text: Totally enjoyed our stay here. Free transfers from airport. The English breakfast was more than sufficient and was very good quality. Was better than most large hotels. The staff here are very happy to help and made our stay so much more enjoyable.

placeInfo/address: 82/5, Cemetery Road Ettukala, Negombo 11500 Sri Lanka
text: Nice modern hotel in an ok location but the staff are underemployed and bored so the service is suffocating. Also, we stayed one night - arriving at 6:00 pm and leaving at 8:30 am next day - and we were asked constantly to make a review on Tripadvisor or booking.com by different people. One employee thought it was a good idea to stand outside our door in the early morning and have a loud cell phone call - clueless. This place is nice but annoying.
title: Nice but annoying

placeInfo/address: 82/5, Cemetery Road Ettukala, Negombo 11500 Sri Lanka
text:
We stayed here the night before we flew home and were delighted with our room and the hotel in general. About a 5 minute walk from the beach to see our last sunset, a clean and modern pool and dining area and great service. We had dinner at the hotel on the rooftop, the food was excellent. Breakfast was also great and our room and bathroom exceeded our expectations, very modern, spotlessly clean and everything you end, safe, tea and coffee, water, robes etc.
We used their shuttle service to get to the airport yesterday, all good. Very good value, we highly recommend.
title: Great hotel and ideal for airport

text: We had a late arrival from Australia via Singapore ( Our first time in Sri Lanka) and the hotel driver John was waiting. No delays and smooth check in. Deluxe room spacious and clean. text: After a long flight, the Belmont Boutique hotel felt therapeutic. The airport pick-up driver was waiting for us at the airport and drove us safely to the hotel in his spacious and clean car. The check-in was seamless. The room was beautifully decorated with paintings and comfortable furniture. The bed felt like a mother's arms. The AC temperature control was ideal. The bathroom was spacious with hot water. The rooftop was beautiful, and the breakfast was impeccable with string hoppers, coconut roti, dal, sambal, and fish curry. The tea, coffee, and fresh fruits elevated the breakfast experience. The restaurant manager and staff were extremely courteous. The hotel is walking distance from the beach where we went for a stroll. Overall, I am glad we picked Belmont to recover from a long journey.
title: Perfect Stay

placeInfo/address: 82/5, Cemetery Road Ettukala, Negombo 11500 Sri Lanka
text: The Belmont Boutique Hotel is a little gem hidden from the hustle and bustle of the CBD of Negombo. It has a quiet location to unwind and is a short distance to walk to the beach and restaurants safely at all hours. The rooms are well appointed and very spacious with good air conditioning. The staff are extremely friendly and helpful at all times and the reception desk is manned 24 hours a day. Breakfast is a sumptuous spread of classical Sri Lankan food and Western. The sparkling pool is always inviting and so is the rooftop terrace restaurant. A huge bonus is the fair pricing structure of the daily room rate. When we left at almost midnight, Michael the manager provided a complimentary light dinner. A singular and amazing plus of this hotel is the free airport shuttle on arrival and on departure , irrespective of the hour of day or night. My wife and I had a comfortable stay here and met the owner, Anton, who told us of an excellent nearby Ayurvedic Spa called the Jasmine Spa and this spa provides free pick up and drop off for this hotel and this is yet another plus when staying here.
title: Very good experience

placeInfo/address: Shanthipuara Road, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
text:
Just had an amazing stay, and I can’t recommend this place enough! The chef (sorry, can’t recall his name, but he was a star!) catered to all our culinary needs with some of the best Sri Lankan cuisine I’ve ever tasted. Breakfast and dinner were highlights—Pal Sambol, Kata Sambol, Fish Curry, Pol Roti, and Stringhoppers were all spot on, bursting with flavor. A quick tip: ask for mid spice or no spice if you’re not used to the heat!

The ground staff were incredible too. Laksman on the left took care of our every need, always ensuring we were comfy—just let him know what you want, and it’s done. I’m the one in the middle, with Sandoor, the manager, to my left—super professional, top-notch customer service, and always with a smile. The last guy on my right, whose name I didn’t catch, also pitched in big time.

The resort itself is marvelous, with a nostalgic vibe that’s hard to beat. Bring a jacket though—it gets chilly at night! And don’t miss the morning hike from behind the property; the view is absolutely breathtaking. Can’t wait to come back!
title: "Unforgettable Stay with Amazing Food and Stellar Service!"

placeInfo/address: Shanthipuara Road, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
text:
Actual rating 3.5

The review sums it up...it's a cute colonial bungalow with a spacious garden...the room is well restored but was rather puzzled with the choice of tacky heat panels....

It's situated within a functioning tea estate though the factory is abandoned. 

There is also a view point, couldn't really find it though with the poor signage, but nevertheless had a nice short hike...

The staff was efficient and experienced. The real downside was the food. Dinner was a set menu. The chicken was so-so and the margarita pizza was burnt... The breakfast (local option chosen) was slightly better, but extremely spicy (even for us locals) and with only a few accompaniments. 

The Google map directions are accurate and road is in good condition upto the bungalow.

The rating is rounded up only because we found the place to be quite picturesque and charming....
title: Cute colonial bungalow

text:
This hotel is on high ground,  I mean,  really high at 1980m. So on a clear night,  the sky is full of stars.  This beautiful estate is tastefully designed, and was very clean,  with no insects. Arosh and Krish took good care of us throughout our stay,  and the kitchen served really delicious breakfast and dinner.  Highly recommend the grill for dinner.  

Would recommend the villa to anyone visiting Nuwara Eliya, it can be a romantic hotel,  place for family or even large groups.
title: Great service, gorgeously beautiful hotel

text:
Had an excellent stay at Aliya resort and for the third time too, the amazing staff made the stay awesome and they made sure to deliver a personalized service. 

Starting off with the receptionist Pabalu, She always had the nicest smile and attitude, welcomed us with a warm smile and showed us around the hotel. Really grateful that we met her 🥰. 

Then the gymnasium staff Kasun, took us on a tour to show us around more places , including Ayurvie where we had the opportunity to take nice photos and enjoy calm surroundings. He made sure to capture the nicest moments which we will cherish forever. He introduced us to the pottery session where we were able to make clay items. This was an experience I missed on previous times I came to Aliya but thanks to Kasun, this time we were able to enjoy a nice poetry session and also the nature room, Pala, yoga area, kumbura and many more. 

Bartender Induwara made us amazing cocktails including one that is not even on the menu but a request. He was super nice to us and delivered an exceptional service.

Hats off to all the staff that made our stay very pleasant and enjoyable. Definitely coming back again🥰
title: Had a wonderful time at Aliya Resort & Spa with my family.

We want to say a huge thank you to all the staff for making our stay so special, but especially want to shout out: Dana, Yaburawa, Ajith, Chanaka, Dasha, Prasa, Induwara, and of course, Kasun. You all made our experience feel personal and unforgettable - we’re so grateful.

text: Cool campus.  Room was clean and spacious.  Tons of stuff to do around the resort.  The restaurant was fantastic.  Huge buffet for breakfast which had a wide variety of things to choose from with new choice every day!  Did not do the dinner buffet but their a la carte menu was solid.  The beef steak was well worth it!  Short distance away from Sigiriya and Dambulla.  Saw elephants on the road a few times going back and forth from those towns!  The billiards table by the bar was nice too.  Chanaka and Thara were our servers and provided great service every time we went to the restaurant.  The bar tender made great drinks too!  I apologize but I forgot to write down his name.  Taller gent with a cool haircut!  Thanks again for everything
title: Best resort for visiting sigiriya and Dambulla.

placeInfo/address: 26/7 Poruthata Road, Negombo 11500 Sri Lanka
text:
Dickman’s was our favorite hotel during our entire two week visit to Sri Lanka. From the moment my two adult daughters and I arrived, we fell in love with the staff and the relaxed, chill vibe. 

Just a block from the beach, it is easy to go down for a swim and enjoy chatting with the many local families on the beach. There are also many good restaurants nearby, and the staff at Dickman’s can help you choose from among them. 

There are also pool area and grounds were just gorgeous. Brightly painted walls, lots of plants and art. A cool oasis on even the hottest days. 

We opted for the Sri Lankan breakfast, which was absolutely delicious with a gorgeous fruit plate, followed by string hoppers, dhal curry and much more. Since we couldn’t come close to eating it all, the staff nicely packed it up and we had it for lunch!

All in all, the staff is what really makes and experience great. And this staff did exactly that. So kind. So helpful. And just plain fun to talk with.
title: Best hotel on our whole trip!

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Mrs. Karen & Mr. Ade,
Thank you so much for your delightful review. We're proud to hear  you had a great time at Dickman Resort and appreciated the relaxed atmosphere our amenities and our team's efforts. It was a pleasure to having you with us, we hope to welcome you again in the future.

placeInfo/address: 26/7 Poruthata Road, Negombo 11500 Sri Lanka
text: Maybe it was the endless sunshine and the cool lion beer, but our experience at Dickman resort was truly wonderful. This resort is a hidden gem (but only a stones throw from the main town);and from the moment we stepped inside we were made to feel more like long lost friends rather than guests. The resort is small and perfectly formed with only 9 rooms it’s amazingly intimate but has all the amenities you need, restaurant (Cookie breakfast was delicious), bar, pool, loungers and chill out areas that include free roaming tortoises, a turtle sanctuary and fish. BUT what truly sets this resort apart from ANYWHERE we’ve stayed and made this into one of the best holidays ( and Birthdays); was fabulous Danu and his amazing team!! The care and genuine way in which they went about making sure we had the best time ever was amazing. Dickman Resort it seems like you’ve found the secret recipe to give your guests a perfect stay. It’s not a 5* corporate sprawling resort, it’s real, it’s genuine ans authentic and an experience like no other… THANK YOU and see you again very soon we hope Karen & Ade
title: Our Delightful Dickman Experience …

placeInfo/address: 26/7 Poruthata Road, Negombo 11500 Sri Lanka
text: This is a wonderful boutique hotel with 6 rooms and 3 suites. We stayed in the Mango suite a large ground floor suite with massive bed and lovely rain shower. The garden and pool are excellent and really comfortable and includes quiet and spacious places to sit in the shade or rain as well as poolside sun. Breakfast is fabulous and served from 8-12 so really laidback. The resort is small and Balinese in design and the thing that makes it so wonderful is the staff and service which I could not fault. We went partly for our 25th Wedding Anniversary and they were so lovely and kind to us on the day as well as for our whole visit. We would go back in a heartbeat.

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guests ,
We found your outstanding review last night and we need to thank you very much you really make all of us  proud and happy with your super B compliments for the staff and the Hotel .

placeInfo/address: 26/7 Poruthata Road, Negombo 11500 Sri Lanka
text:
We booked the first four nights here for our arrival in SL however our flight from Australia was delayed and so we were a day late arriving. This was not a problem though as we were still able to spend four nights with the minor inconvenience of having to change rooms for the last night. It was extremely accommodating of the staff to allow this and it meant we could acclimatise and get organised prior to heading up to Jaffna. We are grateful to Damith, Danu and Harsha for their flexibility!

The resort is located up a quiet street about 300 metres from the frenetic beach road and so quiet however conveniently located to restaurants, cafes, taxi services, etc. Having said this the staff will organise tuk tuks and drivers for you so you can avoid the hassle of negotiating on the Main Street.

We spent the first three nights in the Red suite, which was extremely comfortable and has a fabulous bathroom and balcony overlooking the garden and front entrance so it was very quiet. 

The last night we spent in the Orange room which is on the ground floor and still a good size room with a serviceable bathroom however not as luxurious as the suite. 

The swimming pool is great and my husband managed to swim his daily 1-1.5 kms as it is not busy.

Finally, I would like to mention the delicious food and lovely staff - Damith, Harsha, Danu, Desican, Mahinda, Dilhen and everyone else whose names I have forgotten - sorry! Together you all make this boutique hotel very special and an extremely welcoming experience. Mr Dickman should be very proud.
title: Outstanding Boutique Hotel

placeInfo/address: 26/7 Poruthata Road, Negombo 11500 Sri Lanka
text: This is an oasis of calm and tranquility which we were so grateful to experience after our 12 day tour of Sri Lanka. The hotel is situated down a little lane about 100yards from the hustle and bustle of the main road where you can find lots of cafes, bars and the usual souvenir shops. Our room/suite was very spacious with a magnificent bed with such wonderful pillows that gave us the best sleeps ever. The hotel is decorated and furnished in a quirky style which is charming. There’s also a magnificent pool to dip into when the heat from the sun is just too overwhelming! Staff were extremely friendly and polite and couldn’t do more to make us welcome and cared for. Breakfast is superb with fresh fruit, fruit juice, tea/coffee and a comprehensive choice of cooked dishes.  All in all, we left feeling rested so many thanks to all the staff for rounding off our wonderful holiday in Sri Lanka.
title: A little gem of a find!

But would definitely stay here again. Breakfast was also lovely, with lots of choices.

Fantastisch hotel! We hebben 3 dagen genoten! Personeel is zeer vriendelijk en geïnteresseerd. Het eten is erg lekker zowel het ontbijt als het diner, heerlijk! 
De kamers zijn goed en netjes! Het enige minpuntje vonden wij de matrassen die erg hard zijn..

placeInfo/address: Lane 3, Field View, Baddegama Road, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Nothing not to like...parking easy...try as many dishes as possible
text: I absolutely loved our experience at Asian Jewel.Best food by far we ate in Sri Lanka. There curry is famous & locals come from Colombo just for that!!!That's saying something as a recommendation. We ate both European & Sri Lankan food. Both was wonderful & beautifully presented. Taste was delicious in everything we ate. Staff are friendly & very professional, nothing too much trouble & discreet. Cold beverages were ice cold. Oooh the ambiance in lush tropical gardens with kingfishers & other exotic birds. I highly recommend & it's not expensive. Reasonable prices. Nothing not to enjoy. Ate there several times & booked to go again.
title: Best food by far on our Sri Lanka trip

placeInfo/address: Lane 3, Field View, Baddegama Road, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Staff are so helpful. Easy to walk & catch local bus so it is worth being out in this lovely area near the lake, with a pool & restaurant.
text: Charming secluded little place surrounded by lush gardens with lovely pool area, friendly helpful staff and great food.  Just a short walk/bus to town so definitely worth being out near the lake and the tranquility.   Very comfy rooms with lake outlook & bar fridge.
title: Peaceful escape, a world away from the town

placeInfo/address: Lane 3, Field View, Baddegama Road, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka
text: This was our second stay at Asian Jewel and it was every bit as enjoyable as the first. Our room (Jasmine) had a direct panoramic view of Bird Lake and we saw many different species of birds as well as small animals including chipmunks, water monitors, geckos (and a cobra one one day but soon banished by the staff...). The staff here are wonderful, friendly and welcoming and nothing too much trouble, and the food is excellent with both Sri Lankan and British options. We are vegetarians and they went out of their way to adapt meals pretty much to whatever suits, but the star of the show is the Sri Lankan rice and curry. It is in a peaceful location but only a short and cheap tuk tuk ride - around £1.75 - into the more hectic beach area.We would strongly recommend.
title: Lovely hotel, wonderful staff, excellent food, lots of birds/wildlife

placeInfo/address: Lane 3, Field View, Baddegama Road, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka
text:
The rooms are a little tired and dated, but the whole experience of this hidden gem is fantastic. By far, the best food served in Hikkaduwa..... The only place to experience the Authentic Local Curry!!!! Amazing. Dale and his staff are absolutely great, Overlooks a lovely lake, while only a short tuk tuk away from the main beach area.
This is a must visit, also welcomes guests for lunch or Dinner. you wont be disappointed!
title: A must visit!

placeInfo/address: Lane 3, Field View, Baddegama Road, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Check out the traditional English Sunday Roast....yum yum...
text:
Amazing Hotel...a 2 minute tut tut ride from the main drag...Beautiful swimming pool overlooking a lovely Lagoon...My room was spotless with Amazing views...The Food is Amazing... English @ Sri Lankan food the best we had in Hikkaduwa....Lastly the Manager Dale a English guy and the other staff couldn't do enough for you...We will definitely be coming back next year...
Superb place....
title: A little Gem of a find....

placeInfo/address: Lane 3, Field View, Baddegama Road, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka
text: Although the rooms are a little dated, they are clean and spacious  with a lovely large terrace in a lovely location overlooking a beautiful lake. We really enjoyed the view whilst having our morning coffee and saw various birds and parrots. The rooms are actually above a restaurant and just 7 minutes from town via tuk tuk. So if you are looking for character with a lovely chilled garden pool area look no further! All the staff are so friendly and the food is beyond delicious- as well as having a lovely breakfast here each morning, we enjoyed a fresh tuna salad and their amazing Sri Lankan curry. We enjoyed our stay here!
title: A little jewel indeed@

placeInfo/address: Lane 3, Field View, Baddegama Road, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka
text:
We ate at the restaurant on the last day of our 2 week trip. It wasn’t busy as it was the off season. However, they were really accommodating and stayed open to serve dinner later than they would usually have done.

The food was fantastic - It was undoubtedly the best curry we had in our whole trip. 

Definitely recommend!
title: Definitely recommend

placeInfo/address: Lane 3, Field View, Baddegama Road, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka
text: Probably save our marriage, a little oasis of calm with a good restaurant after the disappointment of Unawatuna with the boom boom music until day light and poor quality food on offer at 95%  of the bars and eating place we tried, just extended our stay before going to to Columbo for a few days and then back to Goa
title: A lovely friendly place to relax around a pool away from the tourist resorts

placeInfo/address: Lane 3, Field View, Baddegama Road, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka
text: First called in this beautiful hotel for a meal with friend's on a recomondation,such a beautiful setting overlooking the river,peace itself,liked it so much we booked three room's for my husband's birthday,room's are beautifully furnished big comfortable beds,big bathrooms and all have stunning view's,Dale the owner made us so welcome and nothing was to much trouble, he arranged a beautiful birthday cake and the food was excellent throughout our stay,lovely pool set in the garden to relax around, couldn't ask for more,,definitely will return,,
title: Fabulous memories

placeInfo/address: Lane 3, Field View, Baddegama Road, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka
text:
We went to Asian Jewel last March and returned again today.
Nothing has changed still the best in Hikkaduwa.
We had a fab sunday lunch and spent the day in and around the pool.
The food was top notch.
The staff were great.
Ended up staying until late evening.
Definitely a recommendation too all.
Dale and the team just make it work.
title: Great Food with a view

placeInfo/address: Lane 3, Field View, Baddegama Road, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Check out the right times to go weather wise
text:
Asian Jewel Boutique Hotel 
Kath and I stayed at the Asian Jewel Boutique Hotel Hikkaduwa from the 28th of December till the 9th of January .
The Hotel is spotless and the grounds are beautifully maintained , the pool is cleaned every  day , there are comfortable sun beds with pads and towels are provided . 
The food is beautiful both a selection of traditional Sri Lankan and western dishes .
The food is freshly cooked by wonderfully confidant and skilled kitchen team . 
You can even have Sunday lunch should you wish we had it it was brilliant 
We had the Jasmine room which was well appointed with a lovely veranda overlooking the lake which is situated next to the hotel .
It was wonderful to see a beautiful  selection of parrots king fishers being our morning visitors 
Dale the owner greeted us on arrival with complimentary drinks the staff could not do enough for you . 
Dale  arranged  a fantastic trip to Ella taking in the local National Park which was wonderful seeing a host of animals in their natural environment Crocodiles Elephants  Water Buffalo Mongoose Hawks , Eagles to mention just a few . 
Dale sorted all transfers for us from airport . 
We had the most amazing New Year at the Riff Hotel well worth a visit for the sunsets 
Dale and his team are fantastic , big thank you to 
Cyril  
VJ

title: You must visit the Asian Jewel  Boutique Hotel

placeInfo/address: Lane 3, Field View, Baddegama Road, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka
text:
I can’t speak highly enough of my stay at this hotel… perfection from start to finish. The staff are truly amazing, they cannot do enough for you. I felt like a VIP! 
The rooms are lovely and cleaned daily, with various towel art waiting for me each day. I couldn’t wait to go check out my room each day and see which towel animals were waiting for me.
The pool and the grounds are just beautiful, I loved the bell next to my sun bed for when I needed service… such a lovely touch.
The food was also amazing here. It was so good that I hardly ate anywhere else on this latest trip to Sri Lanka! Not only do they serve some beautiful and tasty Sri Lankan dishes but if you fancy a Shepherds Pie, a Sunday roast or other British home comforts whilst there you’re in the right place.

The hotel is owned by Dale, a lovely English guy that knows all you need to know about trips, transport and just general advice on the area… He checked in on me everyday to make sure I was ok. I’ve never felt so looked after and I will definitely be returning.

I would highly recommend Asian Jewel Hotel. The attention to detail, the attentive staff, the stunning food and beautiful grounds/views were faultless.

Thank you Dale, you and your amazing staff made my latest trip so special! I’m hooked and I’ll see you in a few months!
title: You’ll feel like a jewel at the Asian Jewel!

placeInfo/address: Lane 3, Field View, Baddegama Road, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka
text: We went for dinner in the restaurant and it was the nicest food that we had during our time in Sri Lanka. Amazing curries and all freshly made. The restaurant waiter, Mr. Pereira was extremely pleasant and friendly. Couldn’t recommend this place highly enough.
title: Best food in Sri Lanka!

placeInfo/address: Lane 3, Field View, Baddegama Road, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka
text:
My Fiancé and I stayed here for 10 nights and absolutely loved this hotel. 

The grounds and pool are just beautiful and the garden staff work really hard at keeping it immaculate.

The waitors couldn't do enough for us & were always super polite and attentive. We even had a bell next to our sunbed to call for service, which was a really nice touch.

The rooms were cleaned daily. We had fresh bed linen and incredible towel art arrangements waiting for our return. 

The food was by far the best that we'd had in Hikkaduwa and we had tried many restaurants. The menu is varied from beautiful Sri Lankan dishes to exceptional English classics. We even had a full Sunday roast and it was superb.

The hotel is owned by a lovely English guy and he was always on hand if we needed anything, advise, trips, transport etc and made sure we weren't overcharged. He checked in on us everyday to see if we were ok and had everything we needed. We felt really looked after and we will be returning.

I would highly recommend Asian Jewel Hotel. The attention to detail, the attentive staff, the stunning food and beautiful grounds/views were faultless.

Thank you Dale, you and your amazing staff made our holiday very special. See you in February, Nat & Lee x
title: Beautiful hotel, attentive staff & stunning views!

placeInfo/address: Lane 3, Field View, Baddegama Road, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka
text:
Have visited here a few times for food, over December and march. Staff are a real credit to the Asian jewel. 
Food is fabulous especially the curry sharer. All reasonably priced. Good cocktails. Definitely worth a visit
title: Great place

placeInfo/address: Lane 3, Field View, Baddegama Road, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka
roomTip:
Do yourself a favour and go up the day before so you can have a look at the menu,
If there is something you fancy thats not on menu, the team will do their best to make it happen
text:
Just got back home to UK after 10 days at Asian Jewel.
Its run by Dale who is from UK and does a great job of making you feel at home.
The staff are great and always happy to help  with a smile to go with it.
The pool is fab and so is the well maintained gardens.
The view over the lagoon is great and there is many different birds and other animals to keep you busy all day.
We asked Dale if he knew where to get dressed crab? and he said, he could sort it out for us, a couple of days later we had the best meal of the holiday at Asain Jewel, dressed crab, chips and salad, and some lovely Jumbo prawns.
Highly recommend, the sunday roast was fab also.
Back next year for some more, good luck to you all at Asain Jewel a well deserved 5 star rating.
title: Great food, great Team and great views.

text:
Starting from the special welcome you receive on arrival with local dance and music till the time this hotel bids you farewell with a small ceremony, you are in for a luxury treat. 
The rooms are spacious, luxurious and beautifully designed. You get a menu for pillows, soaps, and bath crystals (no extra charges). The beds are huge and very comfortable. Cleanliness is top notch.
We opted for half board option and never regretted it. 
The breakfast and dinner buffet had extensive variety of everything and all the food was delectable. 
Hotel is right next to the beach, and you have two pool options with amazing views.
The staff is very hospitable and always available for any service.
My family had a great time at Anantara.
Thanks to the whole hotel staff for making our trip so memorable.
title: A memorable experience in the best possible way!!

roomTip: One of the best hotel for dayout
text: We went for a lunch buffet at the 'Anantara' in Kalutara, Sri Lanka last Saturday. It is a unique five-star hotel with stunning views of the sea and lagoon next to the hotel. With the beautiful design of the famous architect Geoffrey Bawa, 'Anantara' makes its guests feel incredibly comfortable. The artistic sculptures and paintings placed there bring an artistic ambience. Its staff, especially Dilmi Nilupa, provided the highest level of hospitality to its guests and served delicious drinks and food to its guests with the highest satisfaction. A long swimming pool is suitable for swimming but the poorly equipped changing area brings inconvenience. It is worth your expense for a 'day' at the hotel. Thank you to the staff, especially Dilmi and the management.
title: ANANTARA a unique hotel

Dear Valued Guest,

Thank you for sharing your wonderful experience with us at Anantara Kalutara Resort. 
We are absolutely delighted to know that your four-night escape was filled with memorable moments—from the traditional welcome dance to the private villa comforts and thoughtful touches throughout your stay.  It’s wonderful to hear that you enjoyed the tranquility of our unique riverside and beachfront setting, as well as the wellness experiences like sundown yoga and the couples massage. 

Thank you once again for choosing to stay with us and for your kind appreciation of Sri Lanka as a destination. We sincerely hope to have the pleasure of welcoming you back for an even longer and more enriching stay in the future.

Anantara Kalutara Resort
placeInfo/address: St. Sebastian's Road, Kalutara 12000 Sri Lanka
text:
Anantara Kalutara Resort

Kalutara

Villa stay

1012966745

We spent 4 nights at Anantara Kalutara Resort in a villa with a private pool and had an absolutely amazing time! Throughout our stay we were welcomed and taken care of!  At the main entrance four lovely ladies performed a traditional dance, which made for such a warm and memorable first impression.

Our villa had a fresh fruit basket waiting for us, filled with the most delicious tropical fruits, the mini bar was stocked with refreshments and we had a tea and coffee station. The resort itself is stunning, with the river on one side and the beach with its wild waves on the other, such a unique and beautiful setting.

The resort offers a lot of activities , but we especially loved the sundown yoga and a wonderfully relaxing couples massage. The weather was pleasant the entire stay, with just a brief tropical shower that cleared up quickly and only added to the experience.

The attention to detail and the service were truly outstanding. Every staff member we interacted with was friendly, welcoming, and incredibly helpful. A special thank you to Ishara Disanayaka, Assistant Guest Relations Manager, and Lashan Liyanage, Front Office Manager. Both Ishara and Lashan, in particular, went above and beyond to make sure we were comfortable and enjoying every moment.

Even on the day of our early departure, the team kindly packed us a breakfast to go, such a thoughtful touch!

Our only regret? That we couldn’t stay longer. Sri Lanka we loved visiting your beautiful country.
title: Villa stay

We had a great time at Anantara Kalutara Resort. From the moment we arrived, the staff were very friendly and welcoming. They always smiled and helped us with anything we needed. Their kindness made our stay even better.

The hotel is beautiful and peaceful. Our room was big, clean, and very comfortable. We loved the view from the balcony. The whole place feels calm and relaxing.

We also enjoyed the swimming pool, beach, and the spa. It’s the perfect place to relax and enjoy nature.

placeInfo/address: Kotikambokka 91200 Sri Lanka
roomTip:
Stay more than 1 night!
Cycle to the waterfall is challenging but rewarding
text:
We had a fabulous time at Jetwing Kaduruketha, the hotel is absolutely stunning and so peaceful. We only stayed 1 night, wish it was longer!
Breakfast was plentiful and made to order, dinner was also exceptional - the curry and rice came with lots of additional dishes that were so tasty. 
Special shoutout to Faizal, he was so friendly and engaging, asking us questions and sharing some interesting facts about Sri Lanka. He made our time at the restaurant enjoyable and he has a lovely warm nature. 
All the staff we encountered were really friendly, and our butler Tharushi was always there to help with anything. 
A fabulous stop following Yala before we headed inland. 
Highly recommend!
title: Fantastic stay at a relaxing and peaceful hotel

placeInfo/address: Kotikambokka 91200 Sri Lanka
text: What a fantastic place to stay. The staff are delightful and so helpful. The food is delicious and the rooms lovely. Such lovely surroundings and would have stayed longer but couldn’t do so this time. Highly recommend. Thank you
title: Absolutely beautiful and tranquil place to stay.

placeInfo/address: Kotikambokka 91200 Sri Lanka
text:
If you're looking to unwind in nature and enjoy a peaceful, eco-friendly getaway, this hotel is a gem. With its agro-eco concept, it truly impressed me as a sustainability professional. They offer three types of villas so you can pick what suits you best. The team is incredibly warm and welcoming — special shoutout to our butler, Lishali, who went above and beyond to make sure we were comfortable throughout our stay.

Some of the highlights from our time there:
1. Cycling 
2. Strolling across paddy fields and climbing a traditional treehouse (පැල) 
3. A refreshing dip in Kirindi Oya  
4. Watching the sunset from the grassy field  
5. Pool time with a stunning view  
6. Quiet moments on the villa corridor soaking in the scenery  
7. And the open-air bathroom unique and freeing experience! &
8. Bird watching with Naturalist

Truly a place to recharge. Highly recommend it.
title: Exellent

placeInfo/address: Kotikambokka 91200 Sri Lanka
roomTip:
Few Tips!
* Stay for at least few days to enjoy and relax more
* Try the Ambula Lunch at the hut in the middle of the paddy field.
text:
Pictures or YouTube clips does not do the justice for this place. Its far more than what you see on camera. You have to be there in person to explore and enjoy the amazing vista of this property. I was treated like a king!!! Amazing guest services from the reception, management and restaurant. The entire staff was very well trained, courteous and displays the srilankan hospitality at its best. 
Very humble management (Nadun and Ishan), they took their time to come to me in person few times to check up on me. Restaurant staff was very nice too. Restaurant manager and Dikli who was my personal butler gave an amazing service. I was relaxed and enjoyed at its best. Don't to take a dip in Kuda Oya. Special thanks to Kalum (Pool Boy) who guided me to river and help to spot a nice location to have a nice dip! Amazing experience!

Also a special thanks to the Geeshani from the reservations team as well with the inquiries that i had with the property. 

Thank you again!
title: WOW!!!!! Amazing Location, Property and Service!

placeInfo/address: Kotikambokka 91200 Sri Lanka
text:
One of the best experiences we had... Although we booked Jetwing Kanduruketha, we were a little apprehensive initially, as the rooms were not airconditioned and since buffet was not available... However, our worries soon disappeared as we entered through the hotel gate. The hotel is build in a 50 acre land plot and is completely surrounded by trees, paddy fields, and farm lands...Rooms are basically separate Cabanas. Personal Bicycles were available next to all rooms, which we could use if required. Our room was right next to the paddy field, which was lovely... It was sooo peaceful, and quite. 
Although there was no AC in the room, it was quite cool, and there was no need for one...Although there was no buffet, the staff was willing to honour our special meal requests, even when it was not on the menu...Food was exquisite in presentation and taste. The hotel arranged a personal butler, who took us on a guided tour of the area.. 
Everyone was smiling, courteous, and helpful. 
We accidently left one of our phones in the room and noticed it half way to Colombo. When we called looking for it, the reception immediately confirmed that they  found it and was willing to courier it back to my home.. We were amazed that we got it back in Colombo in just 2 days...This shows the integrity of the staff and the genuine care for the guests...
It simply was one of the most relaxing experiences...
Thank you everyone at Jetwing Kanduruketha for making our stay a memorable one...
title: One of the most relaxing experiences...

placeInfo/address: Kotikambokka 91200 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Wonderful hotel and I truly recommend anyone
text: We had a wonderful stay at Jetwing Kaduruketha few days ago.Its a hidden gem in Wallawaya and as soon as we entered the hotel we were welcome with great hospitality by their friendly staff.Rooms are spacious and beautiful facing paddy fields surrounded by beautiful mountains.Rooms are well equipped and we didn't require AC as the rooms are so airy and cold.Food was great and they took an extra effort to prepare food for our son on our request.We were given a butler and he guided us for site seeing and we had a lovely experience at Kirindi oya which flows close to the hotel.It was a great stay and me and my family had a unforgettable wonderful experience in hotel.I would like to express my sincere gratitude to staff at Jetwing Kaduruketha for honesty and excellent service they provided when we accidentally left our son's mobile phone in the room and once we informed them they promptly located it and arranged to return to us to Colombo promptly.I truly appreciate their effort, communication, attention to detail and professionalism which reflects the higher standards of hospitality and for going above and beyond.Thank you once again Jetwing Kaduruketha staff
title: Wonderful experience.... great place and great staff

placeInfo/address: Kotikambokka 91200 Sri Lanka
text:
We had an unforgettable stay at Jetwing Kaduruketha! Every moment was truly special, and the entire experience exceeded our expectations. The setting was beautiful, peaceful, and perfect for a relaxing getaway.
A special thank you to Ayesha, our butler, who was incredibly helpful and attentive from the beginning to the end of our stay. Her warm hospitality made us feel right at home.not only ayesha the entire staff was very helpful through our stay.

placeInfo/address: Kotikambokka 91200 Sri Lanka
text:
Jetwing Kadhuruketha was another amazing place to have a relaxing vacation by Jetwing hotels. Staff were very kind and friendly and the food was amazing. It’s a location with mostly a women staff. It am happy to see managements attempt to provide the opportunity to the young girls in the area. 
While the stay was amazing, the place is lacking accessibility features. For someone with difficulty with walking, getting around was not easy. Perhaps they should consider putting some ramps to get around the place. Having said that the staff did everything within their capacity to help my mother to move around.
title: Peace and quiet!

placeInfo/address: Kotikambokka 91200 Sri Lanka
text:
Stayed for three nights '' Jetwing Kaduruketha '' what a stay. We really enjoyed every moment of our holiday. Food was impeccable, the property it self is an amazing place which feels like heaven. Rooms definitely needs an overhaul but that did not impact our holiday. Specially the trip to '' Ellawala waterfall'' a must visit too, very professional tuk tuk guide '' Tharindu" was provided by the hotel. Also I would love to take this opportunity to thank Faizal, Thiloka, Chef Dhamitha and the two girls from reception whome made our stay more fruitful. Lady from the spa, gave us an amazing spa experience and highly recommended to not be missed. 

Thank you to all at Kaduruketha for making our holiday a special and a memorable one.
title: What a stay!!!

placeInfo/address: Kotikambokka 91200 Sri Lanka
text:
We had a fantastic experience at this resort, which is beautifully nestled amidst wildlife and paddy fields. The natural surroundings were stunning, with plenty of animals to spot — including graceful peacocks. There were lots of activities to enjoy, such as cycling, nature walks, and a fantastic swimming pool.

Only one negative is that it has no A/C as it is an Eco-friendly resort, but it’s manageable.

The food (Full Board) was absolutely delicious with generous portions, offering a great variety of flavours that kept every meal exciting.

The highlight of our stay was the exceptional customer service. Every staff member was warm and welcoming. A special thank you to Lishali, our butler, who went above and beyond to make our stay special. She was always smiling, attentive, and incredibly helpful — truly outstanding service!

Highly recommended for anyone looking to relax in nature with great food and exceptional hospitality.
title: Great location and customer service

placeInfo/address: Kotikambokka 91200 Sri Lanka
text:
We had the most wonderful family stay at Jetwing Kaduruketha and couldn’t recommend it more highly. From the moment we arrived, we were welcomed with genuine warmth and hospitality from the Jetwing Team. The serene surroundings, lush greenery, and scenic paddy fields created a peaceful atmosphere that immediately made us feel relaxed and at home.

The eco-luxury dwellings were both spacious and beautifully designed, blending comfort with nature. Dilani and all the staff including Nadhun the General Manager, Saduni, Maheshika, Faizal and Maduwanthi were incredibly kind and attentive, always ready with a smile and eager to help in any way. Special mention to Subath and the culinary team – every meal was a delight, with fresh local ingredients and both traditional Sri Lankan and western meal options.

What made our stay even more special was getting to take part in the traditional Sinhala New Year games organized by the hotel. It was a wonderful cultural experience that the whole family enjoyed – from tug-of-war to musical chairs and other fun local traditions and treats. It was heartwarming to see guests and staff celebrating together. We also enjoyed the guided nature walk in the morning viewing many birds with the naturalist.

Jetwing Kaduruketha is more than a hotel – it’s an experience of Sri Lanka’s natural beauty and warm culture, made even better by a team that truly cares. Our family left with lifelong memories - feeling recharged, connected, and already planning our return.
title: A Perfect Family Getaway Amidst Nature’s Beauty

placeInfo/address: Kotikambokka 91200 Sri Lanka
text:
We only stayed a night at Jetwing Kaduruketha, but I truly wish we had more time there. The place is so calm and peaceful, surrounded by nature with lovely village vibes. The food was great, and the service was amazing. Special thanks to Pasindu, our room boy — so humble and helpful.

The view was beautiful with so many birds around, especially peacocks. Waking up to a peacock in our backyard was such a special moment. Would love to visit again for a longer stay!
title: A Peaceful Escape in Nature!

placeInfo/address: Kotikambokka 91200 Sri Lanka
text:
Jetwing Kaduruketha – what a hidden gem in Wellawaya! I have never received such personalized hospitality as I did there.

The food was delicious! The bakery items were so fresh and incredibly good!
One of the main highlights was the friendly staff. Our butler, Ayesha, and the restaurant manager, Sanduni, were so welcoming and helpful, always catering to our needs. They even have a lovely little ritual for sending guests off — such a nice touch!

I loved the peaceful atmosphere and would definitely go there again.

placeInfo/address: Kotikambokka 91200 Sri Lanka
roomTip: No aircon, be ready for outside bathroom.  Book this place if you love the idea of eco and being amongst a working organic farm.  Its remote
text: Beautiful hotel.  Booked the rice paddy (organic farm) villa.  Its beautiful, though you have to remember that you are in the middle of a very humid location -- so things feel a little damp.  It s the reason you book it...course. There is no aircon (eco) and the fans are enough even in the 33 degree heat, however, while its lovely to hear the critters, birds and so on all night, you kind of dream of AC from time to time.  Did not have an issue with mosquitos though we did use the net in case.  Rooms come with umbrellas and torches too.   For coffee lovers, there is a Keurig..a welcome relief for my partner. Bathroom is outdoor concept, probably the only place I thought they could have done a better job cleaning out and it felt as though the toilet was leaking.  This could very well be 5 star, but that would also double the price!   Restaurant setting is lovely, you are taking care of by a "butler" and the food is organic, tasty and interesting.  As usual, the wine is not great (Sri Lanka).  The pool was lovely, while swimming we saw a couple of peacocks and a monitor lizard, hornbills, yellow orioles and kingfishers.   Note it is a working farm...
title: Villa among the rice paddy fields

placeInfo/address: Kotikambokka 91200 Sri Lanka
text:
Location: The first thing to note is that it's a huge property (50 acres) situated in a lovely location, surrounded by lush paddy fields, Poonagala mountain as the backdrop and "kirindi oya" river running along one side of the property.....in terms of location it could not get any more perfect than this....

Rooms: The room is more like a villa. There are two types to choose from. Forest dwellings are situated in a wooded area near the river and gives a slight jungle vibe. Paddy field dwellings gives a more airy and sunny vibe. On our first visit couple of years back, we opted for the forest dwelling and also had a bit of a hilarious peacock encounter. Loved it's semi open washroom. This time, the place was fully booked and only the paddy field dwellings were available. It was also pouring (unusual for that time of the year) and we loved the airy vibe of the room. While I am a big fan of open showers, the fully covered washroom (it was part of the room and only semi partitioned off) was more convenient with the rain. 

I cannot recall whether there was an Ac in the room since the weather was quite cool anyway but there was definitely no TV. While we are not the type to stay in hotel rooms watching TV, the heavy rains left us with nothing much to do. So we opted for a session at the spa which turned out to be a lovely experience. But there was only one lady at the spa, so we had to take turns and wait in the library.... The spa, the library along with the reception are housed in what used to be an old "Walauuwa" (a term used decribe a mansion). The library had a TV but it's collection of book could use some new additions.

There is a pool right next to the restaurant. When the place is fully booked, the pool area can get a bit crowded and noisy. 

They may offer some activities but we've stayed only for one day each time and never ask. There were bikes parked at other villas but not at ours. Again didn't really bother since it was raining anyway.

The majority of staff are young and from the vicinity with a sprinkling of more seasoned staff. We went on the day of the traditional new year and the younger ones did look a bit overwhelmed having just finished Avurudu festivities in addition to maintaining a full house. But they did get back to their sunny smiling versions by the evening. Special mention must be made of the property manager who made a point to personally welcome each guest even in the caos of many check ins and check outs and who also personally manged the check in process which didn't even take 10 mts. There was also a senior server at the restaurant (unfortunately i cant recall his name) who kept constantly checking on our needs and made sure the service was perfect. 

Jetwing properties always offer a massive breakfast spread and Kaduruketha was no exception (Its not a buffet but like a 6 -7 course meal). Throughly enjoyed the breakfast. (It has become something to look forward to on our visits to Jetwing properties.) Lunch and dinner (four course set menu) were beautifully presented. Portions were large. Loved some items, others not so much. But all in all quite enjoyable. 

The Google map directions are accurate. There are two routes, one from Ella side, other from Moneragala side. Both in good condition. 5 minutes to Wellawaya town and from there you can easily get to Yala, Arugambay, Ella, Udawalawe and roads are in excellent condition for the most part.
title: Idyllic village vibes...

placeInfo/address: Wella Devala Road, Yaddehimulla, Unawatuna 80600 Sri Lanka
text:
Были в этом отеле впервые. Удобное расположение, недалеко от пляжа , но вдали от шумной улицы. Великолепный дизайн , номера очень просторные и уютные с современной мебелью и качественными матрасами, виды с балкона номера потрясающие!
На территории есть 2 великолепных бассейна.

Персонал отеля – просто находка! Они лучшие!  всегда готовы помочь с любыми вопросами, горничные поддерживают идеальную чистоту, а на ресепшене говорят на нескольких языках. Особенно впечатлило, как быстро они реагируют на любые просьбы.

Ресторан, расположенный в отеле, поражает своей изысканностью с первого взгляда. Уютный интерьер  создаёт идеальную атмосферу для  ужина . А веранда - просто идеальное место для вечернего отдыха в отеле.

Шеф-повар творит настоящие кулинарные чудеса! Особенно впечатляют блюда из морепродуктов — свежайшие и очень вкусно приготовлены. Заказывали часто креветки, блюда из тунца, белой рыбы  — это было просто божественно!
Это именно тот отель, где хочется остановиться снова. Рекомендую этот отель всем, кто ценит комфорт и качественный сервис.
Если планируете приехать в высокий сезон, рекомендую бронировать номер заранее – отель пользуется большой популярностью.
title: Идеальный отдых в превосходном отеле на берегу океана

roomTip: Переходник для розетки берите с собой. Номер лучше местный купить, чтобы такси/туктук вызывать, так намного дешевле
text:
Мы с дочками отдыхали в этом отеле 10 дней в марте. Отлично! Я б снова вернулась) Современный, ухоженный уютный отельчик, локация красивая, народу не много, не толпятся. Завтрак разнообразный. До моря пройтись по джунглям минут 7, и что классно - оживленная улица прямо в 2-3 минутах от отеля, а сам отель в очень тихой зоне! Персонал реагирует на просьбы, помогает при необходимости. Понятно, что не все идеально, но главное в том, что на все твои простые реагируют и идут навстречу. 

В номере убирался юный парень Dilshan, спасибо ему за чистый номер и настроение! Уже знал, что и как нам больше нравится по быту, старался сразу учитывать) ну а где не замечал, по первой просьбе все в лучшем виде) Ты нам создал очень классное уютное ощущение, пока мы там отдыхали! Спасибо за твое внимание)

Ресепшн отзывчивый, на связи всегда. Отдельное огромное спасибо от всей души юной девушке с кудрявыми волосами, я к сожалению забыла имя!(( Может потом найду и дополню отзыв! Она и на завтраках внимательна к нам была, и с местной связью сколько мы разбирались - имей ей удалось решить проблему 🙏🏼 

Обязательно берите переходник для розетки с собой! В отеле были парочка, но очень страшные, искрили, других не было. Не помню тип розетки, можно загуглить
title: По кайфу)

placeInfo/address: Avudangawa 21120 Sri Lanka
text:
Aliya Resort and Spa – A True Gem in Sigiriya!

Our stay at Aliya Resort and Spa was simply unforgettable! From the moment we arrived, we were welcomed with warm smiles and a peaceful, nature-rich setting that instantly relaxed us.

Location: Nestled amidst lush greenery with breathtaking views of Sigiriya Rock, the location is perfect for both relaxation and sightseeing. It's serene yet close enough to major cultural attractions.

Rooms: Spacious, clean, and beautifully designed with a mix of traditional charm and modern luxury. The open-concept bathrooms and comfortable bedding made our stay extra enjoyable.

Atmosphere: The whole resort gives off a calm and elegant vibe. Whether you’re by the pool, in the restaurant, or walking through the gardens, the atmosphere promotes pure tranquility.

Value: For the quality of service, food, and facilities offered, the resort is excellent value for money. It's a luxurious escape that’s worth every rupee.

Service: A special mention goes to Ishan, whose dedication and friendly nature truly stood out. He ensured we felt at home and went above and beyond to meet our needs. The entire staff was attentive and professional.

Cleanliness: The property is impeccably maintained. Rooms, pool areas, and restaurants were spotless, adding to the resort’s overall comfort.

Amenities: The infinity pool overlooking Sigiriya is a highlight! 

Highly recommended for couples, families, or anyone looking to unwind in luxury with a touch of Sri Lankan hospitality. We can't wait to return.
title: We had an unforgettable stay at Aliya Resort and Spa

My sister and I were super excited to stay in one of the greatest hotel and they absolutely went beyond our expectations!!!

We had Ayurveda treatment, did some sports activities like badminton and table tennis, did yoga in the sacred rain (it was so stormy but even that was a magical experience!), and all the food we had here was amazing!

We must thank ISHAN for everything he offered us during our stay. He arranged all the wonderful experiences for us and made sure we enjoyed every moment in Aliya spa & resort.
His efficient support and heartwarming hospitality was everything we could wish for!
ISHAN was the BEST!
title: Exceptional stay with wonderful staffs!

text: On en prend plein la vue des notre arrivée, en montant les marches de l'hôtel et quand on arrive à l'accueil, on se retrouve face à la piscine à débordement avec une vue magnifique sur le rocher du lion ❤️. Le personnel est aux petits soins et la restauration rien à dire, du choix et de la qualité... et au bar les consommations sont a des prix tres raisonnable, c'est vraiment le top cet hotel, si je retourne dans ce magnifique pays nul doute que je retournerai à l'hôtel Aliya. placeInfo/address: Avudangawa 21120 Sri Lanka
text:
This hotel is set in a peaceful natural area that’s perfect if you’re looking to relax and take a break. It’s not the kind of place with dramatic views or luxury features, but the surroundings are quiet and refreshing—trees, open sky, and the kind of calm that makes you slow down without trying. It’s a good choice if you want a simple, relaxing stay away from the noise.

The rooms are clean, comfortable, and have all the basics you need. Nothing too fancy, but everything works well and feels thoughtfully put together. There’s a sense that the place is cared for, both inside and out.

What really stands out is the staff. Everyone we met was friendly, down-to-earth, and helpful without being overbearing. Whether you needed directions, tips on where to go nearby, or just a quick chat, they were always ready with a smile. It felt more like being welcomed by hosts than just checking into a hotel.

Overall, this is a great spot if you want somewhere simple, peaceful, and well-run. The setting is gentle and natural, and the people make it even better. Would definitely return for a quiet weekend away.
title: A calm, pleasant spot with great staff

Tranquil setting amongst the highest elevation tea estate in Nuwara Eliya, with an old world colonial luxury vibe. Oliphant house exceeded our expectation, it was the highlight of our entire trip in Sri Lanka, when compared to our stays at other hotels at similar price points. The entire team at Oliphant house were the perfect hosts, with great service and attention to detail. Food was delicious, and do try the Sri Lankan cuisine. Thank you to the chefs! 
It was refreshing not to be amongst the hordes of tourists. So if you are looking for a personalised service experience and attention;  and truly relax, this is the place. 
Our room was tasteful furnished, with a large four poster bed, huge bathroom, and a couch. Very clean and spacious. 
Highly recommend to go for a walk and explore the surrounding tea estate as well as meeting the locals. 
We would go back to Sri Lanka, just to go back to Oliphant House.
title: Magical experience, didn’t want to leave

placeInfo/address: Shanthipuara Road, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
text:
The staff were lovely and attentive. The decor was beautiful inside the house.The rooms were very tastefully decorated and comfortable. We felt that there was room for improvement on the outside, that the garden could be improved and the way that the property has been photographed gives a different impression to the reality. Very cleverly photographed. The house is surrounded by a lot of houses that you can't see from the pictures, it isn't set on its own as you are led to believe. 

Our room didn't have a view or access to the outside, which was a shame as we had bad weather and had to stay inside quite a bit of the time, so looking out would have been nice. We had to move the tv out of the way of the window to be able to look outside when sitting on the couch. 
Overall a nice experience, but not one we will remember as outstanding. 

There are some lovely walks to do from the property through the tea plantations, even walking from the house to Nuwara Eliya.
title: Good hotel

text: Helaas regende het flink toen we aankwamen. De temperatuur was daardoor ook flink omlaag gegaan. We bleken de enige gasten. Bij het diner werd de haard aangestoken en op de kamer, maar ook in de eetkamer waren verwarmingskosten die de ruimtes een aangename temperatuur gaven. Een ruime en mooi ingerichte kamer (in totaliteit 7 of 8) en een fraaie badkamer voorzien van alle comfort. Het avondeten en het diner waren heerlijk. Ook voor een bezette kamer is de kok gewoon aanwezig. En je kon ook wijn en bier bestellen. Een mooie tuin om het huis completeerde het geheel. En het meest opvallend waren de medewerkers. Altijd in voor een praatje en ook geïnteresseerd. Kortom, we hadden er een geweldige tijd.

text:
Belmont Boutique 
We had a short overnight stopover in Negombo here, the staff were very helpful and polite. 

This lovely boutique hotel is set back off the main street so nice and quiet. The room was clean, bright, modern and comfortable, good AC & fan. 
The breakfast was also good and having a courtesy car to take us to the airport was much appreciated. 

A short walk to the beach, local restaurants, & found good coffee closeby as well.
There was a pool and rooftop bar area that would be good if we were staying longer. 
Great value and a good stay..

Our team strives to provide exceptional service, and we're glad that the complimentary airport drop-off and our 'can do' attitude made your stay memorable.

Your kind words are a testament to the hard work and dedication of our staff, and we're truly grateful for your recognition. We look forward to welcoming you back to the Belmont Hotel on your next visit to Sri Lanka, ensuring it remains your preferred place to stay.

Thank you once again for choosing us and for your highly commendable feedback. Until next time, we wish you safe travels and wonderful adventures ahead.

Warm regards,
placeInfo/address: 82/5, Cemetery Road Ettukala, Negombo 11500 Sri Lanka
text:
This is a hidden gem. It seems situated in an odd spot but it really is not - fantastic safe location that is close to everything you need. Not that you need to go out for much at all as the staff, food, drinks, pool, rooftop view and well appointed room make it a very hard placd to leave.
The complimentary drop off to airport and ‘can do’ attitude throughout our stay was first class. When we next visit Sri Lanka, this will be our first and then last place to stay. 
Can not speak highly enough of our stay here.
title: Fantastic way to start and finish beautiful Sri Lanka

text: From the moment we arrived on the property I was thoroughly impressed with the service and treatment that was received at the Belmont.  The staff was friendly, welcoming and completely accommodating at all times. I got to know some of them very well and they are truly good people.  The location, views and weather were amazing.  The dining is first rate and eclectic. The room was flawless , comfortable, with amazing beds and pillows: I didn’t want to get out of bed in the morning but I knew that paradise awaited.  I just felt so relaxed, starting the morning with healthy breakfast and then a swim in the pool which was spotless and impressive and never crowded.  Then afternoon at the beach. If it didn’t take a full 24 hours to get there, my husband and I would definitely return every year!!!
title: Perfection in Paradise

ownerResponse/text:
Dear valued guest,

We sincerely appreciate your extensive feedback on your recent stay at Belmont Boutique Hotel. It brings us immense joy to hear that your experience, from the moment of check-in until departure, was nothing short of incredible. We understand the weariness that comes with a long flight, and we are delighted that our smooth check-in process helped you transition seamlessly into relaxation mode.

It is particularly heartening to receive compliments from someone with over twenty years of experience in luxury hotels in NYC. Your acknowledgment of our staff's dedication to exceeding expectations is truly gratifying. At Belmont Boutique Hotel, we strive to go above and beyond standard operating procedures to create a memorable and exceptional experience for our guests.

We are pleased to hear that you found our rooms to be subtly minimal, aligning with your preferences. Our housekeeping team takes pride in ensuring the utmost cleanliness and comfort for our guests, and we are thrilled to learn that their efforts were appreciated during your stay.

Your positive remarks about our rooftop bar and food service are truly appreciated. We extend your compliments to our chef and the entire food service team for their attentiveness, efficiency, and the constant warmth they bring to their service.

The combination of our pool and convenient access to the beach aims to provide a diverse and enjoyable experience for our guests, and we are glad to hear that you found them excellent. The fact that you didn't want to leave after 5 days of vacation is the highest compliment we could receive.

Thank you for highly recommending Belmont Boutique Hotel as a place in paradise. We look forward to welcoming you back in the future, and we hope your return to NYC and work is smooth until the next time you seek a well-deserved retreat with us.

placeInfo/address: 82/5, Cemetery Road Ettukala, Negombo 11500 Sri Lanka
text:
A hidden gem in paradise… Incredible from the moment of check-in until departure. I didn’t want to leave!!

After a never ending flight and travel to the hotel one can only hope for a smooth check -in to get into the room and fast as possible!

We were picked up from the airport (complimentary) and driven a short distance to the hotel and were greeted with smiles and efficiency. 

I’ve worked in luxury hotels in NYC for over twenty years and I am familiar with the standard operating procedures that are required to get star rating and I have to say that the staff went above and beyond meeting and anticipating expectations.

The rooms were subtle and minimal which i love and housekeeping was superb!!! The rooftop bar and food were excellent and I want to compliment the chef and everyone in food service. They are attentive, efficient and always smiling. 

The pool and close access to the beach were excellent and after 5 days of being on vacation I can’t wait to return to NYC and get back to work but I really did not want to leave.

Highly recommend this place in paradise!!!
title: Hidden Gem in Paradise

roomTip: The sea is quite rough and has under currents but there are warning signs up to alert you to this.
text:
This was a relaxing final few nights to our trip to Sri Lanka and it didn't disappoint.
Despite being situated on a busy road all we could hear was the crashing of the waves on the beach.
The reception area and restaurant are open sided so you are both in and outdoors.
We were allocated a suite with a balcony and it was very spacious. All rooms overlook the pool and beach.
The staff were extremely welcoming and friendly. The guy who looked after the pool area was very attentive, bringing us extra towels to support our necks whilst on the sunbeds and fresh water. 
The food was all freshly prepared and the portions were generous.
There is a gate out onto the fantastic beach.
We had an early start for a flight home and we were provided with a substantial pack-up breakfast.
The location is good for a visit to the town of Galle Fort, steeped in history. 
We also visited a turtle sanctuary where they look after injured turtles as well as hatching and releasing babies. The visit cost 2,000 LKR pp. 
We also took a boat safari on nearby Koggala Lake and visited cinnamon island.
title: A relaxing end to our fantastic holiday in Sri Lanka

text:
This hotel 20 minutes south of Galle, KK Beach is a small, boutique property located on the beachfront. The rooms are thoughtfully designed and beautifully finished, each with a private
terrace and ensuite bathroom. They all have complimentary WiFi and luxurious touches such as robes,
slippers, a mini-bar and Bose sound system.
The pool and sunlounger area, beautiful and relaxing. 
Super helpful and friendly staff.  Food from the restaurant very good. 
It’s a great spot to explore the south coast and Galle. It has direct access to a beautiful quiet beach. Would recommend.
title: Great Boutique Hotel

placeInfo/address: Matara Road, Habaraduwa 80630 Sri Lanka
text: What an absolutely lovely hotel. Its location is lovely and quiet as it’s a little outside any of the main beach resort towns. The hotel is right on the beach front so from the immaculately layed out pool area you can sea and hear the sea. The pool area is so nice with very comfortable and plentiful sunbeds and bean bags and the pool area attendant works tirelessly in making sure you are in a nice location and you are drinking plenty of cold water. The beach is stunning with beautiful sand and a huge expanse of beach to walk up and down. The sea current can be very strong so do ask the pool attendant where it’s best to swim. The rooms are really nice and well presented all with beachfront views with very comfortable beds. All the staff are so attentive and helpful they couldn’t do enough for you. The food at the hotel is simply superb. The breakfasts are excellent. The Sri Lankan omelette, egg hoppers and labneh, avo and egg all superb. There’s also a wide variety of lunch and dinner menu options from both Sri Lankan and western pallets. The tuna main and the tamarind prawns were both knockout. There’s lots of places to sit and chill out at the hotel post dinner. A wonderful hotel and I would go back in a heartbeat. Thank you KK Beach for a wonderful stay🙏🏻.
title: Amazing stay at KK Beach

placeInfo/address: Matara Road, Habaraduwa 80630 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Turtle hatchery 2 mins along the beach 🏝️
text:
Just returned from this beautiful island. Finishing our trip at this amazing hotel was perfect from the moment we arrived. Hotel was breathtaking view and beach were draw dropping. 
The staff from managers to security guard were friendly and helpful at all times. 
Prasad our waiter was a delight to know and Kasun the pool guy couldn’t have been more attentive 😀. 
Excellent food at every meal time and iced lemon grass tea was delicious. 
We will be back and recommend 100%.
title: Fantastic end to our holiday of a lifetime

placeInfo/address: Matara Road, Habaraduwa 80630 Sri Lanka
roomTip: The weather patterns seem to be changing. March is supposed to be reliably dry, but we had several rainy days. Go earlier.
text:
We had a wonderfully relaxing five nights at the KK. A huge room, Suite 5, with a stunning view over the garden to the beach which is just steps away from the property. 
The  team cannot do enough for you….they are constantly checking in to make sure everything is as you wish it to be. 
Never crowded, it’s almost a home from home atmosphere.
Delicious meals, at night with candles illuminating the bar and restaurant.
We visited Galle, having been 15 years ago. A lovely lunch at the Fort Printers, as recommended by the KK, but Galle itself is now overrun with tourists with very low quality shops and cafes.
So, a thoroughly enjoyable first few days, before heading south.
A huge thank you to the whole team!
title: Relaxing, peaceful and charming.

roomTip: Use the hotel tuk-tuk for the 25 minute ride into the fort in Galle .. the driver will wait and bring you back to the hotel !
text:
After two fabulous weeks touring Sri Lanka,  a week of relaxation was all we needed to complete a perfect holiday !
KK Beach was the perfect choice, we stayed in Penthouse 2 - a comfortable and luxurious room with an enormous bathroom !   Although the menu was limited, the food was great and breakfast was delicious… One evening we were invited to go to the sister hotel KK Boutique for dinner, it is set on a tea plantation and was truly magnificent !  All-in-all we had a great week of relaxation - all of the staff were fantastic, but I have to draw attention to Kason who went the extra mile to ensure our every need was met - he even arranged a photo shoot with the local fisherman! On our last evening  a local alerted us to a turtle laying her eggs on the beach - a perfect end to a perfect holiday ! Thank you all x
title: Luxury personified !

text: We had a wonderful 4 nights here at the end of our tour of Sri Lanka. We stayed in an ocean suite and appreciated its spaciousness though we found the balcony on the small side. Most of the time was spent relaxing in the beautiful grounds anyway, ably looked after by the lovely Kasun. All the staff were super friendly & attentive. The only slight irritation for me was that one couple were allowed to reserve the (best) same table in the restaurant every night which seemed a little unfair. Food was excellent. If you’re looking for somewhere to relax & unwind away from the much busier Galle but within easy striking distance, I’d highly recommend this hotel.

placeInfo/address: Matara Road, Habaraduwa 80630 Sri Lanka
text:
The 1st thing I feel obliged to say is we didn’t feel this was a 5* resort, compared to, say Kumu Beach where we have stayed previously - I daresay there’s a price differential!
The other poignant thing to mention is, given it rained at some point everyday of our stay, the basic rooms don’t seem to have a balcony and, the ocean suites that we stayed in have an uncovered balcony, which rendered it useless in the rain. The weather was not the hotel’s fault of course, but during our 5 night stay the hotel wasn’t at full capacity until our last night, and the suites appeared to be unoccupied - it would have been nice if the manager had used his initiative & offered those rooms to make the other guests stay more enjoyable. We also wondered why the hotel wasn’t full in high season…
On the positive side, we did enjoy our stay here - the pool is nice, with plentiful sun beds & Kasun is an absolute asset to KK, making sure the guests are as comfortable as possible. He also accompanied me on the beach & showed me where to swim in relatively safe conditions, given the waves & fierce undertow. The beach is beautiful but the sand in front of the steps down has been swept away by the storms - we actually saw the difference in the 5 days, where the drop down onto the beach became less deep.
The food here is top class - they’ve clearly got an excellent chef. The restaurant is nice but, given the lack of guests didn’t have much atmosphere & our 1st night we were in there on our own! We realised other guests were eating elsewhere - there is certainly other options within easy distance, either on the main road, or Galle. Incidentally, I must mention that KK is on an extremely busy road but once inside, you don’t hear the traffic at all - mainly because the ocean drowns it out.
The other big asset here is the staff, especially Kasuntha, Prasad & Sahan - a real credit to the hotel.
title: More a 4* hotel

placeInfo/address: No. 101/17 Alles Garden Road, Trincomalee 31000 Sri Lanka
text:
Our stay at Amaranthé Bay was absolutely wonderful! After a rather disappointing experience at another hotel, we made a last-minute booking here – and were warmly welcomed from the moment we arrived.
The room was spotless and well-kept, but what really made the difference was the staff: every single person we encountered was friendly, attentive, and genuinely committed to making our stay as pleasant as possible.
The breakfast buffet offered a great mix of international favorites and local Sri Lankan dishes. We especially appreciated how flexible the kitchen was – they were more than happy to accommodate individual requests.
One of the highlights was a deeply relaxing massage at the spa – just what we needed to unwind.
All in all, we enjoyed a few peaceful, restorative days by the pool and at the nearby beach.
title: Highly Recommended
