roomTip: Everything is good and I didn’t really have any issues with the traffic
text: A hotel that has achieved its stars based on the service provided. That service was top notch. And all with a smile. A very conveniently placed hotel for my needs. As I had come for a convention . Clean beautiful rooms , to suit your every need. The view of the Pacific Ocean is lovely . There was one setback in my room . I couldn’t sit on the balcony due to the smells emanating from the kitchen below . Otherwise it would be nice to go for the sea view rooms and sit and bask in the sultry weather , watching the waves crashing on the shore in full force . The people are friendly and helpful and it’s a clean city overall . A visit to Colombo for a holiday is a very good idea, and I hope to make it again here soon . Allah willing .
title: Amazing hospitality

placeInfo/address: Thalgahapitiya Road, Kosgoda 80570 Sri Lanka
text:
Ich war zum ersten Mal im Garten Beach Ressort und habe mich rundum umsorgt und sehr wohl gefühlt.
Noch mal vielen Dank an den fließend Deutsch sprechenden Gästebetreuer Jan, der sich viel Zeit nahm für alles Wichtige zur Ayurveda Kur kenntnisreich zu erklären und mich mit seinem umfangreichen Wissen über Land und Leute bereichert hat.
Auch herzlichen Dank an das Service Team, sowie Nalin und Suhad, die uns liebevoll umsorgt haben.  Auch das Essen ist ganz ausgezeichnet ! Ich hatte zu der Zeit Geburtstag und das Küchenteam hat mich mit einer tollen Torte überrascht, zudem bekam ich ein Geschenk über das ich mich sehr gefreut habe ! 
Überhaupt ist das ganze Team von den Ärzten, Masseuren, bis hin zum Gärtner immer zugewandt, aufmerksam, freundlich und versucht alle Wünsche zu erfüllen.
Zu erwähnen ist auch die traumhafte Lage des Garden Beach Resort. Alle Zimmer haben Meerblick. Der Strand ist nahezu menschenleer und wenn man Glück hat, kann man Wasserschildkröten bei der Eiablage beobachten.
Nach wundervollen zwei Wochen habe ich mich total erholt und entspannt gefühlt. Wer eine Ayurveda Kur mache möchte hat hier eine traumhafte Zeit. Ich kann es nur jedem empfehlen.
Hermine

Eine in die Jahre gekommene Anlage, aber sehr gepflegt und mit  viel Liebe zu den Details betreut! Alle Zimmer sind zum Meer hin ausgerichtet, die Nächte begleitet von der Meeresbrandung. Behandlungen fanden teilweise auch direkt auf der Liege im Garten, mit Blick auf das tosende Meer, statt... traumhaft.

Vielen Dank an Alle!

text:
Wir hatten einen unvergesslichen Aufenthalt im Garden Beach Ayurveda Resort in Kosgoda! Von der ersten Minute an fühlten wir uns herzlich willkommen. Das gesamte Team ist unglaublich liebevoll und aufmerksam – hier wird echte Gastfreundschaft gelebt.

Ein besonderes Lob geht an Janaka, den deutschen Gästebetreuer. Er war stets für uns da, half bei allen Anliegen und gab wertvolle Tipps für unsere Zeit in Sri Lanka. Seine Unterstützung machte den Aufenthalt noch angenehmer, und wir haben uns rundum wohlgefühlt.

Das Resort selbst liegt idyllisch direkt am Meer – ein perfekter Ort zum Entspannen und Abschalten. Die Ayurveda-Behandlungen waren professionell und individuell auf unsere Bedürfnisse abgestimmt. Auch das Essen war ein Genuss: frisch, gesund und unglaublich lecker! Das ganze Hotel-Feeling war sowohl unter den Gästen, als auch mit den Mitarbeiter*innen des Hotels sehr familiär.

Wer neben der Entspannung auch etwas erleben möchte, hat zahlreiche Ausflugsmöglichkeiten in der Umgebung. Ob eine Bootsfahrt auf dem Madu River, ein Besuch des Schildkrötenprojekts in Kosgoda oder eine Tour nach Galle – Janaka und das Team halfen uns, unvergessliche Erlebnisse zu planen.

Wir können das Garden Beach Ayurveda Resort uneingeschränkt empfehlen und kommen gerne wieder!
title: Abschalten, auftanken, genießen - Ayurveda mit Herz!

placeInfo/address: Thalgahapitiya Road, Kosgoda 80570 Sri Lanka
text: Es war meine erste Ayurvedakur und ich war hier sehr gut aufgehoben! Als Alleinreisende habe ich mir bewusst ein kleines Ressort ausgesucht, was eine gute Entscheidung war. Unter den Gästen entsteht schnell Kontakt, da man gemeinsam an einem großen Tisch zusammen isst und auch durch die kleine Anlage mit Strandliegen entstehen immer wieder Gespräche. Alle Mitarbeiter*innen des Ressort sind sehr freundlich und es herrscht eine sehr persönliche Atmosphäre. Es sind sehr erfahrene Therapeuten im Team, dadurch haben sich meine Beschwerden deutlich reduziert, dafür nochmal vielen lieben Dank! Die Yogastunden waren für mich absolut passend, meine Beweglichkeit hat sich in diesen 3 Wochen verbessert. Auch Gästebetreuer Jan nimmt sich viel Zeit für die einzelnen Gäste und hat mir auch einen Extra-Ausflug nach Colombo organisiert. Das Essen hat nicht nur gut geschmeckt, es ist mir auch sehr gut bekommen. Die Anlage ist schon etwas in die Jahre gekommen, aber sauber. Die Wellen waren mir tatsächlich etwas zu laut, da diese hier auf Steinbänke stoßen. Davon abgesehen ist es ein wunderbarer Ort, um zur Ruhe zu kommen.
title: Professionelle Ayurvedakur mit persönlicher Atmosphäre

Wir freuen uns schon jetzt auf ein Wiedersehen!

placeInfo/address: Thalgahapitiya Road, Kosgoda 80570 Sri Lanka
text:
Dieser Aufenthalt im Garden Beach Kosgoda war bereits mein dritter.
Als ich das erste mal 2023 hier her kam, reiste ich allein und wusste nicht, 
was auf mich zukommt.
Ich hatte keine Erwartungen. Jedoch meine Begegnungen mit den Menschen vor Ort
(Personal und Gäste) haben einen so gewaltigen Eindruck bei mir hinterlassen,
dass ich schon kurz nach meiner ersten Heimreise wußte, ich komme wieder.
Dank der Fürsorge des deutschsprachigen Gästebetreuers Jananka gab es keinerelei sprachliche Hürden für mich.
Es war sofort eine respektvolle und vertraute Atmosphäre zwischen uns.
Besonders wichtig ist mir seine Hilfe bei den ärztlichen Konsultationen.
Man kann sich mit jedem Anliegen vertrauensvoll an ihn wenden.
Auch in diesem Jahr war meine Kur wieder ein voller Erfolg. Meine Akkus sind aufgeladen und die Rückenschmerzen weg.
Die Herzlichkeit und die Fürsorge, die ich hier erfahre sind einzigartig.
Gerne werde ich wiederkommen.

Welch ein toller Aufenthalt in diesem sehr persönlichen AYURVEDA Resort. Bin eher zögerlich und mit etwas Skepsis angereist, letztlich um dem Wunsch meiner Frau nachzukommen. Aber dann haben mich die 3 Wochen begeistert. Tägliches Yoga und die tollen Massagen haben mir eine Beweglichkeit zurück gegeben wie ich sie zuletzt vor 10 Jahre hatte. Das Essen war schmackhaft und abwechslungsreich. Bewusst auf halbe Portion gesetzt, sind wie gewünscht etliche Kilos abgeschmolzen, nachhaltig. Das Ärzte Team hat sich um jedes Wehwehchen gekümmert. Das Ganze Personal ist super freundlich und engagiert, und verbreitet eine herzliche und sehr persönliche Stimmung in diesem Resort. Jan als Guest Relation Manager macht einen super Job. In fließend deutsch und englisch kümmert er sich um jedes Anliegen, beantwortet alle Fragen zu Land und Leuten. Die Lage des Resorts direkt am Meer ist traumhaft. Eignet sich für ausgiebige Strand Spaziergänge und auch zum Baden muss man nur 300 m weit zu einem feinen Sandstrand gehen. Alles in allem … ein guter Grund in 2-3 Jahren wieder zu kommen.
Reiner & Christina

roomTip: Das Haus liegt zwar direkt am Strand, ist dort aber sehr steinig. Um Baden zu können, muss man deshalb ein paar Meter zum Sandstrand laufen.
text:
Ayurveda-Kur in Sri Lanka – Eine Reise zu Gesundheit und Entspannung:
Anstelle eines gewöhnlichen Jahresurlaubs entschieden wir uns auf ärztlichen Rat für eine Ayurveda-Kur, um das Immunsystem meiner Frau ganzheitlich zu stärken und neue Energie zu tanken. Der Arzt empfahl nicht nur 1–2 Wochen, sondern eine intensive vierwöchige Kur, um die volle Wirkung dieser jahrtausendealten Heiltradition zu entfalten.

Nach einer sorgfältigen Recherche stießen wir auf das Resort "The Garden Beach" in Kosgoda, SriLanka. Dieses ruhige Paradies bietet die originale Ayurveda-Kur, betreut von erfahrenen Ärzten, die jeden Gast individuell begleiten. Was uns ganz besonders gefiel, ist die speziell abgestimmte Küche: Hier gibt es kein Buffet, sondern individuell für jeden Gast zubereitete Mahlzeiten, die auf die Bedürfnisse seines Körpers abgestimmt sind. Der Hausmanager Janaka nimmt sich immer Zeit, das Ayurveda-Prinzip zu erklären, die Zubereitung der Gerichte näherzubringen und alle Fragen rund um die Kur, Ernährung und Behandlungen zu beantworten.

Das Resort liegt direkt am Strand, etwas ab vom Massentourismus. Diese Abgeschiedenheit ermöglicht es den Gästen, sich voll und ganz auf ihre Gesundheit und Erholung zu konzentrieren. Dennoch bietet die Umgebung zahlreiche Möglichkeiten für Entdeckungen: Wir unternahmen einen Ausflug nach Galle, einer charmanten Stadt im Süden der Insel, und erkundeten einige der nahegelegenen Sehenswürdigkeiten, wie die Lagune, eine Mine für Edelsteine, eine Zimtproduktion, sowie einen Kräutergarten.

Wenn Sie auf der Suche nach einer Reise sind, die Körper und Geist in Einklang bringt, könnte eine Ayurveda-Kur in Sri Lanka genau das Richtige für Sie sein. Lassen Sie sich inspirieren und erleben Sie eine Auszeit, die nachhaltig wirkt.

Die ayurvedische Küche – Ein überraschender Genuss:
Zu Beginn hatten wir große Bedenken, ob die ayurvedische Küche unseren Geschmack treffen würde. Doch wir wurden schnell eines Besseren belehrt! Das Essen war nicht nur köstlich, sondern auch reichlich – jede Mahlzeit bestand aus vier Gängen, die perfekt abgestimmt waren.

Besonders beeindruckend war, dass jedes Gericht immer alle sechs Geschmacksrichtungen – süß, sauer, salzig, bitter, herb und scharf – enthielt, wie es im Ayurveda üblich ist.

Trotz der fleischlosen Küche und des Verzichts auf Süßigkeiten haben wir nichts vermisst. Die Gerichte waren so abwechslungsreich und wohltuend, dass wir uns nach kurzer Zeit voller Energie und völlig zufrieden fühlten.

Also alles in allem eine empfehlenswerte Reise, die unseren Körper und Geist wieder aufgebaut hat.
title: Das Garden Beach Resort ist eine kleine Ayurveda-Oase, genau richtig zum Ausspannen und Erholen.

text:
Eine wunderschöne, heimelige Hotelanlage mit Pool und Garten ist der richtige Wohlfühlort für so eine medizinische Ayurvedakur.
Es gibt Betreuung durch 3 erfahrene Ayurveda Ärzte,die man jederzeit ansprechen kann, engagierte Masseur/innen, Dosha abgestimmtes, abwechslungsreiches Essen, tägliche Yoga bzw. QiGong Übungen und vor dem Garten liegt der beeindruckende indische Ozean.
Ausnahmslos alle Betreuer, von der Rezeptipnskraft, dem house-keeping, dem Gärtner über den Service ud dem therapeutisch-ärtzlichen Team sind von morgens bis abends hochbemüht, den Aufenthalt so angenehm wie möglich zu gestalten. Alle sind stets sehr freundlich, zugewandt, respektvoll und man fühlt sich gesehen, bestens begleitet und betreut. Es wird von allen auf alle Anliegen umgehend reagiert. 
Besonders möchte ich erwähnen, dass Jan, der Gästebetreuer, perfekt deutsch gesprochen hat und mit seinem enormen Wissen über Ayurveda, Ernährung, Land und Religion durch die gesamte Zeit begleitet und unterstützt, was in Anbetracht der intensiven Behandlungen sehr sehr hilfreich ist. Vielen herzlichen Dank, ich habe so etwas noch nirgendwo erlebt: Der Patient im Mittlepunkt wird hier gelebt!!!

title: Ein freundlicher, familiärer Ort

ownerResponse/text:
Liebe/r Knappenschmiede,

herzlichen Dank für Ihre ausführliche Bewertung und dafür, dass Sie sowohl Ihr Lob als auch Ihre Kritik mit uns geteilt haben.

Es freut uns sehr zu hören, dass Sie deutliche Verbesserungen durch die Ayurveda-Behandlung erfahren haben und die Hingabe unseres Ärzteteams sowie aller Mitarbeitenden – von der Rezeption über die Küche bis zu den Therapeut:innen – geschätzt haben. Ihre lobenden Worte über „Jan Wikipedia“ und das gesamte Serviceteam ehren uns sehr und motivieren uns, weiterhin unser Bestes zu geben.

Gleichzeitig bedauern wir es aufrichtig, dass der Zustand der Hotelanlage Ihren Gesamteindruck getrübt hat. Ihre Anmerkungen zu den infrastrukturellen Mängeln – von Klimaanlage und Sanitär bis hin zu Ausstattung und Mobiliar – sind vollkommen berechtigt.

Wir möchten Sie – und alle zukünftigen Gäste – darüber informieren, dass das Resort im Juli für umfassende Renovierungsarbeiten geschlossen wurde. Die Modernisierungen umfassen unter anderem renovierte Zimmer und Bäder, verbesserte Elektro- und Wassersysteme, neue Matratzen, frische Textilien, aufgewertete Strandeinrichtungen und vieles mehr. Unser Ziel ist es, den Erwartungen unserer geschätzten Gäste gerecht zu werden und gleichzeitig die ruhige, authentische Ayurveda-Atmosphäre zu bewahren.

Wir würden uns freuen, wenn Sie sich in Zukunft doch noch einmal für einen Aufenthalt bei uns entscheiden, um die Veränderungen persönlich zu erleben. Ihr Feedback hat maßgeblich dazu beigetragen, diese Verbesserungen anzustoßen.

Mit herzlichen Grüßen und den besten Wünschen für Ihre Gesundheit

roomTip: Der vom Hotel angebotene Flughafentransfer ist weit überteuert. Einfache Fahrt im klimatisierten Taxi ab 40€ - 50€ pro Strecke
text:
Sehr gute Ayurvedabehandlung, drei Ärzte immer ansprechbar und hilfsbereit, sehr engagiertes Personal, vom Empfang über Küche, Service und Masseurinnen und Masseure. Ich ging mit einer deutlichen Vitalitätsverbesserung. 

Besonders zu loben ist das Engagement von "Jan Wikipedia ", der deutssprachige Kundenbetreuer. Immer sehr hilfreiche Erläuterungen zu Ayurveda, dem Essen und Sri Lanka. 

Das Hotel und die Zimmer sind sehr sauber, aber das gesamte Hotel ist  mittlerweile sehr abgewohnt. Hier wurde in den letzten Jahren wenig bis nichts in die Unterhaltung investiert. Bedenkliche  Elektroinstallationen, fehlendes Warmwasser in der 3. Etage, defekte Klimaanlagen, durchgelegene Matratzen ( mit Inkontinenz-Plastikauflage!) teilweise uralte Handtücher, durchgelegene Strandliegenauflagen, ekelhafte Stranddusche und einiges mehr. 

Das ist sehr schade und mindert leider das exzellente Ayurvedaerlebnis.
Beim nächsten Mal wähle ich ein moderneres Haus.

text: Für mich ein perfekter Ausstieg aus dem Alltag! Hat meine Erwartungen übertroffen. Entspannter Flug - Transfer mit Hilfe des Hotels reibungslos geklappt - in dem kleinen, liebevoll geführten Hotel herzlich begrüsst worden und sofort wohlgefühlt - absolute Privatsphäre und Ruhe zur Erholung - super freundliches, zuvorkommendes, humorvolles Personal, dem die Zufriedenheit jedes Einzelnen (der maximal 15 Gäste!!!) am Herzen lag - absolut einfühlsame, empathische Betreuung durch Jan  (Guest Relations Manager - ein wandelndes Lexikon über Aryuveda generell, ayurvedisches Essen, die Gegend, über Buddhismus - einfach klasse!, die drei Ärzte und jeden einzelnen Therapeuten (8 insgesamt!) - super Essen direkt aus der Küche neben dem Esstisch - geräumige, sehr saubere Zimmer - Wellenrauschen 24/7 - Relax mit Blick aufs Meer - Ausflugsmöglichkeiten zu Fuss und per Tuk-Tuk (frag Jan!) - Yoga jeden Morgen - liebevolle Dekoration und Liebe zum Detail - optionale, abwechslungsreiche, sehr angenehme Abendveranstaltungen bzgl. lokale Kultur - nette Gäste, mit denen man viel Spass haben konnte, oder auch in Ruhe gelassen wurde - wie es einem eben zumute war - WAS WILL MAN MEHR in einem Relax-Urlaub? Naja - und die Entgiftungskur - die ist speziell, dafür sollte man offen sein - ist aber ein tolles Erlebnis, was ich sicher wiederholen werde, weil es einfach MEGA gut tut. Danke an FIT Reisen, und Danke an das Hiru-Beach! Grüsse, Simone

title: Ein entspannte Aufenthalt

placeInfo/address: Thalgahapitiya Road, Kosgoda 80570 Sri Lanka
text:
Ich war über Weihnachten/Silvester im Hinru Garden Beach Resort. Das war gut aus Urlaubstagen Effizienz Gründen, aber es gibt bestimmt bessere Termine, denn speziell nach Weihnachten war das kleine Hotel viel zu voll, da fast alle Zimmer doppelt belegt waren und sogar auch externe Gäste in dem kleinen Resort die Kur mitmachten. Auf der Yogaplattform gab es dadurch kaum Platz und im Garten lag man Liege an Liege. Das Haus könnte auch durchaus und dringend mal eine Renovierung gebrauchen…
Abgesehen davon waren es zauberhafte 2 Wochen dank der Location am Meer, dem ausgezeichnetem Team vor Ort, dem großartigen Essen und den wunderbaren Behandlungen. Ich fühle mich erholt und fit für 2025! Mein Dank geht auch an Jan, den „Host/Gästebetreuer“, der einen ausgezeichneten Job macht. Er erklärt die ayurvedische Lehre sehr anschaulich und eingehend (auch für die westliche Welt), ist stets mit Rat und Tat zur Seite und unterstütz/übersetzt bei Arztgesprächen, wenn jemand der englischen Sprache nicht 100% mächtig ist. 
Ich habe das Resort ins Herz geschlossen. Würde das nächste Mal nicht zur Peak Season kommen, um mehr Ruhe und Raum zu haben und hoffe, das bis dahin vom Eigentümer mal die Pinsel für eine Renovierung geschwungen werden.

Mein Aufenthalt im Garden Beach Resort war einfach fantastisch! Von der ersten Minute an fühlte ich mich willkommen und gut aufgehoben. Das gesamte Personal war unglaublich freundlich, liebevoll, herzlich und aufmerksam. Ich habe mich sehr wohl gefühlt.
Die Anlage selbst ist ein kleines Paradies der Ruhe und Entspannung. Die Zimmer sind sauber und haben einen herrlichen Blick in den Garten und natürlich auf das Meer. 
Ein absolutes Highlight waren die Ayurveda-Behandlungen. Die Ärztin und ihre Assistenzärzte sowie die Therapeuten sind alle sehr erfahren und haben jede Behandlung individuell auf meine Bedürfnisse abgestimmt. 
Das Essen im Resort war ein Genuss für alle Sinne! Die Vielfalt und Frische der Zutaten haben mich jeden Tag aufs Neue begeistert. So wie es zubereitet wurde, wurde es auch serviert - mit viel Herz und guter Laune und begleitet von vielen interessanten Hintergrundinformationen von Jan. 
Alles in allem war mein Aufenthalt im Garden Beach Resort ein unvergessliches Erlebnis. Es war mein dritter und schönster Ayurveda-Urlaub. Ich kann dieses Resort nur wärmstens weiterempfehlen. 
Liebes Garden Beach Resort-Team, herzlichen Dank für die schöne Zeit bei euch. Ihr seid die Besten!!
title: Ein unvergessliches Erlebnis

placeInfo/address: 78 Samanthara Rd, Wadduwa 12560 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Whatever you are given you will not be disappointed they are all amazing
text:
From the moment the gates open into this Oasis your mind shouts O My God this is amazing, your experience is just beginning, the staff greet you with a warm welcome smile a cool drink and cool freshly aroma towel as they have you sit down and relax (RELAXING IS WHAT THIS PLACE IS ALL ABOUT), the decor that surrounds you is out of this world, you spend your whole time imagining how you could live in this place.
Once you have relaxed and are ready the experience continues as you are escorted through the beautiful gardens to your home for the duration of your stay (I say home because there is no way you could simply describe what you are stepping into as a ROOM). I could have easily stayed in my new home for at least a week without going outside, the decor is unbelievable the bathroom well you must see it to believe it.
Everything is catered for in your new home and if it isn't there then just simply pick up the phone and it will be there very quickly, delivered with a smile. 
Moving on to your dining experience, (as it is easy to write a small visitors guide just on your new home), the waiters would give the any Royal staff member a run for their money, I can honestly say in all my years of traveling and staying at such hotels as the Chedi (Oman) and the Burj Al Arab (Dubai) these have to be the most considerate and professional waiters I have ever had the pleasure to meet,  It was a pleasure every meal time to meet these guys, their knowledge off the food being served combined with the skill and care in which they gave the amazing food the Chef had prepared when serving you was outstanding. Put all this together with the beautiful peaceful surroundings you have a perfect place to start your day with the wide selection of breakfast available cooked to your  personnel requirements, followed by a day of relaxing around the pool side or if you wish spend an hour or two being pampered at the Spa. I could write so much more about my stay at the Reef Villa Spa, but rather than do that I will just finish by saying if you want to treat yourself to an experience of a life time then you will not be disappointed when you come and stay here.

A big thank you to Brendan & Bernadette the pups and their amazing team for making our stay so special we will be seeing you again.

To see photos go to Instagram reefvilla
title: BEYOND Exclusive 7******* Star Luxury Retreat with affordable price tag

placeInfo/address: 78 Samanthara Rd, Wadduwa 12560 Sri Lanka
roomTip: We booked a room by the pool and they were amazing,
text: This was one of the best hotels we have been to. Great surroundings  and service with good dining. The personel took great care of us and was extremely professional. We recommend this hotel for everyone that wants to live somewhere special and luxorius.
title: Amazing place

placeInfo/address: 78 Samanthara Rd, Wadduwa 12560 Sri Lanka
text:
Where do I begin!  This hotel is so unique and beautiful. 
On arrival, we entered a beautiful long walkway which was an oasis of trees, plants and water gardens. It felt like we were escaping into a whole other world. A complete oasis of tranquillity and nature. So that was a great start!

The main hotel and reception area is surrounded by all these beautiful antiques. I could have spent hours three exploring all the beautiful artefacts. Just on the right hand side there was another beautiful seating area surrounded by a beautiful water garden, swing sofa, and local fish. You could spend an evening there just listening to the sounds of nature and enjoying the tranquillity.

The hotel staff were very welcoming and friendly, they showed us around to hotel to help us get our bearings. We were led out to a beautiful large garden just Infront of the beach. It is surrounded by palm trees, a fabulous pool and outdoor restaurant where breakfast and dinner is served. Simply stunning.

We were then showed to our suite which was another lovely experience getting there. We were led along this beautiful walkway surrounded by tall greenery. (You feel connected to the nature at all time here)
  
Our suite was a complete WOW. So luxurious and completely unique. All the amazing artefacts and antiques. 
The attention to detail in the suite itself was so impressive and beautiful from the luxurious bedding, cushions, shower gels, bath salts, seating areas, interesting antiques to high vaulted wooded celling, 4 poster bed, gigantic bathtub, additional outdoor shower etc.

Our suite led out to a beautiful private garden and patio area (which included 2 seething areas, a swing sofa and beautiful water garden complete with fish!)
We also had direct access to the garden and pool area.
 

Our stay here was magical and so relaxing. From laying by the pool reading our books, to taking long walks on the beach, watching the sunset etc

One night we had dinner in our fabulous suite. The staff pulled out all the stops in delivering our meals, It was a lovely experience. The food was also divine.
The Sri Lankan breakfast was delicious

The owners clearly put a lot of work into creating this stunning hotel. The attention to detail has to be applauded.  

It’s perfect for couples and families of all ages. You will feel like you are in paradise. 

My husband and I 100% recommend this beautiful hotel . 
Finally, Thank you to all the team at the reef for making our stay with you so special. We are looking forward to returning in the future.
title: A WOW Hotel .Simply beautiful!

placeInfo/address: 78 Samanthara Rd, Wadduwa 12560 Sri Lanka
roomTip: All rooms have seaview, all ar spacious and lovely equipped. Just super !!!!!
text:
This hotel is certainly one of the best in Sri Lanka. The rooms are wonderful, spacious,
safe and quiet, furnished with love and detail, comfortable and luxurious. 
The staff is fantastic, they are extremely friendly, helpful and experienced. Pool, garden and beach are clean and nice - it is really of piece of heaven on earth. 
If you want to spend a relaxed,  luxury vacation, this is the place to go. The location is convenient - a place for the best possible holiday !!!
title: Heaven on Earth

placeInfo/address: 78 Samanthara Rd, Wadduwa 12560 Sri Lanka
text: We had a great few days here before leaving Sri Lanka. Long beach walks, first class food, dedicated staff. Stylish interiors, 150 year old palm trees. Fine place to relax looking at The Sunset from the pool or under the sheltered loungers close to the beach.
title: Palm beach

placeInfo/address: 78 Samanthara Rd, Wadduwa 12560 Sri Lanka
text:
Having spent two weeks touring Sri Lanka, we wanted to spend a couple of days relaxing on the coast before flying back to the UK. We could not have picked a better place to do this than the Reef Villa and Spa.

The hotel has the feel of a colonial villa and is set in a botanical garden paradise complete with parrots. The bedroom suites are massive, extremely comfortable and have huge bathrooms.  The suites and public areas are tastefully furnished and decorated with real antiques and objet d’art.

The standard of service from the staff is exceptional, and from the moment you arrive we felt that we were treated more like house guests rather than just another hotel guest.

The open-air restaurant next to the pool, and overlooking the Indian Ocean was very good and served marvelous fresh fish and seafood.

In the morning it is fun and interesting to walk along the coconut palm fringed beach and watch the local fishing families deploy and retrieve their drag nets and go for swim afterwards in the warm sea. The ocean swim was suggested by the pool attendant who on realising that my wife was nervous about doing so, came onto the beach and  kept and kept an eye on her.

We have stayed in lots of excellent boutique hotels around the world, but in terms of decor and quality of staff The Reef Villa is one of the best.
title: Exceptional - Highly Recommended

placeInfo/address: 78 Samanthara Rd, Wadduwa 12560 Sri Lanka
text:
We booked the Manel suite.  What a beautiful room full of colonial artifacts.
Fantastic garden with ocean view and nice swimming pool.  However the biggest asset of the Reef is the staff : very friendly and always helpfull whenever they can.
A real treasure in Sri Lanka.
title: A peacefull heaven on the west coast of Sri Lanka

placeInfo/address: 78 Samanthara Rd, Wadduwa 12560 Sri Lanka
roomTip: All rooms are beautiful
text:
We have just returned from Reef having spent seven glorious days at this great hotel. It is actually our third visit and we always stay in a Plantation House suite.  Lovely to see all the smiling faces - Dino and Dakshan in the restaurant, Malith the always helpful manager and of course Malka who is ever watchful at the pool.

What is it about Reef that we love?  Its the amazing food, the beautifully appointed rooms and the endless beach.  The staff are all so generous with their smiles and ready to help all the time, but there's one fabulous edition this year - its the opening of the motorway to the airport - only an hour away!

Brendon, keep up the magic and we will see you all next year,
title: Glorious

placeInfo/address: 78 Samanthara Rd, Wadduwa 12560 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Both suites have great views of the sea and are huge.
text:
We booked the Plantation House Suite for a family of four. It was quite difficult to find the property and the surroundings weren't impressive. However, when we arrived it was a total wow factor. Amazing place, with great staff and two lovely dogs that love kids. 

Tried to visit again before we headed back, but couldn't make it work. Will definitely make this our first stop on our next visit to Sri Lanka again.
title: Fantastic start to holiday

placeInfo/address: 78 Samanthara Rd, Wadduwa 12560 Sri Lanka
text: The Reef was one of the best hotels we stayed at in Sri Lanka and one of the best seaside hotels I've ever stayed at. It is hidden within a tropical vegetation and palm trees, and faces a west coast beach on an authentic fishermen's beach. It features a refined and alluring decor, including art and design items carefully collected by the hotel's owners, an interior designer and architect couple. The main villa has soaring ceilings and cozy sitting areas. The rooms are spacious and luxurious, while also being intimate. Our room had a huge stone bathtub for two, a shower and an outdoor shower. We also had a private sitting area and fish pond. The pool is gorgeous and overlooks well maintained grounds, dotted with swaying palms. The restaurant is open and faces the pool and gardens. The quality is excellent and the menu creative. The Sri Lankan breakfast was also delicious. Thanks to the new highway, the airport is less than an hour drive, therefore there's no need to stay at a hotel Negombo, you can remain in paradise here until your last moments in Sri Lanka! I highly recommend this wonderful boutique hotel and can't wait to go back!
title: Exceptional and Magical Beach Hotel in Sri Lanka!

placeInfo/address: 78 Samanthara Rd, Wadduwa 12560 Sri Lanka
text:
Thank you to all the team at the reef for making our stay with you so special. The attention to detail is clear to see; right from how the hotel was designed and built - making this a real quiet haven, tucked away from the hustle and bustle of the outside world, beautifully decorated and furnished with period features. The staff are what make this a truly special place though, they always have a smile on their face and show a true passion for what they do. 

I asked Nishanka and Dino to arrange a surprise BBQ in the gardens near the beach for my partners birthday. Dino even took our pre order for dinner that afternoon to keep it a surprise! I would recommend asking for the BBQ for anyone who stays here, we were served a variety of seafood, chicken and steak along with a selection of sides, all cooked to perfection, it was a real treat. 

During our 8 night stay we didn’t go out for any other meals in the local area as we didn’t consider there to be better food available elsewhere. The food was top class with a service to match. The menu has a good selection of food too so we didn’t get bored during our stay, we both highly rated the restaurant at the Reef.

Overall this is a truly unique hotel which I will be recommending to all our friends and family.
We are already planning our next visit!
title: Stunning Hotel and brilliant Staff

placeInfo/address: 78 Samanthara Rd, Wadduwa 12560 Sri Lanka
text: This hotel is absolutely pure class. The staff and service is what sets this hotel apart. We only stayed one night but the food prepared was absolutely delicious. Some of the best fish I have had. The beach is footsteps away and away from the hustle and bustle of other tourist spots. The pool is perfect & surrounded by beautiful palms. You will feel like you are in paradise. If you are looking to relax, look no further. A huge thanks to Brendan and his team.
title: Hidden Gem

placeInfo/address: 78 Samanthara Rd, Wadduwa 12560 Sri Lanka
text:
When you enter the Reef, you are transported back in time to the 1800’s and the time of the British Raj. A period of colonial opulence typified by ornate furniture and punkah’s. The latter are present in abundance throughout the property in fully restored and operational condition. Fortunately there is also air conditioning!

As you enter through the main building the vista of the grounds open up before you and leads to the crashing sound of the Indian Ocean. Swaying palm trees are dotted around the lawns which host a beautiful infinity pool whose temperature at the time of our stay was pleasantly warm under the heat of the sun.

The hub of the property is the dining area next to the pool where all meals, snacks and drinks are prepared and served. For guests convenience there are buzzers located throughout the property from where you can request service from the staff. It usually takes about 30 to 45 seconds for the staff to respond.

We spent five nights here following a full tour of Sri Lanka and found the Reef to be the perfect place to relax and chill before returning to Colombo and the journey home. We did not need to lift a finger because the staff relieved us of all responsibility, nothing was too much trouble. The staff team were amazing, each carrying out their role effectively to provide effortless comfort for the guest. Our room (Olu) was amazing, spacious, comfortable, clean, cool and a haven of luxury to return to after a tiring day at the pool! The bathroom was large enough to host a rugby team after training. The granite bath would have taken at least half the team! We enjoyed our daily sessions in the private outdoor jacuzzi attached to our room.

The food was excellent. High quality ingredients cooked well and presented to a high standard. By Sri Lankan standards the menu was expensive, by English standards it was equivalent to gastro pub prices. Wine and other alcoholic beverages were much more expensive than in Sri Lanka generally with a bottle of wine averaging 6500 to 7000 slk (about £27 to £30 @ 235 slk to 1GBP at the time of writing). 

We took the opportunity to book a 45 minute whole body massage. Be advised that the Reef does not employ its own staff but arranges for a therapist to come in and fulfil the booking. We would describe the massage as gently relaxing, not unpleasant but certainly not therapeutic. Of the massages that we had during our 18 day tour, this was without doubt the weakest.

The beach directly in front of the Reef was kept clean by the Reef staff and swept every day. Unfortunately once you progressed beyond the hotel frontage the state of the beach is deplorable. It was more than a little disconcerting to watch the local fishermen land their catch as there was nearly as much plastic in the net as there was fish. Rubbish was burnt on the beach and at no time did we see any beach cleaning equipment or personnel except for The Reef personnel.

Don’t let that detract from the amazing service that the Reef provides as there is no requirement upon guests to leave the grounds of the property unless like us you love to walk on the beach. A word of warning, the sand is very gritty which makes walking in bare feet quite difficult if you have sensitive feet. If you have sand shoes then we would advise taking them.

We can thoroughly recommend a few days here at the end of a tour to regroup and leave only a short journey back to the airport.

Would we return to the Reef Villa and Spa?..................definitely!
title: Tranquility in the opulence of the Raj

placeInfo/address: 78 Samanthara Rd, Wadduwa 12560 Sri Lanka
text: In all of Sri Lanka and we have travelled around the country many times, Reef Villa is our favourite property. On our third visit we were warmly welcomed by Marith Perera and his staff. It was so good to be back. The rooms are privately located and to be found nestled amongst the lovely gardens. We particularly enjoyed our large verandah and the Indian swing, as we watched the coloured fish swimming buy. The food was excellent. I was very pleased to be able to pre-order as I have a dietary issue and every meal was carefully adapted for me. The presentation was also superb. I extend my thanks to both outstanding cooks. The staff were delightful.  Ever kind, helpful and friendly and nothing was too much trouble for them. The pool is lovely and it’s a great place from which to sit and watch the sun setting over the sea, with a tipple in hand. The fishermen taking out and bringing in their nets was a feature of every day. It was so interesting. This is a superb beach front property. I can not recommend it highly enough.
title: A beautiful, outstanding property.

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Ayubowan!

Thank you so much for your wonderful review!

We’re absolutely thrilled to hear that you and your partner had such an enjoyable stay with us. It’s always a pleasure to know our guests appreciated the accommodation, facilities, and especially the service from our team – they’ll be so pleased to hear your kind words.

We're also glad your partner enjoyed the massage – we know how important it is to get it just right, especially for those with high standards!

We hope to welcome you both back again soon for another relaxing and memorable stay.

Warm regards,  
Arshed Refai  
General Manager
placeInfo/address: Passikudah Kalkudah, Kalkudah 30410 Sri Lanka
text:
Simply a stunning stay. Accomodation, facilities, staff. All incredible. We were lucky because there were only a handful of us in the hotel so that makes a difference but i can confidently say you won't regret staying here. Book, book, book! 

P.S my partner says that massage was excellent too and she's super fussy!
title: Best Hotel in Pasikudah?

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Ayubowan!

text:
We had a vacation here with three kids! We stayed in a beautiful villa with a great design and a personal pool. There was everything that we needed and even more! The cleaning service also deserves our gratitude. They masterfully cleaned up, no matter the mess we made. 
There are a lot of activities inside the hotel like: gym, tennis court, everything to play volleyball, spa, karaoke, pool and swimming pool. 
The main feature of the hotel is that it has a private beach and even a private reef! It prevents high ocean waves from disturbing your swim in nearby waters. Though the reef bottom may be a bit sharp, the hotel gives out special slippers so it is not painful. The beach itself (and the hotel as a whole) is very well-kept and tidy. You can also rent a kayak if you're tired of swimming. 
Also a detail worth noticing is the hospitality, with which the staff welcomes you. But it doesn't stop there. Throughout your whole stay you will encounter smiles and kind words. 
Special thanks to the general manager, who is very kind, caring and attentive, and to food and beverage department, which provided us superb meals and a luxury service. We want to thank Karthik, Ashitha, Ranu and Gihan. We would like to thank everybody who works there by their names, but we can't recall all of them. Sorry(
So if you want to have a luxury, fun, pleasant, quiet, delicious and all-in-all wonderful vacation, come to Sun Siyam hotel!
title: Unique beach, warm ocean and quiet place

Thank you for sharing your feedback and for choosing to stay with us. We’re delighted to hear that you enjoyed the spacious room, comfortable bed, and large terrace. We appreciate your understanding regarding the challenges with the coral in our area.

As you mentioned, the coral reef was significantly affected by the tsunami, and while it has sadly impacted the natural beauty of the sea, we make every effort to maintain the area by cleaning it daily. We provide the necessary equipment, like plastic shoes, to help make the experience more comfortable for our guests.

We also take note of your feedback regarding the food and coffee at breakfast, and we will look into improving these areas to ensure a better experience for future stays. We're pleased that you enjoyed the nearby local restaurants and the tranquility of our swimming pool. 

We hope you had the chance to explore the local attractions, such as the fish market and the coconut plantation. Thank you again for your comments, and we hope to welcome you back for another stay in the future.

roomTip: Avoid the coffee at breakfast.  Try some of the local restaurants .
text:
We had a spacious room with a very comfortable bed and a large terrace with a partial sea view.  The bathroom was partially open air,  which meant it was rather hot.

However,  the coral has died in the sea, so the hotel beach  has sharp, dead coral.  They give you plastic shoes but we walked up to the public beach or the Uga hotel beach as the beaches there were much nicer for swimming.

The food was OK but could be improved.   The coffee at breakfast wasn't very nice.  There are local restaurants nearby serving fish and prawns as well as curry.

There is a large hotel swimming pool.  When we were there in March, the hotel was quiet and we sometimes had the pool to ourselves.

There is a fish market nearby that is worth the trip.  You can also visit the coconut plantation.
title: Nice hotel,  shame the coral is dead

text:
Погода шик, ни капли дождя днем, только пару ночей проливал (для свежести). 

Пляж у нашего отеля -ну такое. Лучше, чем на западном побережье, из-за отсутствия волн, но хуже, чем у соседнего отеля (10 минут легким шагом), из-за песочка завезенного и волн морских. У нас совсем штиль был все дни. И коралловое дно.
Точнее, не пляж ну такое, а именно вот вода и море.

Экскурсии, конечно, отстой полный. Я давно была, в 18ом году, поэтому забыла, что там все находится друг от друга в 4-8 часах езды. Хорошо, что только 1 экскурсию взяли. Я под конец дня умирала уже.

Вилла прям классная. Там часть санузла такая же как сам номер по квадратуре. Ванная под открытым небом.

С 8 марта поздравляли. Тортик по территории отеля всем предлагали вкусных. Всякие десерты весь день несли в номер. Вечером устроили у берега выступление для дам, караоке прям туда вынесли. Столики поставили, музыка и стробоскопы. Классно.

Отдельный плюс- в отеле никого почти и не было. Человек 10 за все время пребывания встретили и все.

Как будто весь отель наш, да и соседний тоже 😂 Там за 50$ можно было находиться и пользоваться всем отелем. Называется Uga bay.

Кухня хорошая, каждый день новые блюда. Есть вариант шведского стола периодически, а чаще- тебе дают планшет и ты выбирает стартер, основное, десерт и напитки (чай /кофе). Всякие фреши уже дополнительно. Не скажу, что дешево стоят, но вкусные.

К нам шеф повар выходил, спрашивал, все ли нравится, и что больше всего понравилось. Приятно. 
Да и сервис всегда подойдет и спросит, все ли хорошо, все ли нравится. Но они это делают не навязчиво, а всегда с тактом.

Территориия отеля красивая, отель свежий. Зелено, облагорожено, пляж убирают работники. Все есть, даже караоке. Спа зона с хамамом, парилкой и массажем. Стоит не дорого, oil massage 60min вышел 13500 lkr. 

В целом, офигенный пляжный отдых, Мальдивы на минималках. 😂
7-9 дней отдыха- самое то. Дольше было бы уже скучно.
title: Пассикудовка 😄🙌

text:
A great, new beach hotel where you can relax right by the ocean. The territory of the hotel is not very big, but generally well planned and kept nice, tidy and blooming. Itš a vey pleasant and relaxing feeling to be there. The hotel has 36 rooms, but during our stay there were very few guests, which very pleasantly coincided with our expectations for a quiet and peaceful vacation right by the beach. This was only occasionally disturbed by some hotel guests from Russia with their characteristic  loud behaviour and disregard for the presence of others. 
The rooms were very tastefully decorated, with everything you need for your stay. There was enough space to arrange your things. The rooms are really spacious, with a very huge, comfortable bathroom, which is partly under the open sky. The room had good air conditioning. Bed was big, pillows and mattress were very good and comfortable.
Our room was at ground level and it was nice to spend time in the shade, on the spacious terrace. We recommend not leaving anything edible or valuable on the terrace, because every now and then a gang of monkeys comes from the jungle and will gladly pick up or throw away everything that is not tied up. Also during breakfast you will be watched carefully not only by waiters to fulfil your every wish, but also by 5-7 crows, who are just waiting for you to get up from the table and leave your food unattended. Fortunately, they are not as intrusive as sparrows and patiently and attentively wait their turn to occupy your table.
The a la carte breakfast was delicious, with various good, tasty choices. The dinner menu looked quite pricy with comparison to not vey big portions and we went to eat outside hotel twice because here you can have giant fresh lobster for the price of hotel's salad. The hotel has delicious espresso and also a very large wine collection, which we did not try, because the hot climate did not invite us to drink any alcohol.
The pool is beautifully designed, large, comfortable, with pleasantly cool water, which is very refreshing in the hot climate. Lots of sunbeds and umbrellas around the pool. The minus is that the pool is not shaded at any time of the day.
The beach is clean and wide, but immediately behind the hotel a more gloomy reality with a littered beach began. Swimming in the ocean directly opposite the hotel is problematic, because there is a coral reef around the peninsula on which the hotel is located. On the one hand, this is positive, because there are no big waves, but on the other hand, it is actually too shallow to swim there and you need coral slippers, because there are pieces of coral under your feet, which are unpleasant to step on. Slippers according to your size will be given to you at the hotel pool. If you want to swim directly in the ocean, then you have to walk 10 minutes along the beach, to the place where the coral reef ends and swim there.
The spa center is very well decorated, with a good atmosphere. The massage was very nice, relaxing and professional. Unfortunately, I don’t remember the girl’s name, but good that she is the only masseuse! She was great! On the day when I had been in the sun too much, she even brought me an aloe leaf from the hotel garden, which was very helpful.
The entire hotel staff is very diligent, attentive and responsive. I would especially like to mention those with whom we communicated the most - Thirasa and Sasitha in the restaurant, who did their job sincerely and attentively. Also Karthik and Chamop did their best as well as the people at the reception, the chef in the kitchen and the gardeners in the garden and on the beach did everything to make all the guests feel great! Some women in the garden and on the beach were working non stop from early morning till late noon. I hope they are paid accordingly for their intense work.
I would like to say hello to hotel's landscape architect and say that paths to the room's entrance doors  are planned vey funny and not comfortably at all. You and staff need to navigate through bushes and flowerbeds or almost through other guest's terrace, to get to your main door. The paths to the terrace doors of the rooms is very comfortable and well planned, but it's a pity that you can't lock this door from outside. So you need to choose between leaving your room open or lock the room, leave through the other door and then navigate the bushes.
title: A beautiful new beach hotel to relax right by the ocean.

placeInfo/address: 64, Peddlers Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text: I loved this hotel, the welcome drinks were amazing. The size of the room, the aspect, the bed and the bathroom were really lovely. It was a comfortable stay all round. Breakfast was great, plentiful and fresh, made to order. The location was so good, right in the centre of Galle Fort, easy to walk the entire Fort area. I was interested in shopping at Barefoot although the shop in Colombo is much better. I had a massage at the Spa Ceylon branch on the corner from the hotel. It was a fantastic massage experience. We had dinner at 'The Archives' a short walk from the hotel and it was amazing, would recommend. I really enjoyed this hotel. before dinner we went for a drink at the Galle Fort Hotel, we sat on the verandah and enjoyed the history of the Fort. For a one or two night stay the absence of a swimming pool was not an issue. The hotel room was very comfortable as were the common spaces.
title: Great experience at the Merchant Hotel

placeInfo/address: 64, Peddlers Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Sunset from the walls a must
text: A delightful character property sensitively converted to a hotel. Ideally situated near the centre of Galle's walled town. We had a nice room and a small but nice balcony overlooking the hotel's dining courtyard. This courtyard had a real vibe, with great food and an extensive wine list - popular with non residents. The hotel is superb for exploring Galle and its history and views from the walls over the ocean - a day enabled us to see all we wanted including a fantastic sunset. Only downside, no pool and we could have done with an afternoon dip as it is warm within the walled town. However the AC and the balcony were a good substitute. Attentive and friendly staff. Easy to recommend for a short stay in historic Galle.
title: An interesting, well presented and located hotel in historic Galle

placeInfo/address: 64, Peddlers Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text: Un hotel muy bonito,  desde el jardín, la decoración, las habitaciones,  hasta la comida, realmente de calidad. Hasta tiene restos arqueologicos dentro. El personal muy agradable y atento,  Lahma y demás personal nos han hecho la estancia muy agradable. Recomendable 100%.
title: Vivir una experiencia muy agradable

placeInfo/address: 64, Peddlers Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text: Fantastic stay at The Merchant. The staff were very good and always so friendly with a warm smile for us . The breakfast was outstanding, with several excellent choices  (the smoothie bowl was delicious!) The room was extremely comfortable and clean, to enter a fully air conditioned room after the heat outside was wonderful!
title: Highly recommend !

placeInfo/address: 64, Peddlers Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text: Very nice room, big and comfy bed, really friendly staff and a fantastic setting. We arrived at 9am after a 16 hour journey but were allowed to check into the room which was very helpful. Excellent breakfast. Perfect location in the centre of Galle close to restaurants and sites. Would recommend staying here.
title: Great hotel

placeInfo/address: 64, Peddlers Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
The Merchant is a lovely small hotel, situated inside Galle fort and in the hustle and bustle of the town.  We stayed for 5 nights. The room was comfortable and clean with excellent air conditioning which was good as Galle was very hot!
The breakfast was delicious. All the staff were helpful and welcoming.
We really enjoyed our stay.
title: Lovely boutique hotel.

placeInfo/address: 64, Peddlers Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
I came to Galle a night sooner than expected having cut short my stay at Weligama. The Merchant was, therefore, booked last minute and only for one night as had other accommodation booked already in Galle for later date but which was  full for my early arrival. I am so glad it was because really enjoyed stay at The Merchant. It is an old building with outside courtyard dining ( accepts walk ins). The welcome was very warm with a lovely welcome drink provided .

The hotel is in the Main Street of Galle Fort but it is hard for any accomodation in Galle Fort to be anywhere other than convenient . The Fort is very busy with tourists during the day but the room and hotel is quiet, without the huge tourist groups which featured at other hotels at which I stayed. 

The room was not that large but had an outdoor balcony .   The bed was very comfortable. Everything you could need- Filtered water , coffee and tea provided and refilled on request. Toiletries were good including the provision of a lovely smelling anti- Mosi cream. 

Breakfast was gorgeous and relaxed though the coffee was too strong for even me to drink. Ate here for lunch and on pricier side as you might Expect from a quality hotel but there are loads of places around at which to eat. 

I would recommend.
title: Great breakfast . Relaxing stay.

placeInfo/address: 64, Peddlers Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
ロケーション、サービス、お部屋、とても良かったです！

Thank you for providing good services and Ameen is very friendly then he is the best hotel staff!! I really appreciate to him!
title: Awesome stay

placeInfo/address: 64, Peddlers Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Fabulous hotel in an historical city.
text:
We stayed 2 nights as part of our tour through Sri-lanka, sadly for us was just not long enough. The hotel is situated for easy access to the fascinating Fort area which has so much history. We were fortunate to have a local guide who gave us a walking tour for a couple of hours. 
The hotel is situated to wander around the streets and shops. We had evening meal which was lovely and surroundings full of ambience. The breakfasts were superb with menu cards which was so refreshing after several hotel buffets. All the staff were extremely pleasant, attentive without being intrusive.
 Loved our room with balcony overlooking the courtyard. The welcome drink was delicious, I wish I'd made a note of the ingredients along with the name of the gorgeous lemongrass body lotion in our bathroom. 
We absolutely loved our stay,would highly recommend and was very sad to leave. 
I hope that one day we will return to sri-lanka and have the opportunity to stay again.
Thank you to everyone.
title: Beautiful hotel

placeInfo/address: 64, Peddlers Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text: Only one night here. In an excellent location within the fort. Beautiful room, staff very helpful and food good. Enjoyed being central and having restaurants and shops close by.  Would recommend staying longer than one night in Galle as lots to see and do.
title: Great centrally located hotel

placeInfo/address: 64, Peddlers Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
We only stayed here for one night but would have happily stayed longer. This was once a magnificent merchant’s house dating back to 1710 that has been converted into a modern and comfortable hotel. Our room was spacious, well furnished with a small balcony overlooking the roof at the front of the hotel. 

As with everywhere in Sri Lanka we had a warm welcome notwithstanding we were only there for one night. Their restaurant is open to the public with seating both inside and out and the food was very good - especially the breakfast which is ordered and served at the table..so no buffet breakfast! Hurrah! 

Centrally located in this fascinating World Heritage Site it’s perfect for wandering the historic streets and along the wall of the fort.
title: Magnificent old Merchant’s House

placeInfo/address: 64, Peddlers Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text: We went to dinner at the Merchant to celebrate our 5th wedding anniversary. Food and service were amazing! Our server Rizwan was fantastic. He gave great food recommendations, top notch wine reco as well. Did not steer us wrong everything was amazing! Would recommend this restaurant based on the food and service to anyone visiting Galle. Perfect date night as well. Big thanks to Rizwan.
title: Great restaurant, service and amazing food!

placeInfo/address: 64, Peddlers Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
I simply don’t know where to begin in the fantastic review of this brilliant hotel. The manager Chamika deserves so much credit for his management of this hotel. Its venue, its service, its food, its drink, its overall value for money is just brilliant. Yes, we were upgraded to a superb room and facilities, but the hotel overall was just world class. We ate lunch, two breakfasts, and due to a power cut during our stay, we had room service which was just fantastic. 

This was the last hotel at the end of our 11 days stay in Sri Lanka and what a way to round it all off. The city is steeped in history, as is this wonderful hotel. 

Our whole experience of this amazing hotel will be remembered forever. Thank you, Chamika and your whole team, for their excellence, service, skills and friendly nature. We will come back and stay with you as soon as we can.
title: The Merchant Galle Fort - Simply World Class

placeInfo/address: 64, Peddlers Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
This was a very pleasant stay. The room was small, but you expect that in a town. Our room had an outside seating area which was very pleasant. The location is central and convenient for everywhere within the Ramparts of Galle. 

The drinks and cake were excellent and breakfast was great. The other food looked good, but we ate out. 

The team were all very friendly, and attentive and made a point of remembering your preferences. 

One slight downside is that on two of our three days, we were awoken at 06:15 by a very noisy 'gulley sucker' cleaning the hotel drains for 30-40 minutes. I don't know if this happens every other day!
title: Smart, simple hotel. Great location. Lovely team

placeInfo/address: 64, Peddlers Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text: A well run stylish hotel set in a central position allowing for quick forays into the Fort. Exceptionally polite and welcoming reception ladies dressed beautifully in matching saris. Ravindu was an attentive waiter and served us our best breakfasts in Sri Lanka. Our room was very luxurious.
title: A stylish, welcoming and spoiling hotel.

placeInfo/address: 64, Peddlers Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
Fantastic location, excellent service, delicious food. Lovely airy room.

Also, a gold star for their laundry service - it's 1st class! They got food stains out of my dress and returned our clothes the next day - spotless, smelling divine & with a smile!
title: Great service and delicious food

placeInfo/address: 64, Peddlers Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
Très bel hôtel situé au cœur du fort de Galle
Un accueil chaleureux 
Un hôtel qui date du 17e rénové de façon élégante sans touché à l’histoire 
Une chambre magnifique avec balcon et grande douche 
Un petit déjeuner raffiné et d’un goût délicieux 
Explosion de saveur 
Une équipe toujours souriante et aux petits soins 
Rien à dire au top ! 
Le must serait une piscine comme l’hôtel d’à côté !
title: Charmant et accueillant

placeInfo/address: 64, Peddlers Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
Beautifully designed hotel; incorporation traditional & modern.
Excellent modern rooms & facilities; including Netflix.
Great food, friendly helpful staff & superb central location.
Just a shame there is no swimming pool.
Wi-Fi throughout.
This is a great choice when staying in the Fort area. Highly recommended !!!
title: EXCELLENT !!!

placeInfo/address: 64, Peddlers Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
This hotel exceeded our expectations in every way. Beautiful property. Our room was spacious and comfortable and felt luxurious…  a perfect way to end our trip. Staff were exceptionally helpful, friendly and kind. In particular, Rizwan always greeted us with a smile , glass of icy water, was warm and kind, and provided us great recommendations. A standout in our hospitality experiences in all Sri Lanka! 

Also, Azeem made everything about checking in and out a breeze and made sure we were comfortable with our room.

We even had an extremely pleasant jewelry shopping and dining experiences here. 

The Merchant is top notch!
title: Perfect end to an exceptional vacation.

placeInfo/address: 64, Peddlers Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
Albergo situato in una posizione top in galle , rapporto prezzo qualità , giusto , camere spaziose pulite ! Servizi disponibili , a partire dai ragazzi delle pulizie , al concierge, accoglienza professionali disponibili , staff molto attento e disponibile alle esigenze del cliente , guidati dal super manager Samith Chandrasena , che devo ammettere , riuscito a farci passare un piacevole week end nella struttura nonostante il tempo non dalla nostra parte ! Molto attento e disponibile a modificare e venirci incontro alle nostre esigenze ! Consigliato ! Ristorante dell’albergo , posso dire uno dei migliori di galle , anche se non soggiornate lì, vi consiglio di passare una serata a cena , ambiente elegante , molto bello ! Servizio rapido e professionale ! I
Nostro camerieri Dinusha - lakshan sono stati attenti per tutto il soggiorno ! Consigliato
title: Consigliato !

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest, 

Greetings from Jetwing Vil Uyana! 

Thank you for sharing your thoughtful reflections on your recent three-night stay with us at Jetwing Vil Uyana. I’m delighted to hear that you enjoyed our prime location for exploring Sigiriya Rock and that Samman, your dedicated butler, made your stay extra special—he’ll be thrilled to know his service stood out.
It’s wonderful that you embraced the charm of our Marsh Dwelling and its quirky “outdoor” bathroom, and that you found time to relax in your private spa bath after hiking. I must apologize for the unexpected frog encounter in the pipes—it seems our local wildlife fancied an upgrade! Rest assured, our engineering team is now double-checking all plumbing to make sure your next bath is frog-free. I’m glad you enjoyed spotting the playful monkeys by the pool and that our breakfast offerings hit the mark. I’m sorry, however, that our dinner menu became repetitive during your three-night stay. We’re already expanding seasonal options and rotating daily specials to keep our culinary program fresh and exciting for returning guests.

Regarding the open-air spa pavilions and the inevitable insects they attract, I appreciate your understanding of the balance between nature immersion and comfort. We are continually enhancing our citronella gardens, installing additional screening where possible, and providing extra insect-repellent amenities in each treatment room.

Thank you again for highlighting both what thrilled you and where we can improve. We hope to welcome you back soon in the future. 

Ayubowan! (May you live long!)

Anthony Ferdinand
General Manager
placeInfo/address: Rangirigama, Sigiriya 21120 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: Jetwing Vil Uyana, A Luxury Reserve
text:
We stayed here for 3 nights while we explored the area. It's in a good location for Sigiriya rock among other things. 

The staff are very friendly, our butler Samman was particularly great. We stayed in a Marsh Dwelling. The room itself was very quirky and a unique experience which was fun. The bathroom is "outside", while still being private. Perhaps an odd experience, but there were alternate loos as well. 

We used the bath/spa in the room after hiking Sigiriya. Lovely deep bath, but be careful of frogs in the pipes! We accidentally boiled some... 🐸 

Our pool area was lovely and we got to see some "greedy" monkeys playing in the trees which was very special. 

The food was ok, not great not bad. The menu was the same everyday, so 3 days was enough time to get bored of the offering. The breakfast however was good. Try and spot the crocodile!

The spa was ok, good value. A 90 minute massage was £45 GBP. However, the spa treatment rooms are open above the water so there were a lot of bugs. 

Bugs are an inevitable of this hotel, due to location etc. However they are doing a lot to try and counteract them (citronella planting etc.)
title: Unique Jungle stay near Sigiriya

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest, 

Greetings from Jetwing Vil Uyana!

Thank you for taking the time to share your wonderful experience at Jetwing Vil Uyana. It warms my heart to know that you enjoyed a lovely few days in our private, comfortable dwellings and found our setting as enchanting as we intended.  I’m delighted that our culinary team earned your praise with excellent dining throughout your stay, and that our spa treatments provided the perfect opportunity to unwind. I will be sure to pass along your kind words to our therapists.

Most of all, I’m thrilled to hear that Asitha looked after you so attentively. He takes great pride in anticipating and fulfilling every guest’s needs, and your recognition will mean the world to him. 

We look forward to welcoming you back to Jetwing Vil Uyana. Should you wish to explore any new experiences—perhaps a guided bird-watching tour through our wetlands or an intimate candlelit dinner over the rice paddies—please let us know in advance. It would be our pleasure to craft another memorable stay for you.

Ayubowan! (May you live long!)

Anthony Ferdinand
General Manager
placeInfo/address: Rangirigama, Sigiriya 21120 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: Jetwing Vil Uyana, A Luxury Reserve
text: We spent a lovely few days at Vil Uyana.   The villas and extremely comfortable and private.   The food was excellent.  The setting is beautiful.  The spa treatment was excellent.  Our butler, Asitha, looked after us extremely well.   He was obliging for anything we needed.
title: Beautiful place with amazing service.

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest, 

Greetings from Jetwing Vil Uyana! 

Thank you for taking the time to share your impressions of Jetwing Vil Uyana. I’m delighted to hear that you enjoyed the spacious Forest Dwelling with Pool. 

Please allow me to clarify our approach to comfort and sustainability: each of our dwellings are thoughtfully outfitted with a traditional sarong—placed in your room along with simple instructions on how to wear it—as an eco-friendly alternative to bathrobes. Of course, we are always happy to provide bathrobes upon request, and I apologize that this option wasn’t made clear during your arrival.

I also regret the delay at check-in and that your butler was on break when you arrived. We are reviewing our break schedules and enhancing our internal communications to ensure a warm, prompt welcome—especially when arrival times are confirmed in advance.
I’m glad you enjoyed your dinner and found our team’s service generally “mostly decent,” despite the brevity of your stay. Your feedback on those small lapses is invaluable and will help us raise our standards. Should you return for a longer stay, I would welcome the opportunity to personally ensure you have everything you need—from a swift check-in to uninterrupted butler service—and to arrange any activities you wish to enjoy in our eco-friendly sanctuary.

Thank you again for both your praise and your constructive comments. We hope you’ll stay with us again—perhaps for a longer break—to fully experience all that  Jetwing Vil Uyana has to offer.

Ayubowan! (May you live long!)

Anthony Ferdinand
General Manager
placeInfo/address: Rangirigama, Sigiriya 21120 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: Jetwing Vil Uyana, A Luxury Reserve
text:
We booked a pool villa (see photo), which was very spacious and well appointed, on two floors, with its own pool (obv!). Although the bedroom upstairs had an on suite toilet, the shower was downstairs.  But a first world problem, admittedly!

Weirdly for such an upscale hotel, bathrobes were not provided, especially given the remoteness of the shower from the bedroom, quite a walk!  

We only had one dinner and the food was very good

Service was not flawless but mostly decent enough.  Our room came with a butler but when we arrived (within 90 seconds of the exact time when we told them we would, in response to an earlier Whatsapp) he was on his break!  

The check-in was slow which is not what one wants after a long drive. 

We were only there one night, as a stopover to break the very long drive from the tea country to the north-east beyond Trincomalee.  So did not really have enough time to relax and enjoy the facilities. The resort is designed to be Eco-friendly, and has a spa, but we did not use so cannot comment. 

So a few small things prevent me giving five stars but don't let that put you off, especially if you like to commune with nature!!
title: Beautiful setting, lovely room

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Greetings from Jetwing Vil Uyana!

Thank you very much for taking the time to share your detailed impressions of your recent stay with us at Jetwing Vil Uyana. It was a pleasure hosting you and your family, and I’m delighted to hear that you enjoyed the spacious dwelling, private pool, and the tranquil rice-field views that make our eco-lodge truly unique. I’m especially grateful for your kind words about our team’s service.

We pride ourselves on anticipating our guests’ needs—though I understand that at times our attentiveness may feel abundant. Please rest assured that your comfort and privacy are always our foremost concern, and I will speak with our colleagues to maintain the perfect balance. I also appreciate your feedback regarding wildlife sightings. While the wetlands and surrounding forests are home to crocodiles, otters, and the elusive loris, Nature is wonderfully unpredictable. I’m pleased our team was able to secure a special evening excursion so you could experience the loris firsthand. We are continually working with our wildlife guides to enhance the availability and timing of such tours and will look into expanding options for crocodile and otter spotting.

Regarding our cuisine, we strive to deliver authentic meals that showcase the richness of Sri Lankan flavors, prepared with fresh, locally sourced ingredients. Our Executive Chef and I are continuously reviewing and refining our menu to introduce more signature dishes that blend traditional tastes with innovative culinary techniques. 

Finally, I understand your concerns about value for money. We strive to provide a one-of-a-kind eco-luxury experience, and your feedback is invaluable in ensuring that our rates and inclusions align with the exceptional standards we set for ourselves. I will review our packages and inclusions to see where we might better enhance the overall guest experience.

Thank you again for choosing Jetwing Vil Uyana and for your constructive comments. We would be honored to welcome you back in the future, giving us another opportunity to exceed your expectations.

Ayubowan! (May you live long)
Anthony Ferdinand
General Manager
placeInfo/address: Rangirigama, Sigiriya 21120 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: Jetwing Vil Uyana, A Luxury Reserve
text:
Nous avons séjourné en famille (5 personnes) au Jetwing Vil Uyana et avons beaucoup apprécié le lodge spacieux avec sa petite piscine privative et la vue sur la rizière. Le cadre est vraiment unique, parfait pour se déconnecter et profiter de la nature.

Le service est irréprochable, avec un personnel toujours aux petits soins — parfois même un peu trop présent à notre goût, mais cela reste un signe de qualité.

Nous avions choisi cet établissement pour son côté “éco-lodge” et l’observation des animaux, mais nous sommes restés un peu sur notre faim : pas de crocodiles ni de loutres aperçus durant notre séjour. À notre arrivée, on nous informe que les sorties nocturnes pour voir les Loris sont complètes… Heureusement, le personnel a trouvé une solution et nous avons eu la chance d’en voir un.

Côté restauration, la cuisine était correcte, mais rien d’exceptionnel pour un établissement de ce standing.

Le vrai point négatif reste le prix, que nous avons trouvé excessif par rapport à l’expérience globale. Si le cadre est splendide, le rapport qualité-prix n’est pas totalement justifié selon nous.

En résumé : un séjour agréable dans un environnement magnifique, mais une légère déception compte tenu des attentes et du tarif élevé.
title: Séjour en famille dans un cadre exceptionnel mais expérience mitigée par rapport au prix

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Greetings from Jetwing Vil Uyana!

It was an absolute pleasure hosting you at the start of your Sri Lankan journey, and I am delighted to hear how much you enjoyed the luxurious harmony of nature and comfort at Jetwing Vil Uyana. I’m thrilled that your two-storey “Forest Dwelling” with its private pool and open courtyard provided a memorable blend of exotic wildlife encounters and intimate relaxation—eight-legged friends included!

Our design intentionally immerses guests in this unique eco-system, and I’m glad you appreciated the thoughtful layout of bath and bedroom facilities for both convenience and an authentic jungle experience. Thank you for your kind words about our à la carte breakfast and dinner offerings. Our culinary team takes great pride in crafting fresh, flavorful dishes, and it’s wonderful to know the service exceeded your expectations as well. I’ll be certain to share your compliments with them. 

I’m also pleased that you found the resort easily walkable around the lake and that our spa’s soothing massage added an extra layer of relaxation to your stay.

Thank you again for your glowing feedback. We look forward to welcoming you back whenever your travels bring you this way again.

Ayubowan! (May you live long)
Anthony Ferdinand
General Manager
placeInfo/address: Rangirigama, Sigiriya 21120 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: Jetwing Vil Uyana, A Luxury Reserve
text:
Das luxuriöse Jetwing war direkt unsere erste Unterkunft zu Beginn einer umfangreichen Sri Lanka-Rundreise. Wir waren sehr angetan von der exotischen Umgebung mit vielerlei Wildtieren und unserem großartigen zweistöckigen "Forrest Dwelling" mit eigenem Pool. Rund um einen nach oben offenen Innenhof (Achtung nach Sonnenuntergang Krabbeltiere auch der 8beinigen Art), liegen im Erdgeschoss WC, Badewanne, Dusche und Waschbecken. Im ersten Stock ist der geräumige überdachte Schlafraum mit separatem WC - Gottseidank, denn nachts wollte ich nicht nach unten ins Vivarium.

Das á la Carte Menü zum Frühstück und Abendessen war genauso wie der Service hervorragend. Die gesamte Anlage rund um einen See ist sehr gut konzipiert, gepflegt und gut begehbar. Wir genossen auch die wohltuende Massage im herrlichen Spa.
title: Luxus und Exotik im Einklang

placeInfo/address: Rangirigama, Sigiriya 21120 Sri Lanka

text: It was the best hotel we’ve ever stayed in . The wetlands were truly magical and it felt like you were living amongst the animals and nature . text: I thoroughly enjoyed this hotel and wish we had a longer stay than 3 nights. The property is stunning, set in a wetland with huge bungalows that are incredibly private and beautiful, where every detail has been carefully considered. We felt very comfortable and at home, and the staff are very attentive. The food is lovely, and we really enjoyed the different set menus each night. Unfortunately we got rained off the loris watching tour, but still had an enjoyable experience, with a very knowledgeable and friendly guide. We can’t fault this property at all. Yes there is a lot of wildlife around, because that’s the nature of the place. Personally, we loved it.
title: Beautiful, comfortable and well run sanctuary

placeInfo/address: Rangirigama, Sigiriya 21120 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: Jetwing Vil Uyana, A Luxury Reserve
text: The Jetwing Vil Uyana is an unusual hotel which blends into its natural surroundings. When wandering through the grounds, you will see monkeys birds, fish and the evenings are filled with the sounds of frogs. There are Fishing Cats and even a crocodile but we didn't see either. We had a Garden Room which was fine but maybe a little tired. Some rooms were being upgraded while we were there so, hopefully all will get a refresh. The food was great and the whole ambience at the hotel was so peaceful. My only slight negative would be the distance from some rooms to Reception and the restaurants. It is along sandy paths and could get quite muddy if raining. Despite this, we would still highly recommend a stay at the Vil Uyana. We would like to give a very special mention to Ravi (Ravinder). He was an absolute star and ensured we had whatever we needed. He is such a lovely guy and if you have Ravi assigned to you, you are very fortunate indeed!
title: Jetwing Vil Uyana

placeInfo/address: Rangirigama, Sigiriya 21120 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: Jetwing Vil Uyana, A Luxury Reserve
text: Our night visit to the Loris trail at Jetwing Vil Uyana was an unforgettable experience. Along with our well experience guide, Yesitha, we were able to see number of elusive nocturnal creatures like lorises, a civet and a cat snake. It was an amazing and adventurous experience overall, able to see and photograph these rare creatures even during a short period of time. Big thanks go to Yesitha for tracking these wildlife and explaining their behaviours. Would highly recommend to anyone to witness these elusive animals, especially the Grey Slender Loris.
title: Amazing experience on the Loris trail

It is close to Sigiriya so excellent for visiting that historic site.
Thank you Vil Uyana!! We had a unique experience!!!!

The food, especially the curries, was excellent. 
Our butler, Prasanna, did a fantastic job & was always on hand to make sure we had a great stay. Our room was kept spotless by Migala (apologies if the spelling is wrong) and he always made sure we had plenty of water & created very clever towel art.
This was one of favourite places to stay in Sri Lanka & I highly recommend staying there.
title: Perfect location for nature lovers

text: The Westbury Palace gave us an exceptional hotel experience. All staff members were incredibly friendly and attentive to our needs. The manager was kind enough to give us a new room to freshen up after attending a wedding, post-checkout. The food was delectable and the portions were generous. placeInfo/address: No. 17 Udupussellawa Road, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
roomTip: If you are staying at this hotel, have a clear schedule because you will not want to leave the hotel once you get there.
text:
The style, architecture and furnishings were the most anesthetic we have ever seen. Every corner of it is picturesque and Instagram-worthy.The hotel itself held a grandeur due to its heritage and history.
The rooms were very spacious (especially compared to the commercial-type hotels) and luxurious. The food was delicious and the servings very generous. The dinning area in itself was a luxury.
They have a heated pool (it is impossible not to have a heated pool in this climate) available at any time of the day and a separate jacuzzi room which is included in the room reservation. 
The lawn is brilliant both in space and landscaping. It is very nice to have an afternoon tea and relax in the gardens.
And the staff is very helpful and accommodating.

Overall, it is one of the best stays we have ever experienced. I recommend experiencing this hotel at least once in your life, just to feel like a royal.
title: Have a Brilliant, Royal Palace Stay

This boutique hotel is perfect for a peaceful and charming getaway. Highly recommend it to everyone!
