text:
It's a ROYAL experience..👑️ Thank you Westbury Palace..!♥️

I and my wife visited Westbury Palace for my wife's birthday. It became her best birthday ever.♥️🥰

We had a very warm welcome at the arrival and after the hotel tour we were escorted to our room. We were SURPRISED. We were upgraded to the HIGHEST room category of the palace. Robert London Suite. Room was very comfy, clean and spacious with a seating area by the heating place. And a nice chocolate platter was there in the room for us to enjoy. Swimming pool is heated. it was really good to enjoy outside in a cool climate. And once you are there don't forget to order some moktails or cocktails to sip while enjoying the pool. 

And we played billiord and moved for the dinner. DOUBLE SURPRISE..! Our butler Yaso and hotel team arranged us a ROMANTIC CANDLE LIGHT DINNER..Table decoration with friesh roses was very beautiful and food was very delicious. Importantly the food was really fresh and no artificial ingredients.

Then we could spend time at Sauna and Jacuzzi too..After the breakfast again SURPRISED..! Our butler Yaso and Hotel team arranged a Birthday cake for my wife to celebrate and to make the moment remebered. Baloons and flowers added more party vibe..🎂💐🎈

After the lunch we checked out. But this experience will be in our memory for life. 🥰♥️

Thank you Mr.Nihal, Residence manager for your incredible and warm hospitality.
Thank you Mr.Pushpakanth for all the support and communication since making the reservation.
And thank you Yaso, our butler for taking extra effort to make our stay more memorable and comfortable.
Thank you all the chefs for your mouth watering food. 
♥️Thank you everyone ♥️

Much ♥️Westbury Palace
If you wanna feel royalty, Visit Westbury Palace 👑️
title: It's a Royal experience at Westbury Palace 👑️

The food was delicious with a good variety at breakfast, and the service from the hotel staff was friendly and helpful.

Overall, a lovely hotel for both relaxation and sightseeing. Highly recommended if you’re staying in Colombo!

We would love to visit this hidden gem again.

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Thank you so much for taking the time to share your experience at Jetwing Kurulubedda. We are truly delighted to hear that you and your husband had such a pleasant and relaxing stay with us in April.

It’s wonderful to know that you enjoyed the comfort and cleanliness of the chalet, the peaceful natural surroundings, and the delicious meals prepared by our talented chefs, Iroshan and Ashen. Your kind words about our team mean a lot. Shantha and Sameera will be thrilled to hear how much you appreciated their attentive service, and Sanjeewa will be happy to know his hands-on approach made a positive impression.

Creating a serene and personalized experience is what we strive for, and we’re so glad to hear we succeeded during your stay.

We look forward to welcoming you back on your next visit to Sri Lanka!

Ayubowan! (May you live long)

Indika Gamage
Head of Galle Hotels
Jetwing Kurulubedda
placeInfo/address: Mahamudali Mawatha, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
My husband and I spent two days at Kurulubedda Galle, in April 2025.
It was a very pleasant experience.
The chalet  was clean and well equipped. The food was tasty and plentiful.
The surrounding atmosphere was so very peaceful and relaxing. The sound of the birds chirping in the morning was very pleasant.
What impressed us the most about the place was the service that was provided. There were two butlers assigned to our chalet, Shantha and Sameera. They did an excellent job of serving us. They went above and beyond their call of duty in performing their job.
The meals that were cooked by the two chefs, Iroshan and Ashen were very tasty.
The manager, Sanjeewa was very hands on.
We would definitely stay at this place the next time we visit Sri Lanka.
title: Amazing stay

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Ravi,

It is truly an honour and a heartfelt privilege to read your beautiful words—and to welcome you back for your third visit in just six months. Guests like you are the very soul of Hilton Yala, and I cannot thank you enough for the trust, loyalty, and warmth you continue to show our team.

From the moment we first had the pleasure of hosting you, your passion for wildlife, eye for detail, and appreciation for Sri Lanka’s natural and cultural heritage have inspired us. Your vivid description of the premium villa, the bespoke amenities, and the experience of immersing in the buffer zone’s serene wilderness is deeply appreciated—and beautifully articulated. It is clear this place resonates with you on a very personal level, and that means the world to all of us.

Chef Jerome and his team will be overjoyed by your praise—he leads his culinary brigade with both passion and precision, and to know it has become a highlight of your visits is incredibly rewarding. Indika and the F&B team, our housekeeping and buggy associates, security colleagues including Chandima, and everyone across Front Office join me in thanking you for the special recognition.

Of course, your words for Sajith and the Ranger Team are especially meaningful. We all know your love for wildlife runs deep—and to hear that this visit brought four leopard sightings and rich wildlife encounters is thrilling. You are not just a guest to our Rangers; you are a kindred spirit in the field, and their respect for you is genuine and heartfelt.

The way you’ve described the fishing experience, dune walks, and bush walks captures what we hope every guest comes to understand—that Hilton Yala is more than a resort, it’s a place to reconnect with nature, self, and soul. The childlike wonder you described during the fishing trip brought a smile to all our faces.

As someone who knows Sri Lanka intimately and has seen the world, your praise means more than we can express. Thank you for recognizing the sincerity of Sri Lankan hospitality, and for letting us be part of your journey home, in every sense of the word.

We look forward to welcoming you back soon—with more wildlife, more stories, and many more memories to share.

With deepest gratitude and warmest regards,
placeInfo/address: Palatupana, Yala National Park 95000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Just book and go. No turning back.
text:
This was my third visit in six months, five nights on each occasion. 
There's an absolutely great reason why we will visit often. 
The resort is a stunningly architecturally designed, lovely place in lush surroundings in the Yala buffer zone, sensitive to protect its environs. The luxury is next level, love the amazing and superb premium villa with private plunge pool, hi tech and tastefully crafted and  luxuriously appointed interior, amenities and  unsurpassed comfort. 
The cuisine is extraordinary - Exec chef Jerome and team delight at every meal, the service is exceptional- Front office (Vino and team including the tireless buggy drivers), F&B (Indika and team), Housekeeping, Security (Chandima and team) and of course all graciously managed by the GM- Gitanjali. The spa and gym are world class as well.
But as a keen life long wildlife enthusiast, the primary reason for my unswerving loyalty  is the     superb best in class skill, utterly amazing knowledge and client focus of the Ranger Team,  built, led and nurtured by Sajith, the Head Ranger.
This visit yielded four separate and breathtaking leopard sightings deep in the jungle in addition to several large and smaller mammal sightings, stunning variety of bird life (including endangered species) sightings and the various  rich eco-systems.
I also went on a fishing excursion that is offered,  that was absolutely fabulous and enjoyable (Ranger accompanied), appreciating the National Park from a very different perspective from the warm Indian Ocean,  spotting wildlife on the beach at dawn and subsequent childlike jubilation reeling in Trevally, Barracuda and other species while fighting to bring in King Mackerel (locally prized Seer).  Another couple of great experiences that are also offered are the Ranger accompanied Dune Walks and Bush Walks. These experiences will keep your senses on edge in a delightful way. Totally immersed in nature, as intended.
In context, my wife and I grew up in Sri Lanka and know the land of our birth. We are Americans and I have been extremely fortunate to travel to almost seventy countries with work and on holidays. 
Hilton Yala Resort embodies many facets of the best that Sri Lanka offers including extraordinary and legendary Sri Lankan hospitality and genuine friendliness.
title: Wonderful and Serendipitous Experiences!

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Rudi,

Thank you ever so much for your beautifully written review and for choosing to spend five nights with us at Hilton Yala.

We are truly delighted that your stay was filled with peace, connection to nature, and authentic Sri Lankan hospitality. It brings us immense joy to know you appreciated the architectural design, your private pool suite, and the serenity of our communal pool—a perfect way to unwind after an early morning safari.

Your kind words for our team, from Ms. Gitanjali and Chef Jerome to our waitstaff, spa therapists, buggy drivers, and housekeeping colleagues, mean the world to us. We are incredibly proud of the genuine warmth and attentiveness they bring to each guest interaction, and your recognition will be shared with great pride.

It was a pleasure having you with us during the Sinhala and Tamil New Year celebrations. Including our guests in these meaningful traditions is something we hold dear, and we’re thrilled that you enjoyed both the reverence and the joyful moments—especially “pin the eye on the elephant” 🐘!

Though the elusive leopard remained hidden this time, we're glad your personal safari with our ranger still offered memorable wildlife encounters. We hope there will be another opportunity for you to return and perhaps catch sight of one on your next visit.

Thank you once again for your generous recommendation and for making us a part of your Sri Lankan holiday memories. We look forward to welcoming you back to Hilton Yala for another unforgettable escape in the wild.

Warmest regards,
placeInfo/address: Palatupana, Yala National Park 95000 Sri Lanka
text:
What a gem this relatively new Hilton Resort in the Yala National Park is. We had the most relaxing 5 nights here surrounded by the wilderness of Yala National Park. The fresh architectural design of the resort is reflected in the high quality of the large room/suite we had (with its own pool). The large communal pool was a wonderful place to languish away the day after an early morning safari. 

All the hotel staff, from Gitanjali the General Manager, Jerome the head chef, our two beautiful waitresses,  the pool staff, the buggy drivers, the housekeeping staff and the two women in the spa who gave us super massages, could not have been more welcoming and friendly. They all took time to speak to us regularly in the kind and gentle nature of the Sri Lankan character. 

We felt honoured to be included in the hotel’s Sri Lankan New Year rituals and activities, mixing with hotel staff and some hotel guests. At times reverential and then some fun activities such as pin the eye of the elephant 🐘. 

Our Safari was very personal with just the two of us and our knowledgeable ranger.  We saw many fine examples of Sri Lankan wildlife, although we missed out on spotting a leopard, but that is in the nature of a safari and trying to spot an elusive wild cat such as this. 

We can highly recommend this beautiful resort. We loved it. Thank you to all you who made this such a memorable part of our holiday in Sri Lanka.
title: The Wow Factor Hilton Yala Resort

text:
Spectacular. Incredible surrounds. Hard to imagine you're IN the national park until elephants etc walk past your amazing zoom. The rooms are spacious and delightful. Incredible art work, clearly a lot of thought went into design and also supporting local artists. 
Yala safaris are fabulous. If you ride with Hilton rangers, you'll get a great download. Fingers crossed you see leopards (we did)  and of course the other majestic mammals. Love the elephants. And don't not appreciate the amazing bird life. 
The spa is amazing, and the pool is gorgeous!
Second last, OMG the restaurant. Chief Chef Jerome is a magician on top of what clearly is a man with incredible skill and talent. Hilton Yala could or should be a destination resort just to indulge in his amazing creations. 
And of course, lastly, Hilton Yala is like a super  6 star destination resort, it gives the likes of four seasons or st regis a run for their money, thanks to the wonderful staff. Professional is one thing but the genuine friendliness is next level stuff. So, full credit to Ms Gitanjali and all her team!!!
title: Go nowhere else but here when in Yala!

ownerResponse/text:
Dear mmth,

Thank you for sharing your detailed feedback. We truly appreciate your kind words about our service and the safari experience, and we understand your perspective on the overall atmosphere.

As Hilton Yala is uniquely located inside the national park, guest safety is our top priority. The requirement for a ranger to access the beach and the use of buggies after dark are important safety measures due to the presence of wildlife in the area. These precautions ensure a secure and immersive experience while respecting the natural habitat surrounding us.

Regarding the safari experience, we recognize that Block 1 can get quite busy, especially during leopard sightings. For guests seeking a more tranquil and immersive experience, we often recommend exploring other areas such as Block 5, which offers breathtaking landscapes and abundant wildlife in a quieter setting.

We sincerely appreciate your constructive feedback and hope to welcome you again for another memorable stay, perhaps with a fresh perspective on the diverse and untamed beauty of Yala.

Best regards,
placeInfo/address: Palatupana, Yala National Park 95000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Ein Zimmer oben (Jacuzzi) in den Villen bietet etwas Ausblick, unten (plunge pool) eher Dschungelfeeling
text:
Warum keine Bestnote obwohl wirklich alles perfekt ist, und da kann ich mich den meisten anderen Bewertungen nur anschließen. ABER: es passt irgendwie hier nicht hin. Hat keinen lokalen Stil, könnte überall auf der Welt stehen. Auch die Tatsache, dass man an den Strand nur mit Ranger darf (auf die Idee zu schwimmen würde man an der Stelle sowieso nicht kommen) und einen Buggy braucht, um sich bei Dunkelheit in de Anlage zu bewegen (und es gab nie Wartezeiten) - fühlt sich komisch an. 
Die beiden Safaris mit dem Ranger waren sehr gut, viele Erklärungen und tolle Eindrücke. Als dann ein Leopard gesichtet wurde begann der Stress. Alle Jeeps fuhren a die Stelle, nach Schlangestehen und Retten eines anderen Jeeps haben wir ihn auch gesehen. Natürlich kann für die Überfüllung des Parks das Hotel nichts, aber auch das passt in das etwas absurde Bild. 
Sorry, jammern auf sehr hohem Niveau, aber fühlt sich irgendwie nicht nach Sri Lanka an.
title: Alles perfekt - aber doch nur eine 4

We came to the Yala Hilton on the recommendation of a friend of ours. Two couples 2 nights . We wish we stayed three nights. I read the reviews of some of the guest and could not disagree more . This is a magical place great value for the money. The Park was a bit of a disappointment after Wilpattu. But the staff at the Hilton from top management to the wait staff and pool attendants were welcoming . We brought some friends with us and they too thoroughly enjoyed their stay.
I would avoid block 1 if possible. 
Kudos to the Hilton team. We have stayed in many a hotel from both coasts of the US to Australia , New Zealand , other parts of Asia . I would say by far this place exceeded our expectations.
We are coming back with our kids and grand kids !
title: Magical place from Jurassic Park 😂😍

Dear Malith,

Thank you for sharing your wonderful experience at Hilton Yala! We’re thrilled to hear that your stay with family was a memorable one and that our modern and stylish resort, along with our amazing team, made such a positive impression.

It’s fantastic that you had such an incredible safari experience with our Hilton guide and jeep service—seeing a leopard, elephants, and so much diverse wildlife must have been truly special! The wildlife corridors within the property do make for a unique experience, and we appreciate your note about safety when exploring the surroundings.

We’re also delighted that you found the rooms cozy and comfortable and that our team, especially Bhasura, Shashi, Kesha, Eranga, Seshan, Manohari, and Chef Jerome, contributed to making your stay exceptional. We’ll be sure to share your kind words with them!

We truly appreciate your review and look forward to welcoming you and your family back for another unforgettable stay.

placeInfo/address: Palatupana, Yala National Park 95000 Sri Lanka
text:
Stayed at Hilton Yala for two nights with family, and it was a memorable experience. It is a modern and stylish resort, with an amazing Front Office, Restaurant, and Housekeeping staff that provide excellent services.

Situated very close to Yala Park, hired Hilton’s guide and safari jeeps to visit the park and saw a leopard, elephants (many), wild buffalos, deer, samba, crocs, and many birds. There was a leopard sighting near the hotel and an elephant visited the hotel at night as there are corridors within the property for animals. So, don’t go for walks!

Rooms are cozy and large, the bed is very comfortable, well-stocked bar, etc.. please note “no room service” due to the animals that roam within the property.

A special mention and thank you to Bhasura, Shashi, Kesha (Front office), Eranga and Seshan (Buggy team), Manohari at the restaurant, and Chef Jerome who made our stay memorable.
title: Excellent Resort in Yala

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Frank,

Thank you for taking the time to share your experience with us. We truly appreciate your kind words about our high-quality accommodation, knowledgeable safari guides, and the hospitality of our team. It is wonderful to hear that these aspects of your stay were enjoyable.

At the same time, we sincerely regret that certain areas did not meet your expectations. Guest communication is of utmost importance to us, and we are concerned to hear about your experience with unanswered emails and your impression of our reception team. Please rest assured that we take your feedback seriously, as we are committed to continuous improvement.

Regarding the dining experience, we regret any misunderstanding about the menu options. Our goal is always to provide a variety of choices to cater to different preferences, and we appreciate your comments as they help us enhance the clarity of our offerings.

As we have not been able to trace the specifics of your concerns, we would truly appreciate the opportunity to understand more in detail. If you could kindly reach out to us directly at vino.ramakrishnan@hilton.com and gitanjali.chakravarthy@hilton.com, we would love the chance to personally address your concerns and ensure your feedback is acted upon meaningfully.

Once again, thank you for your time, and we hope to have the opportunity to welcome you back and provide you with an even better experience in the future.

Best regards,
placeInfo/address: Palatupana, Yala National Park 95000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Always busy on weekends
text:
Pros:High quality accommodation, knowledgeable safari guides, nice staff on the whole.
Cons: very poor communication, many unanswered emails, not impressed by staff on reception and I include the lady who is the general manager .
They have 4 different menus but don’t tell you this , you will be given the ‘pan Asian concept’ menu ( the most expensive)in the evenings , which is not well executed. It was only when we sent the food back that we were told  other options were available .
title: Good , could be great

ownerResponse/text:
Dear CaroUsTrip,

Thank you for your incredible review! We’re absolutely delighted to hear that Hilton Yala was the highlight of your stay in Sri Lanka and that you found it truly worth the experience.

It’s wonderful to know that you enjoyed every aspect of your stay, from the warm welcome and unique wildlife encounters to the comfort of your villa, the attention to detail from our housekeeping team, and the dining experience. placeInfo/address: Palatupana, Yala National Park 95000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Bed is a bit too hard
text:
Wow !! What an amazing resort. The best hotel I stayed in Sri Lanka. It worth the price.

The welcome was amazing from the moment we stepped in. Monkeys were playing on the roof of the hotel.

Lobby is very modern with a view on the resort.

Bedroom is like a villa. Huge, very clean, comfortable. We had our own pool which was a little bit colder than the main pool but still very nice. 
Bathroom was the best part of the room. One of the biggest I have ever had. Very modern. 

Housekeeping did an amazing job making up our room twice a day, that was great because of the dust from the safaris.
Towels and toileteries were replenished twice a day.
Bottled water was complimentary.

The main pool was very warm and lovely. I loved it.

The restaurant was very well decorated. You can eat inside and outside. Both were great.
Food was very tasty, but more expensive than anywhere else in Sri Lanka. 
Breakfast and diner were both amazing.

We had a safari from another compagny than Hilton. They picked us up in front of the lobby and the hotel was very closed to the National Park.
There is no barrier between the park and the hotel (we saw an elephant very close to the hotel). That explains the few restrictions inside the hotel (no room service).

It's the first Hilton of this kind.
And it totally worth it.
title: Amazing experience !

text:

The highlight of our trip was my proposal to my partner. I would really like to thank the General Manager, Gitanjali who helped me plan a truly unforgettable surprise at “Lanthaaruma”, the picturesque outdoor dining experience on the beach. The hotel staff went all out arranging a lovely candlelit dinner complete with flowers and personal touches that made the moment special. We would also like to shoutout Malith & Janath from the kitchen, Chanaka and Hiran from F&B and the Head Ranger Sajith for their impeccable service during the outdoor dinner. 

The food at Hilton Yala, curated by Head Chef Jerome, was simply out of this world. Each dish was an absolute masterpiece, and we could not get enough!

The private pool in the room truly elevated the experience, providing us with the perfect relaxation after a safari. 
I would definitely recommend Hilton Yala for anyone looking for the perfect luxurious get away!

title: Super erholt in einer traumhaften Umgebung

placeInfo/address: Thalgahapitiya Road, Kosgoda 80570 Sri Lanka
text:
Mit den Erfahrungen aus meinen letzten 3 Ayurvedakuren fliege ich im August/September 2024 zu meiner 4. Ayurvedakur nach Sri Lanka ins das Garden Beach Ayurveda Resort. 
Einige Rezensionen aus dem Internet und vor allem die herausragende Betreuung der Ärztin Dr. Sandya Mendis, die ich bereits aus einem anderen Hotel kenne, haben mich dazu bewogen, dieses Hotel auszuwählen. 
Nun, am Ende der Kur kann ich kaum in Worte fassen, wie herausragend dieses Hotel wirklich ist. 
Die ärztliche Betreuung des Ärzteteams, zu dem auch 2 jüngere, sehr fähige Ärzte gehören, Frau Dr. Sewwandi und Herr Dr. Pandukha und wie oben schon angesprochen, Frau Dr. Sandya Mendis sind von allem was ich bisher in meinem Leben erlebt habe, unübertroffen. 
Hinzufügen möchte ich, dass ich mich seit 40 Jahren mit nichts anderem als Gesundheit und körperlicher Fitness beschäftige. 
Nirgends habe ich bisher soviel Liebe zum Detail, Wohlwollen, Kompetenz erfahren. 
Zeitdruck ist in diesem Hotel ein Fremdwort. 
Es ist keine Frage offen geblieben und das Kurergebnis lässt sich u.a. an meinem verbesserten Hautbild, besserem Schlaf und mehr innerer Ruhe erkennen. 

Jan, der Manager des Gästebereichs verfügt über ein Ayurveda Wissen, was nicht einfach angelesen ist. Jede meiner Fragen wird von ihm mehr als ausreichend beantwortet. Jan kommt aus der Praxis, auch für sich selbst lebt er eine ayurvedische Lebensweise. Er hat sich im Laufe mehrerer Jahrzehnte ein enormes Fachwissen angeeignet und dieses auch schriftlich festgehalten, um auf alle Fragen bestens vorbereitet zu sein und mir Hilfsmittel in schriftlicher Form mitgeben zu können. Egal welches Gemüse, welche Frucht, welche Kräuter, er weiß stets die Wirkung und kann Detailgenau sagen, ob es nun gut für mich ist, oder ob ich dieses oder jenes nur mäßig verzehren soll. 
Durch seinen längeren Aufenthalt in Deutschland sind ihm unsere Probleme mit Leistungsdruck, schneller, höher und weiter sowie Zeitdruck u.v.a. sehr wohl bekannt. 
Das macht es ihm möglich, sich in jeden Gast bzw. die Bedürfnisse eines jeden, hineinzuversetzen.    
Wer an historischem Wissen interessiert ist, findet in Jan ebenso einen kompetenten und interessanten Gesprächspartner. Die Gespräche mit ihm habe ich sehr genossen. 

Die Anwendungen werden von einem Therapeutenteam durchgeführt, welches über einen enormen Erfahrungsschatz verfügt. Liebevoll und stets bemüht für mich das richtige Maß zu finden, habe ich jede einzelne Behandlung sehr genossen. 
Hand- Kopf- und auch Fußbehandlungen kann ich direkt mit Meerblick, draußen im Garten genießen. 

Ich verbringe im Ayurveda Garden wirklich eine wunderbare, unvergessliche Zeit für meine körperliche und geistige Erholung. 

Was die Küche in diesem Hotel leistet, ist mit all meinen Erfahrungen ebenfalls unübertroffen. Detailgenau wird die Kost auf mich abgestimmt. Die kurzen Informationswege vom Ärzteteam und der Küche machen dies möglich. 
Liebevoll dekoriert, vom Gericht selbst, bis zur Tischdekoration, genieße ich jede Mahlzeit und spüre, wie bekömmlich und heilsam sie für mich ist. 

Einen herzlichen Dank möchte ich auch an alle richten, die im Hintergrund dieser Anlage arbeiten. 
Das Team an der Rezeption, der Yogalehrer, der Tai Chi Lehrer, der Gärtner, die Handwerker, Nalin der Tuc Tuc Fahrer, die Reinigungskräfte, die für die überaus sauberen und ordentlichen Zimmer zuständig sind, alle machen einen wunderbaren Job und haben mir unvergessliche 18 Tage im Ayurveda Garden beschert. 

Herzlichen Dank auch an die Leitung des Hotels, an Udyoga. Er hat mich bereits vor der Kur per mail bestens informiert und begleitet. Es ist ihm gelungen, in diesem Hotel ein Team zusammenzustellen, was in der Ayurvedaszene in Sri Lanka seines Gleichen sucht. Gerne komme ich wieder und lasse mich verwöhnen. 

Vielen vielen Dank an alle, für diese schöne Zeit. 
Dagmar Krishna Shakti
title: Ein Dank von Herzen an dieses wunderbare Hotel

placeInfo/address: Thalgahapitiya Road, Kosgoda 80570 Sri Lanka
text: Dopo 27 anni sono tornata in Sri Lanka per una cura Panchakarma e avevo le idee abbastanza chiare su quello che cercavo: una clinica non troppo grande e con uno staff competente e motivato. Dopo una selezione tra tante offerte sul web, sono pienamente soddisfatta della scelta fatta. L’hotel ha dodici camere ed è veramente pulito e ben tenuto. Tutto lo staff è gentilissimo, professionale e accogliente, seriamente interessato al raggiungimento degli obiettivi del cliente, a partire dai medici e terapisti, fino allo staff della cucina, direzione, reception e manutenzione. Mi sento quindi di consigliare questo resort, con tutta la serenità possibile, a chi è interessato a seguire seriamente un programma di panchakarma in un ambiente “familiare” e protetto, che offre tuttavia anche la possibilità di soddisfare curiosità turistiche nei dintorni.  Sicuramente tornerò il prossimo anno per un periodo più lungo.
title: Completamente soddisfatta dell’esperienza Ayurvedica 🩵

placeInfo/address: Thalgahapitiya Road, Kosgoda 80570 Sri Lanka
text:
Ich kam auf Empfehlung meiner Schwester in dieses Resort und war von Anfang an total begeistert! Es ist ein kleines Resort direkt am Strand mit einem sehr schön angelegtem Garten und einem Pool. Im Garten kann man Streifenhörnchen, Krebse, Libellen und allerlei andere Tiere beobachten. Die Zimmer sind groß und sauber, alle mit Balkon und Meerblick. Die Mahlzeiten sind auf die individuellen Doshas abgestimmt und unheimlich lecker.

Im Resort gibt es drei Ayurveda-Arzte, die sehr genau und kompetent arbeiten und mit entsprechendem Feingefühl auf die einzelnen körperlichen, geistigen und seelischen Probleme eingehen. Man bekommt hier mindestens vier Behandlungen am Tag. Die Therapeutinnen und Therapeuten arbeiten sehr professionell und fragen während der Behandlung auch nach dem Wohlbefinden. Danke für die sehr gute ärztliche und therapeutische Betreuung!

Durch die geringe Anzahl der Zimmer und der Gäste ist man nicht irgendein Gast sondern wird als individueller Mensch wahrgenommen. Wünsche oder Bedürfnisse wurden jederzeit passend umgesetzt und möglich gemacht. Ganz gleich ob Manager oder Gärtner, Nachtsecurity oder Fahrer, Therapeuten oder Köche - ausnahmslos ALLE Mitarbeiter waren immer sehr offen, zugewandt, freundlich, respektvoll und herzlich! Danke für die vielen schönen und lustigen Momente!

Den Gästebetreuer Janaka, genannt Jan, möchte ich separat erwähnen. Er spricht fließend Deutsch und kann bei Arztkonsultationen und anderen Angelegenheiten übersetzen, falls es mal mit der englischen Kommunikation nicht genau funktioniert. Das war sehr hilfreich. Jan hat außerdem ein sehr breites Wissen über Ayurveda und die Geschichte, Kultur und Umgangsformen seines Landes. Wir haben im Innenhof viele interessante Gespräche geführt und ich konnte so einiges besser verstehen und dazulernen. Danke für den geistigen Austausch, Jan!

Ich hatte das Gefühl, Urlaub bei Freunden zu machen und bin erholt, aber mit schwerem Herzen abgereist. Irgendwann werde ich sicher wieder kommen. Bis dahin AYUBOWAN - ich wünsche euch allen ein langes Leben!
title: Dieses Ayurveda-Resort ist ein echter Geheimtipp!

ownerResponse/text:
Ayubowan!

Liebe Gäste,

Herzlichen Dank für Ihre wunderbaren Worte und Ihr Vertrauen in unser Resort. Es freut und sehr, dass Sie sich rundum wohlgefühlt haben und Ihre Ayurveda-Behandlung bei uns Genossen durchgeführt haben. Besonders freuen wir uns, dass unser Team zu Ihrem gelungenen Aufenthalt beigetragen hat. Ihre Wertschätzung ist für uns eine große Motivation.  

Wir würden uns sehr freuen, Sie bald wieder bei uns begrüßen zu dürfen.

Mit herzlichen Grüßen,
Garden Beach Resort - Udyoga
placeInfo/address: Thalgahapitiya Road, Kosgoda 80570 Sri Lanka
text:
Ich habe schon verschiedene Ayurvedakuren in Sri Lanka gemacht. Das Hiru Garden Beach hat mich sehr beeindruckt. Schönes Resort im typischen Landesstil am indischen Meer, alle Zimmer mit Meerblick. 
Die Gastfreundlichkeit aller Mitarbeiter, immer lächelnd, jeder Wunsch wurde umgehend zur Zufriedenheit umgesetzt und  war Balsam für die Seele. Jeder Tag brachte eine neue Überraschung. Frühstück am Meer, im Garten oder im Yogapavillon am Meer. Zu Jeder Mahlzeit war der Tisch sehr schön mit Blumen geschmückt. Das Essen war hervorragend.  Alles war sehr sauber und gepflegt.
Zum Sonnenuntergang wurde spontan ein Tisch ans Meer gestellt, so dass man beim Abendessen einen wunderbaren, unvergesslichen Sonnenuntergang erleben konnte. Es wurde alles gemacht, damit man sich wohlfühlt.
Die professionelle und fürsorgliche Behandlung durch die Ärzte und Therapeuten waren für mich gesundheitlich ein Erfolg.
Besonders erwähnenswert ist Jan, der Gästebetreuer. Er nahm sich sehr viel Zeit, alles über Ayurveda und das Essen zu erklären. Er hat ein sehr gutes Wissen und ich habe durch ihn einiges wieder dazu gelernt. Er stand immer mit Rat und Tat zur Seite.
Ich würde jederzeit in der Hiru Beach Garden eine Kur machen.
Ein Dankeschön an alle .....
title: Meine persönliche Ayurvedakur

ownerResponse/text:

We truly hope to welcome you back in the future!

Best Regards!
The Garden Beach Resort - Udyoga

text:
I can highly recommend this little, but very lovely hotel.
The rooms are super clean, beautyful with fresh flowers every day and a balkony direktly looking at the Indish Ocean.
The food ist special for everyone because of the Ayurveda, it´s delicious and they shared their recipes freely.
All people working there are super friendly , lovely and caring. This starts with the housekeeping, to the receptionists, the kitchenstaff, the Doctors and the Therapists. The touristmanager Janaka prooved to have an exeptional knowledge about Sri Lanka and Ayurveda which he shared with lots of joy.
The trips had been perfectly planned, the Yoga and ChiGong had been real fun in front of the Ocean.

I could say much more, but I recommend to try it on your own, and you will know why I say, words are not really enough.

placeInfo/address: Thalgahapitiya Road, Kosgoda 80570 Sri Lanka
text:
the best travel i ever had.
the small and very lovely resort direct beside the sea is great.
familiar atmosphere, competent and friendly doctors, a great citchen and service team. especially the therapirst team… i am a physiotherapist… and i can tell you i never got a better bodytreatment than in the garden beach resort.
mr prassanah and all the other men and women of the treatment team have great knowledge and good hands.
mr jannaka was all the time direct beside us for translation. he has hugh knowledge and gave us a lot of information about ayurveda. he organized all our trips beside the panchakarma treatment and gave us also a lot of informations about sri lanka, the language and politics.
he was our best contact person in the hotel.
it would not be the same without him.
i want to thank the team for your love and your service.
i miss you all and i want to come back.
title: best voyage and bodytreatment i ever had

placeInfo/address: Thalgahapitiya Road, Kosgoda 80570 Sri Lanka
text:
Bei meiner 3 wöchigen Ayurveda Kur im Garden Beach Resort in Kosgoda habe ich mich wie ein ganz besonderer Mensch gefühlt. 3 Wochen lang war das gesamte Team sehr freundlich und höflich, sehr aufmerksam und zugewandt, sehr hilfsbereit und immer lächelnd um mein Wohl bemüht. Kein Wunsch blieb offen. Die Räume waren immer sauber, das Essen hat sehr gut geschmeckt, die regelmäßigen ärztlichen Konsultationen waren aufmerksam, freundlich und zielorientiert. Alles, was bei all den Verspannungen helfen könnte, wurde sofort angewiesen und umgesetzt. Die Behandlungen waren umfassen, achtsam und in einer ruhigen respektvollen Atmosphäre. Und ich kann meine Kalkschulter wieder bewegen. 
Auch wenn zum Ende des Mai der Monsun zugeschlagen hat, hatten wir eine wunderbare und erholsame Zeit in Srilanka und möchten uns bei dem gesamten Team von Herzen bedanken. Wir kommen bestimmt wieder.
title: Eine wunderbare ayurvedische Erfahrung in einem familiären Resort mit freundlichem, zugewandten, hilfsbereitem Personal

placeInfo/address: Thalgahapitiya Road, Kosgoda 80570 Sri Lanka
text: Ich war im Mai 2024 2 Wochen dort und war sehr angetan von der Freundlichkeit und Achtsamkeit der Mitarbeiter. Es sind ausnahmslos alle Mitarbeiter sehr bemüht, man fühlt sich gut aufgehoben und sehr gut betreut. Für allein Reisende sehr gut geeignet. Das Essen ist sehr fein, die Lage ist schön, gleich am Meer und die wenigen Anzahl der Zimmer und damit Anzahl der Gäste macht es heimelig.
title: Sehr netter Aufenthalt

placeInfo/address: Thalgahapitiya Road, Kosgoda 80570 Sri Lanka
text:
Wir waren das erste mal hier. Von der ersten Sekunde an wurden wir herzlich empfangen und wie Familie behandelt. Dieses Resort ist einzigartig. Vom Inhaber über seinen Sohm Udyoga, über Jan (der perfekt deutsch spricht), alle Mitarbeiter wie zb. beide Nalin, Sudath, Agilla, Prasanna, Niro,……um ein paar zu erwähnen. Alle sind wirklich top. Udyoga machte mit uns einen tollen Ausflug. Nahm sich Zeit für uns und ging auf all unsere Wünsche ein.
Jan ist ganz speziell! Er ist das Herzstück hier. Ayurveda ist seine Leidenschaft. Er erklärt jedes Essen, kennt sich sehr gut aus, gibt Ratschläge und ist immer für uns da.
Das Essen ist sehr speziell und sehr lecker. Die Behandlungen top. Die Zimmer liebevoll eingerichtet und sauber. Direkt am Meer. Es gibt nichts zu bemängeln sondern nur zu Loben! Nach 2 Wochen fühlen wir uns körperlich viel besser und sind wahnsinnig entspannt! Wir können es nur empfehlen!!!!! Wir kommen fix wieder
title: Absolut empfehlenswert

placeInfo/address: Thalgahapitiya Road, Kosgoda 80570 Sri Lanka
text:
Dies war meine erste Ayurvedakur und ich wusste gar nicht genau was mich erwartet. Ich habe bewusst ein kleines Resort ausgewählt und wurde nicht enttäuscht: Die persönliche Atmosphäre kommt voll zum tragen, es wird einem jeden Wunsch von den Augen abgelesen. Der Kontakt unter den Gästen wird gefördert und ist angenehm. Ein grosser Vorteil ist auch dass Jan als Manager sehr gut Deutsch spricht und einem so sein grosses Ayurveda Wissen auch erklären kann falls jemand nicht so gut Englisch spricht. Das Resort entspricht den Fotos auf der Webseite und jeder einzelne im Team bemüht sich jederzeit den besten Gästeservice zu bieten.
Die Küche kocht individuell für jeden Gast anhand des diagnostizierten Doshas und auch die Massagen und das ganze Treatment sind entsprechend abgestimmt. Ich habe mich sehr gut erhohlt und blicke auf zwei sehr schöne Wochen im Garden Beach Ayurveda Resort in Kosgoda zurück. Die einsame Umgebung wirkt sich positiv auf das Erlebnis aus, man kann sehr schöne Strandspaziergänge machen. Absolut empfehlenswert wenn jemand Wert auf persönliche Atmosphäre und eine professionelle Kur in legt!
title: Sehr persönliches Ayurveda Erlebnis

placeInfo/address: Thalgahapitiya Road, Kosgoda 80570 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Auf alle Fälle darauf einlassen
text:
Es war großartig- alle haben sich perfekt um einen gekümmert - die  Behandlungen und das liebevoll angerichtete Essen ein Traum.
Sonderwünsche wurden sofort umgesetzt . 
Es war so Erholsam und Krafttankend . 
Immer wieder würde ich dort hin fahren
title: Großartiges Erlebnis

placeInfo/address: Thalgahapitiya Road, Kosgoda 80570 Sri Lanka
text:
The Garden beach Resort war/ist einfach ein paradiesisches Plätzchen!!! Trotz dessen, dass es schon in die Jahre gekommen ist, war es sehr gemütlich eingerichtet. Die Zimmer komfortabel mit einem Balkon mit Meeresblick. Ein Pool zwar klein, aber ausreichend...Der Palmgarten-idyllisch!! Man konnte einfach nur da sitzen und das Schauspiel des Ozeanes beobachten. 
Die ayurvervedische Küche-sehr lecker und gesund.
Meiner Meinung nach fehlt in dem Resort Koch ein separater Ruhe bzw Empfangsraum für verschiedene Veranstaltungen.  Z. B Tanzabende, Yoga, oder Meditation!!!

Da mein Englisch sehr schlecht ist,
war einer der Kriterien der Auswahl
vom Hotel der deutschspachige
Übersetzer! Gerade die wichtige
Arztgespräche sollten doch in der
gleichen Sprache geführt werden.
Somit wurde das mir in diesem
Hotel versichert. Ich war auch
nicht entteuscht, sogar andersrum!
Der Manager Janaka (von uns Jan
genannt) hat mich sehr herzlich
empfangen. Führte mich auch in
Welt von Ayurveda ein. Viel erklärt
und natürlich das Programm der
Kur vorgestellt. In einem guten
Deutsch begleitete Jan mich/uns
die gesamte Zeit. Nicht nur das
Ayurveda, sondern auch das
Allgemeinwissen über das Land,
die Sitten, und vielem mehr hat
meinen Aufenthalt sichererer und
schöner gemacht! Er gab uns
Tipps über Einkaufsmöglichkeiten,
Verkehrsmittel, Ausflüge usw.
Ich hatte auch das Gefühl, dass Jan das ganze Konzept des Hauses im Griff hat und alles 
hervorragend  managt. 
Das gesamte Team, bestehend aus drei Ärztinen, Therapeuten,  Hauskeeping und Küchenpersonal waren auch sehr
kompetent und freundlich!!! Man ist sehr schnell Teil der Familie, was einfach toll war.
title: Eine sehr hervorragende Kur in einem wunderbaren Ort

placeInfo/address: Thalgahapitiya Road, Kosgoda 80570 Sri Lanka
text:
Das Garden Beach Resort in Kosgoda ist ein wunderschönes und vom Feeling her familiäres Hotel mit einem wunderschönen Garten.
Die Zimmer sind groß und komfortabel und jeden Tag sehr liebevoll hergerichtet worden.
Die Betreuung durch die Ärztinnen, Jan den Hotelmanager und das ganze Team war super und wir haben uns sehr gut aufgehoben gefühlt. Die Anwendungen wie zB Massagen, Yoga usw. sind spitze und alle Therapeuten wirklich vom Fach und extrem freundlich. Das Essen ist frisch, mit Liebe zubereitet und sehr lecker!

Als Hotelgäste hatten wir das Glück auch über das Neujahr im Hotel zu sein. Wir wurden so herzlich einbezogen in die Feierlichkeiten und lernten sogar die Familien der Mitarbeiter kennen. Lustige Spiele und Menschen die Freude und gute Laune verbreiten.

Wir haben vor der Ayurvedakur über den Besitzer des Hotels noch eine Rundreise organisiert bekommen und hatten hier mit unserem Fahrer Tenny eine tolle Zeit. Organisiert, sicher und komfortabel - perfekt, um sich einfach mal um Nichts kümmern zu müssen.

Rundum ein super Urlaub und ein bezauberndes Land mit lieben Menschen!
title: Jederzeit gerne wieder.....

ownerResponse/text:
Ayubowan🙏🏻

Lieber Schweinsteiger,

herzlichen Dank für Ihre wunderbare Bewertung. Es freut uns sehr, dass Ihr 10-tägiger Ayurveda-Aufenthalt im Hiru Garden Beach Ihnen tiefe Entspannung und Ruhe gebracht hat. Ihre lieben Worte über Janaka und unser gesamtes Team bedeuten uns viel – es ist unsere Freude, einen Ort zu schaffen, an dem sich unsere Gäste rundum wohl und liebevoll betreut fühlen. Wir hoffen, Sie bald wieder bei uns begrüßen zu dürfen – für weitere Momente der Ruhe, Fürsorge und blühender Blumen.

Herzliche Grüße
Ihr Garden Beach Team
placeInfo/address: Thalgahapitiya Road, Kosgoda 80570 Sri Lanka
text: Wir waren 10d für eine Ayuveda Kur im Hiru Garden Beach Hotel. Es liegt direkt an einem ruhigen, sehr sauberen Strand ohne viele Menschen. Das Rauschen der Wellen und die Ruhe in der kleinen Oase garantieren echte Erholung. Die Betreuung durch Janaka ( deutsch- und englischsprachig) war perfekt. Unter seiner Leitung wurde jeder Wunsch angenommen und soweit wie möglich erfüllt. Auch seine Kenntnisse über die ayuvedische Küche und den Sinn von Ayuveda waren sehr hilfreich. Insgesamt war das gesamte Team im Hotel von den Thrrapeuten über die Küche, Zimmerservice bis zur Rezeption sehr freundlich und hilfsbereit. Das Essen war stets liebevoll zubereitet und angerichtet und im Zimmer gab es immer einen kleinen Blumengruss. Ein kleines feines Ayuveda Hotel in dem man sich rundum wohlfühlen.
title: Hiru Garden Beach Hotel - ein Ort der Ruhe und Erholung

ownerResponse/text:
Liebe Hermann, liebe Christine,

Ayubowan 🙏🏻
Herzlichen Dank für eure wundervollen Worte. Es war uns eine große Freude, euch bei uns zu haben. Eure Wertschätzung bedeutet unserem gesamten Team sehr viel – wir geben jeden Tag unser Bestes, um jedem Gast eine herzliche und unvergessliche Zeit zu bereiten.

Besonders freut es uns, dass euch die kleinen Details – die Blumen, das Frühstück am Strand und die Neujahrsfeier im April – so berührt haben. Ein großes Dankeschön auch für die lieben Worte über unseren Jan – er ist wirklich ein Schatz, und wir sind glücklich, dass seine Unterstützung und sein Wissen eure Ayurveda-Reise bereichert haben.

Wir freuen uns schon jetzt auf ein Wiedersehen. Bis dahin: Bleibt gesund und inspiriert!

Mit herzlichen Grüßen,
euer gesamtes Garden Beach Team
placeInfo/address: Thalgahapitiya Road, Kosgoda 80570 Sri Lanka
roomTip: toller Aufenthalt, Ayurveda und Service wie man es sich wünscht
text:
Liebes Garden Beach Team,
wir wollen uns nochmals für die wunderschöne Zeit bei euch bedanken. 
Wir wurden von allen mit so viel Aufmerksamkeit und Freundlichkeit empfangen, 
wie wir das noch nie erlebt hatten. 
Es haben uns alle mit viel Herzblut und besondere Aufmerksamkeit betreut. Das ganze Team hat sich immer wieder etwas besonders einfallen lassen um unser Aufenthalt so angenehm wie möglich zu machen.
Ein paar Highlights waren, das Blütenmeer auf dem Zimmer oder beim Essen auf den Tischen, das Frühstück am Strand und auch das Neujahrfest, Mitte April, das wir mit allen Mitarbeiten und deren Familien mitfeiern durften. 
Das ist nicht selbstverständlich.

Einen ganz besonderen Dank gebührt dir lieber Jan,
für deine unermüdliche Hilfsbereitschaft in allen belangen, für deine Erklärungen über die Zusammenhänge von Ayurveda.
Bei jedem Essen hast du die Zutaten und Wirkungsweisen sehr gut erklärt.
Dank deiner ausführlichen schriftlichen Dokumentation über Gewürze und Nahrungsmittel und welches mit welchem Kombiniert werden darf und was nicht,
konnten wir hier zu hause vieles in den Alltag integrieren.
Durch deine Übersetzungen bei den Arztterminen war ein guter Dialog mit den Ärzten möglich.
Du bist die Seele des Hauses.

Herzlichen Dank
Hermann und Christine 
April 2024
title: toller Aufenthalt, Ayurveda wie man es sich wünscht

text: The entire stay was truly a lovely experience - from the spacious room, to the warm, welcoming staff and especially the delicious food. placeInfo/address: 78 Samanthara Rd, Wadduwa 12560 Sri Lanka
text:
We stayed here at the end of an incredible tour of a beautiful country. Each room is about 100m2 and tastefully decorates by the English owners. Huge bed, outside shower (and inside), huge bath in stunning water gardens. The pool and garden lead directly onto the beach which is quiet where you can help fisherman pull their nets in if you feel you need the exercise and to feel like a good person. 

Staff were very attentive with a genuine interest in us and what we think and want. Such nice guys. Really make your stay special. Food was great. Loved the Sri Lankan brekkie!!

The room was secluded with a good degree of privacy. Even the hotel tuk tuk was a useful service for emergency present buying. It’s quiet enough to feel you’re secluded. Beautiful place
title: End of tour relaxation

placeInfo/address: 78 Samanthara Rd, Wadduwa 12560 Sri Lanka
text:
Stayed for 4 nights at the end of our Sri Lanka tour. This is a perfect place to rest up before the flight home. Just 1hr from Columbo airport. 
Beautiful high spec property with lovely beach. 
Rooms are sumptuous and beautifully decorated. 
Restaurant excellent, prices at top end - but worth it. 
Attentive service from friendly staff
Would definitely stay again
title: Fabulous beachfront property

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Indula

Many thanks for staying with us and for your helpful feedback

I am really pleased you enjoyed your stay and hope to welcome you back again.

Please allow me to address some of the points you raised.

The huge bathtubs are hand-carved and so require a spinner type bath waste which may seem a little unfamiliar.  Sorry about that.

The ceiling fans are over 100 years old.  They are fully operational and refurbished but sometimes these old boys make a little groan now and again.  All our suites are fully air-conditioned for your comfort.

Our restaurant meals are cooked fresh to order and as we have a very large a la carte menu the chefs take care to create dishes specially for you and therefore takes a little time.  Although you don’t have to, we normally request in the evening your order in advance and for your convenience ask what time you wish to dine.  Obviously, something didn’t go to plan that evening and apologise for this.

It is our policy not to provide ironing equipment in the guest suites for safety reasons.  A hot iron could cause injury especially if there are children staying in the suite.  We have our own fully operational laundry and offer a pressing service should you have requested this.
placeInfo/address: 78 Samanthara Rd, Wadduwa 12560 Sri Lanka
text:
Went with my wife and daughter for a short stay. 

Incredible place, tastefully decorated, excellent service, superb food. 

This place is a must visit if you want to drown yourself in complete serenity.

The combination of nature and a pleasing selection of decorative antiques with a calm and quiet environment just alters your state of mind.

The service, specially by Dino was exceptional. Every little need was looked into.

We had minor technical issues such as the tub drainage being stuck, the ceiling fan makes an irritable noise over a certain threshold and the TV being out of place, however that didn't bother us because we were there for a short stay. 

Just a few recommendations if this revreview makes it to the management,
Please cater to your guests needs rather the guests catering to the kitchens needs when it comes to pre ordering the meal. 
We had to confirm our dinner order by 5.30 and we were uncomfortable As we had to rush to dinner. 

The room was equipped with most essential appliances except for an iron and an ironing board. 
When called guest services, they said that they don't provide them either. 
For this reason, I had to wear wrinkled clothes throughout my stay. 

On checkout, we had to wait for approx 10 mins until someone showed up,  despite ringing the electric remote bell. 

Other than these little things, we had an excellent time. 

Thank you.
title: Amazing stay

ownerResponse/text: Thank you so much for your lovely review and I am glad you enjoyed your stay.   We offer a soothing range of spa treatments with our well-experienced staff and assure you that they are very well trained.
placeInfo/address: 78 Samanthara Rd, Wadduwa 12560 Sri Lanka
text: Reef Villa is a beautiful place with green spaces, stunning interiors and attentive staff. It has direct access to the beach, and a lovely pool set between the main house and the sea. The food is delicious - especially the curries - and the restaurant had perfect views to the beach. Overall a lovely quiet place to spend time at the beginning or end of a tour of Sri Lanka, or even for a long weekend from the Gulf. The only small criticism we had was that the masseur in the spa did not appear to have been professionally trained.
title: Peaceful and serene

placeInfo/address: 78 Samanthara Rd, Wadduwa 12560 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Fantastic place to stay
text: Every time we visit Sri Lanka, we  always spend time at the Reef Villa & Spa. We were there just before Christmas. We were warmly greeted by the hotel Manager Malith Perera followed by the hotel Owner Brendan and Bernadette and of cause by all the other staff. We always found the hotel be very inviting, welcoming, warm and friendly. We love everything about the hotel. The food was tasty and mouth watering. We felt the Chef gave personal attention to our meal and service was great by the waiting staff.  We love the antiques in the hotel. Every time we visit the Sri Lanka this is one of our highlights of the trip. Thank you again for the hospitality and looking after all our requirements. We are looking forward to visiting again this year. Roshini & Michael Edwardes
title: Hidden Treasure

placeInfo/address: 78 Samanthara Rd, Wadduwa 12560 Sri Lanka
text:
We headed for a lunch (really late n starving) with two toddlers on 22/12/19. The atmosphere was amazing, it gave a feel of being inside the secret garden. The huge coconut groove, clean beach which was not crowded was superb.
The staff, deserves a word. They were very friendly, accomadating and kind. I have seen such level of hospitality only once!
The food, it takes a good 30-45 mins to prepare but I wouldn't complaint! It was just heavenly! 
The only thing I would like to add is allowing us to use the pool for a small fare, since we are dining anyways and it was so inviting...
I would definitely recommend this place and come back too!!
title: Good food, tastefully done surroundings...

placeInfo/address: 78 Samanthara Rd, Wadduwa 12560 Sri Lanka
text: A luxury boutique villa of just seven rooms, with amazing artifacts and water bodies.  They have good, courteous staff and absolutely calm and peaceful. You would just listen to crows, waves, wind, train and some fisherman.
title: Pooja Rajesh Kukreja

placeInfo/address: 78 Samanthara Rd, Wadduwa 12560 Sri Lanka
roomTip: The soothing sound of the sea was soporific in ocean view rooms.
text: A wonderful place for a restful holiday. Excellent accommodation, fantastic caring staff and outstanding food. This retreat is a hidden gem which provides everything you could want in a friendly and relaxed atmosphere. We spent four nights here and could have happily stayed longer. The rooms are spacious and bathrooms well appointed. The gardens and pool beautiful.
title: Luxury and tranquility

placeInfo/address: 78 Samanthara Rd, Wadduwa 12560 Sri Lanka
text: An absolutely gorgeous place that was only a stop gap for our long flight into Colombo from the UK and our next destination, Unawatuna. We were beyond gutted to leave and could have easily stayed a week, such is the beauty and peaceful ambience of this property. The staff are fantastic and can’t do enough for you and the on-site restaurant offers food of the highest quality (The samosa’s were a particular highlight!). We were very kindly upgraded to an ocean suite as it was our first stop on our honeymoon (A lovely touch) and it was just impossibly beautiful - think four poster beds and marble bathtubs. My wife is heavily into her interior design and she was blown away by the layout and decor of the entire suite (not an easy feat I don’t mind telling you). We also enjoyed a good chat with the owners before we reluctantly had to check out and they were both very hospitable and kind (as well as getting to meet their two gorgeous dogs, Fred and Wilma). I can’t recommend Reef Villa and Spa enough, the perfect tonic and right amount of self indulgence which offers ultimate relaxation and TLC in abundance. 5 stars*
title: Our only complaint was that we only booked one night!

placeInfo/address: 78 Samanthara Rd, Wadduwa 12560 Sri Lanka
text: We stayed Two nights in this amazing hotel in our World Around tour. The place is stunning and the service is First class. Food is excellent. I really can recommend this to everybody who wants to enjoy life !
title: Amazing place

placeInfo/address: 78 Samanthara Rd, Wadduwa 12560 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Just 7 private villas and the resort is a hidden gem
text:
Here we are in the car, going through this narrow path of tall grass/bushes on both sides and we (wife & I) could not figure out where did we land up. Once we stepped out of the car and started walking down this antique pathways & ponds with steps at intervals, we reached the reception which is directly connected to a huge coconut groves-land and that is in turn linked to the beach & ocean!

We were famished but there is this 1 main restaurant present and little did we know that the food and coffee served during our 5 day trip would make us smile. With filled and content bellies, we got to our room (on day 1) and were just amazed by the royal setup and feel of it. A jacuzzi with so much depth but blended with the naturality of the room and the resort and a room ceiling so high that a ladder could not help us reach it ;) The cleaniness of the room, the old meets the new school look and the size of the bath-room was so huge, we just landed up pampering ourselves and being in awe.
The resort overall is a private boutique and the style of it blended with the wooden and antiques setup really gave me goosebumps because I never felt so much at ease and suddenly I started warming up to the idea of forgetting everything negative in life.
The cherry on the cake is that it was just me - wife - staff. So the peace, much needed privacy (no noise pollution), quiet and friendliness of the staff (will never forget Malith + Dakshi + head chef) gave us the most needed break away from our very stressful work routines. I am focusing on the key fact that all this together made our stay in Reef Villa the best and the most memorable for us.

Thank you so much for giving us our idea of a getaway anniversary trip and we thoroughly enjoyed every bit of it.

Kudos to you guys and will never forget this place and the memories created.
title: A Haven of it's own

placeInfo/address: 78 Samanthara Rd, Wadduwa 12560 Sri Lanka
text:
5 Star hotels are synonymous with luxury and amenities.  In this age of inflated reviews, 4 and 5 stars abound on many review sites.  Reef Villa and Spa in Wadduwa  is in a category by itself.  The 5 star rating does not do justice to its splendor in design, service, and above all the ambience of tranquility.  Should be 6 stars.

This sanctuary is a delight to all the senses with its detailed ordained furnishings , its fine gardens and fish ponds, and most of all the splendid personnel who tie it all into one perfect gift of  calmness and repose.

Shout out to Dino, Darkshana, and Malith for their most favorable interactions with us this past weekend.  We will be back even just for the superb cuisine that rivals top restaurants in Colombo. 

Dominic/Seni
title: A Sanctuary unlike others

placeInfo/address: 78 Samanthara Rd, Wadduwa 12560 Sri Lanka
text: we visited for a second time in a year beautiful beautiful fantastic beach really great staff the manager is great guy the owner even better we were looked after like Sri Lankan kings.Food and service first class 5 stars all the way You must at least once in your life .We can't wait to come back again and again ..🙏
title: Great stay

placeInfo/address: 78 Samanthara Rd, Wadduwa 12560 Sri Lanka
text: From the moment we set foot in this hidden gem in became clear that we would have an incredible stay,the hospitality throughout our trip was phenomenal. From the owners, right down to the porters, everyone was a joy (particularly Wilma and Fred, the resident pooches). To match with this the layout and design of every inch within Reef spoke of a love and care you only get in small hotels like this. I personally love a great bathroom in a hotel, and Reefs huge shower and all enveloping stone bathtub really stood out for me. Hats of to you team, keep up the great work!
title: Like a home away from home .. only with incredible luxury

placeInfo/address: 78 Samanthara Rd, Wadduwa 12560 Sri Lanka
text:
The day I visited to “Reef” was very special day for my life. I need to surprise my ever loving one. This is the first time I also visited to this hotel. When both of us were entered the hotel we get and very remarkable feeling. What an amazing. We couldn’t believe, were we @ wadduwa area. It’s a very nature friendly design. The feeling what we got couldn’t be explain because it’s that much surprising.

The dinner which was we enjoyed was very delicious. Wow

Mr Dino and his crew were given us very humble warm welcome with excellent service throughout the period. Thank you for every thing 
 “Actually it’s like a Paradise”
title: Amazing Dinner out

placeInfo/address: 78 Samanthara Rd, Wadduwa 12560 Sri Lanka
text:
I have just returned from a 4 night stay at Reef Villa and Spa. 
The building and the decor are absolutely sublime, a stunning environment to spend a few days in. 
Brendan and his team are attentive and attuned to guests needs, I was impressed with absolutely everyone.
title: Elegant relaxation

placeInfo/address: 78 Samanthara Rd, Wadduwa 12560 Sri Lanka
text:
Absolutely amazing hotel and a hidden gem in sri lanka! 
Beautiful property and tasteful interiors with such attention to detail.
Rooms looks incredible and the staff is extremely hospitable and helpful. 
A must stay for sure!
title: A hidden Gem

placeInfo/address: 78 Samanthara Rd, Wadduwa 12560 Sri Lanka
text:
This property, hidden away in Waadduwa, is an absolute gem of a place.

Tasteful decor, exquisite menu and what stood out for me was the courtesy, thoughtfulness and attentiveness of the staff especially Dino’s! The food was great and the service, impeccable. 

After lunch, we wanted to see the suites and it was amazing; such large well decorated rooms with carefully curated art, ornaments and furniture, it was like stepping into history.  Yes, I am definitely coming here for a weekend at least.
title: An absolute gem!

placeInfo/address: 78 Samanthara Rd, Wadduwa 12560 Sri Lanka
roomTip: All rooms are gorgeous, it comes down to what you want to pay.
text:
Stayed here for three nights at the end of our tour around Sri Lanka. 
Viewed The Reef 5 years ago and made a vow we would visit this resort at some time.
Well it lived up to all our expectations and more. A truly unique & classical place, the best I have visited. 
Full of asian artifacts that adorn the property coupled with the splendour of the rooms that make this resort stand out against anything else.
The management & staff are of the finest we have encountered and strive to make your stay a memorable one, and it was. 
I was presented with a surprise birthday cake specially made by the chef, it was one of the best I have tasted, but then again all his dishes were of a high standard.
I wish I could remember all their names to thank them individually, nothing was too much trouble for this team.
We did meet "Monica" one day on the beach, she being an elephant. Some sadness in seeing her in a captive environment, but Mr Malith the resort manager assured me she is well taken care of. 
There are only seven rooms and we stayed in one of the Plantation House Suites with a  balcony and sea view. We did have the chance to view one of the garden rooms and found this to be splendid. Which ever room you choose it would be of similar opulence to the others at the Reef.
If you like dogs you will love Wilmer & Fred two gorgeous and well behaved golden retrievers who belong to the owners.
Do not miss the chance to visit this hidden jewel of Sri Lanka, you will not be disappointed. We hope to return.
title: Unique Splendour

placeInfo/address: 78 Samanthara Rd, Wadduwa 12560 Sri Lanka
text: My family and I spent a night at the hotel and it was amazing. Beautiful room, which was really well decorated and close to the sea. The premises are well maintained and great to simply walk around. The staff were extremely friendly and very helpful. Definitely recommend a stay, either for families or couples.
title: Amazing hotel, fantastic staff

placeInfo/address: 64, Peddlers Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
We visited the restaurant tonight and was greeted by our host Rizwan. He made us feel at home and was very polite and personable. 
We felt relaxed all night and would love to come back tomorrow for seconds. 
Food was delicious and wine was too.
We would recommend the restaurant tonight others
title: Relaxed

placeInfo/address: 64, Peddlers Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
Great place to stay right in the middle of Galle. Everything worthwhile seeing is within walking distance. Top service, very good breakfast and a good a la carte choice of tasty meals for lunch and dinner. 
Even though it is located in the middle of the old town, it was quiet at night.
The staff is very friendly and helpful.
Room was spacious and clean.
All in all a very pleasant stay.
title: Nothing to complain about!

placeInfo/address: 64, Peddlers Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
We had a fantastic stay at this lovely hotel. The rooms were a great size , very comfortable beds and a great shower. 
The hotel is in a fab location and team especially Ameen were great in helping us find things to do. 
We absolutely loved the breakfast. The hotel is worth a visit for breakfast alone ! 
I will definitely stay here again if I’m lucky enough to be back in Galle Fort 
Thanks team Merchant
title: Fantastic stay at this lovely hotel

placeInfo/address: 64, Peddlers Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
We reached Galle on our fantastic Sri Lankan holiday & were delighted to reach the Merchant Hotel, the best hotel on our trip.  Our welcome was very warm & friendly.
Two ladies at Reception were outstanding - Mishara & Naveena.  They were a constant joy & delight throughout our stay of 4 nights.  They made us feel like part of the family & we were really sad to leave them behind when we left.
Our room was excellent.  Spacious, comfortable & homely with a nice view out of the front of the hotel.  It was so nice sitting out on the balcony with our drinks watching people go up & down Peddlers Street outside.
The food was very good indeed though we would like to have seen more local dishes, but the standard of the cooking was excellent.
Galle Fort area is a very relaxed, laid back sort of place & the Merchant Hotel was a perfect reflection of this.
We think we now have to come back to Sri Lanka & a return to the Merchant Hotel would be very high on our list of priorities.
title: Probably the best hotel in Sri Lanka.

placeInfo/address: 64, Peddlers Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Highly recommended!
text:
I thoroughly enjoyed my recent stay at The Merchant, and it’s possibly the finest hotel I’ve stayed in whilst visiting Sri Lanka.
Friendly and welcoming staff, well-appointed accommodation and an excellent restaurant warrant a stay at this property; highly recommended for its location too.
Special mention to Shakila, Mimu, Melinda and Chamika for their excellent service and attention during my stay. 
A truly memorable stay.
title: Impeccable!

placeInfo/address: 64, Peddlers Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: The room is in a smaller size if you are a family with children pay attention to the size.
text: The hotel is located in the heart of town, walking distance to all the shops and restaurants. This is a cute charming boutique hotel. The room was very beautifully decorated and comfortable. Note that the room is on a smaller size. If you have children pay attention to the room size before booking. Great customer service and fantastic breakfast.
title: Cute charming hotel in the heart of town

placeInfo/address: 64, Peddlers Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
Before wrapping up our short holiday, we decided to step into the beautiful and charming Merchant Galle Fort for lunch. This stunning boutique hotel, housed in a restored colonial era building, sits right in the heart of Galle Fort, offering a perfect blend of history, style, and warmth.
 
The rooms are thoughtfully designed with a tasteful colonial-inspired aesthetic. I particularly loved the elegant décor, which maintained a sense of heritage while incorporating modern touches. The facilities were comfortable and well-maintained, ensuring a pleasant experience for every guest.
 
The staff were genuinely warm and welcoming, always going above and beyond to ensure we were well looked after. Special mention goes to their exceptional service and attention to detail. The food was of high quality fresh, flavourful, and beautifully presented. I have to say, their chicken biriyani was a standout dish that I absolutely loved.
 
I had visited this property on previous occasions as well, and each visit has been memorable. The evening vibe at their open restaurant is simply magical, making it the perfect spot for a cosy dinner amidst the fort’s atmospheric surroundings.
 
If you’re looking for a charming place to dine or stay while exploring Galle Fort, I would highly recommend The Merchant Galle Fort. It’s a space where heritage meets modern-day elegance, and the experience is sure to leave a lasting impression.
title: Charming Lunch Experience at The Merchant Galle Fort!

placeInfo/address: 64, Peddlers Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text: Ameen was great!!!! The hotel was super nice but the service really makes it better. We had a free upgrade of our room. We were shown where to go in golf and not were the amenities of the hotel fantastic but the food was also amazing and so was breakfast.!!!
title: Lovely staff!

placeInfo/address: 64, Peddlers Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text: Great food and service at the 1710 restaurant in The Merchant Galle Fort. Rizwan especially was great and spot on with this food recommendations. Highly deserved and well worth a visit again. We will be back again in the next few days to try other dishes on the menu.
title: Great food with awesome service and nice atmosphere

placeInfo/address: 64, Peddlers Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text: Great and friendly service from staff especially Ameen, rooms are clean, strong aircon and super fast wifi. Beds are comfortable qnd had great sleep here. Amazing breakfast sread, food was excellent. Close to shops cafes and attractions. highly recommended!
title: Great!

placeInfo/address: 64, Peddlers Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text: The room is amazing and clean! Love my stay so much that we are sad to leave. Ameen from front desk has been really friendly and helpful in providing recommendations around the area. Coconut sambal is a such a great traditional restaurant a few minutes away!
title: Love our stay!

placeInfo/address: 64, Peddlers Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text: Lovely hotel in a great location. All the staff were lovely especially Rizwan at breakfast. The rooms had a colonial feel and were tastefully decorated (a mirror in the bedroom would be a good addition). The food was of high quality and it was lovely to be served rather than the buffet style at other hotels we stayed at. I would definitely recommend this hotel
title: Great Hotel and Food

placeInfo/address: 64, Peddlers Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
Location and Access – Around 2.5 hours’ drive by Expressway from Colombo Airport. The hotel is situated in the historic walled fort – a few moments’ walk from the ancient ramparts and the iconic light house. Nearby are numerous restaurants, cafes, bars, souvenir and craft shops. More shops and services, the train and bus station can be found in the “new” town

A number of pictures of the hotel can be seen on Google Street View.
 
Reception – Being greeted at the hotel entrance (by name) gave an immediate good impression as did the flawless check in with choice of welcome drink and ice cold towel. Staff were exceedingly friendly and helpful

Public Areas/Decor – Whilst the public areas have welcoming contemporary furniture and décor care has been taken to ensure the hotel retains a colonial feel including wooden staircases, external walkways and balconies overlooking Pedlar Street below

Guest Room –Small – but perfectly formed with great consideration given to layout, design and furnishing. Everything worked well and it was comfortable. An immaculate shower room. In room mini fridge, tea and coffee making etc. A small private balcony with seating overlooking the street below

Amenities including Entertainment – Large flat screen TV with a limited number of channels. Ample electrical sockets. Free WiFi was very good

Lighting – A variety of lighting options
 
Air Conditioning – Very good including ceiling fan

Noise – Despite live entertainment on the night I was there I was not disturbed by any noise

Food & Beverage – I opted to have dinner at one of the many local restaurants nearby. The buffet breakfast was probably one of the best I had during my time in Sri Lanka. Everything served like a “picture on a plate”. Even the coffee was freshly brewed.
 
Value for Money – For the quality of the accommodation and high level of service I was very satisfied with the room rate which included the excellent breakfast

X Factor – The location of the hotel in the centre of the historic fort means that it is easy to explore the area on foot. In addition, staying there means that it’s possible to experience the true ambience of the fort once the hordes of day trippers have left or before they arrive!

During my stay in Sri Lanka I made use of the services of Kulansa Tours who I have relied on in the past for airport transfers and island wide sightseeing on and off the usual tourist trail. A remarkable personalised service at a reasonable price
title: Modern Comfort with a Colonial Feel

placeInfo/address: 64, Peddlers Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text: This hotel is in a excellent location in the centre of Galle fort . All the staff are very welcoming and so helpful in everything you need. We would highly recommend this hotel . The breakfast is a la carte and amazing. Although we were bed &  breakfast we ate dinner in the hotel on our first night and it was fabulous. All in all this hotel is def worth a visit
title: Hotel merchant Galle

placeInfo/address: 64, Peddlers Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
The hotel is in the perfect position in the heart of Galle fort. 
The rooms were well appointed and regularly attended to.
The breakfast, which was cooked to order, was extremely tasty and served in the beautiful outside garden area.
Most of all the staff were excellent; always attentive and responsive to any request.
A big thank you to Ameen who packed us off at 5.30 am with a packed breakfast full of tasty goodies.
A really enjoyable experience!
title: Excellent hotel in the heart of Galle

placeInfo/address: 64, Peddlers Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text: This was a super experience here at The Merchant. The staff were ever so helpful, in particular, Ameen and Navina at reception. The food was superb, and the rooms were spacious and exceptionally clean. Thank you for the excellent hospitality.
title: Superb experience

placeInfo/address: 64, Peddlers Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
Отличный отель, очень понравилось все. Приятный персонал, уютные и удобные комнаты, вкусные завтраки.
Особенно приятны комплименты при звезде - освежающий коктейль фруктовый, комплимент за завтраком.
В комнатах очень чисто и приятно, убираются несколько раз в день. 
Рекомендуем к посещению, отель находится в центре Галле (форт), приятная тихая улочка. Даже не хотелось уезжать.
title: Прекрасное место для знакомства с достопримечательностями Галле и проведения выходных в европейском стиле!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

placeInfo/address: 64, Peddlers Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text: Look no further for a great hotel in Galle Fort. Spacious, quiet and very tasteful room, helpful, welcoming and attentive staff, great restaurant (best string hoppers for breakfast)! Special thanks to Ameen and Ravindu for the perfect service! Highly recommended!
title: Superb hotel in Galle Fort

placeInfo/address: 64, Peddlers Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text: Located in the heart of Galle Fort this is a great starting point to explore the area. The rooms have all that you need and the beds are comfortable. The air conditioning outdoor unit is just outside your room with little sound insulation, creating quite a lot of noise in the room. Breakfast was great but you need to take at least n hour. We didn’t eat in the restaurant as we thought the prices were quite high, there are many excellent options like the bungalow. Get your additional drinking water at the Cargills supermarket, just a few steps away.
title: Good location, beware of noisy aitcon

placeInfo/address: 64, Peddlers Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
stunning hotel - wonderful location in an old dutch house near to the fort  - rooms are tasteful and high quality - the food in the restaurant and at breakfast  and the service could not be friendlier 

a fantastic experience and highly recommended
title: stunning hotel in a perfect location with wonderful currys and breakfast

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest, 

Greetings from Jetwing Vil Uyana!

Thank you so much for your wonderful feedback. We’re delighted to hear that you enjoyed your stay at Jetwing Vil Uyana—from the luxury touches in your room and exceptional views of the lake to our delectable Sri Lankan curries and attentive service. It’s always rewarding to know that our efforts, especially those of our team member Lakshan, have made your experience memorable. We also appreciate your tips about the evening naturist walk and the local wildlife—ensuring our guests are well-prepared is important to us.

Ayubowan! (May you live long!)

Anthony Ferdinand
General Manager
placeInfo/address: Rangirigama, Sigiriya 21120 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: Jetwing Vil Uyana, A Luxury Reserve
roomTip: Take insect repellent if you are prone to being bitten.
text: An amazing experience. This hotel was a joy to stay at. Incredible room overlooking the lake with luxury touches like a deep double bath, compliments mini bar, veranda overlooking the lake and amazing aircon (our room was like a fridge when we woke up). The food was exceptional (especially the Sri Lankan curries) and the service very attentive. Lakshan, our personal host, was so helpful and happy to talk to us….he’ll go far. The evening naturist walk was interesting, the gym decent and its well positioned for all Cultural Triangle excursions. Take insect repellent; mozzies at night.
title: Beautiful Serene hotel

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest, 

Greetings from Jetwing Vil Uyana!

Thank you for sharing your thoughtful feedback and for choosing to return to Jetwing Vil Uyana not once, but three times. It is truly heartwarming to know that our unique setting—nestled by the lake, surrounded by paddy fields, woodlands, and nature—continues to enchant you. We are delighted that you enjoyed the luxury and sustainability of our spacious dwellings, as well as the excellent dining experience with those picturesque lake views.

We also appreciate your kind words about our dedicated team, whose friendly and efficient service is central to creating a memorable stay. Regarding the crocodiles, we understand your disappointment; wildlife can be unpredictable and we continue to monitor and manage our natural habitat to ensure the best possible environment for all our guests and local fauna.

Once again, thank you for your loyalty and insightful feedback. We look forward to welcoming you back for many more magical experiences at Jetwing Vil Uyana.

Ayubowan! (May you live long!)

Anthony Ferdinand
General Manager
placeInfo/address: Rangirigama, Sigiriya 21120 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: Jetwing Vil Uyana, A Luxury Reserve
text: This was our third visit to this hotel - 2019, 2024 and 2025.  It is a magical place built around a lake with paddy fields, woodland and surrounded by nature.   The dwellings mix luxury with sustainability and are very spacious.  The first floor dining room overlooks the lake and serves excellent food.   We particularly enjoy wandering around the grounds wildlife spotting although we were disappointed to find that the crocodiles present on our previous two visits had gone missing from the lake.  The staff are a good combination of friendly and efficient making it a memorable place to stay.  The fact that we chose to go back for a third time when there are numerous luxury hotels in the area says it all.
title: Fantastic Hotel

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest, 

Greetings from Jetwing Vil Uyana!

Thank you for choosing Jetwing Vil Uyana to celebrate your 25th anniversary and for sharing such a heartwarming review. We are truly delighted that our beautiful, scenic environment, along with the lively presence of our resident monkeys, peacocks, and butterflies, added to your special celebration. It brings us great joy to know that you found our accommodation, food, staff, and overall experience worthy of the highest praise.

The hotel is a calm oasis when visiting this area.
