text: We stayed 4 nights and had a wonderful time. Rooms were comfortable and the views are incredible! Our hike was so informative and really showed the incredible botanical diversity of Sri Lanka from forest fruits to natural medicines and of course tea. We loved it and could have stayed for the entire holidays!

roomTip: The road leading to this area was narrow . Take care when driving
text:
We visited this up country eco friendly hotel recently  . Our group consisted of 2 families. 
The Hotel staff was very friendly . The rooms were spacious & comfortable . Most rooms  open into a lawn area over looking a beautiful scenery of trees & surrounding mountains. The pool & gym area was good with buggy cart takes guests to & from hotel reception. 
The ambiance was very relaxing .
 The food was set menu & done to perfection which all of us enjoyed very much
We took a 2 hour nature walk in the evening session with Naturalist “Isuru” who was very knowledgeable about botanical & zoological aspects of the surroundings . We witnessed some interesting things during the walk .
Overall our stay was very good & relaxing . The Hotel is located not too far from some historic temples & buildings which one can visit .  
Can recommend for any family  who aims to spend a relaxing few days
title: Most enjoyable Holiday

placeInfo/address: Elkaduwa Road Meenawatte Estate, Kandy, Wattegama 20000 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: Simpson's Forest - Luxury Boutique Resort & Spa
roomTip:
Recommend two nights and above. Try to arrive before the dark. 
Ideal for nature lovers and bird enthusiasts
text:
Our next stop was the beautifully tucked-away Simpson’s Forest, and what an incredible experience it turned out to be. From the moment we arrived, we were warmly welcomed by a team that was genuinely friendly, attentive, and always ready to assist with anything we needed.

The setting is truly something special. Surrounded by lush greenery and fresh mountain air, it felt like a world away from the city. The property itself sits within 100 acres of thick forest, dotted with tea and clove trees. There are plenty of nature-based activities to enjoy within the estate, and we were lucky to do a guided trek with Isuru, whose knowledge of the area’s flora and fauna was remarkable. The morning and evening trails are beautifully designed for birdwatching and immersing yourself in nature.

Waking up to the sound of birds and enjoying a cup of tea while taking in the stunning views from our room was unforgettable.

Though we only stayed for one night, we were fortunate to experience several of the property’s unique offerings, thanks to the excellent support of RM Asela and his team. The infinity pool, the peaceful setting, and the well-maintained spaces added so much charm to this hillside retreat.

Everything was clean, thoughtfully arranged, and delivered with genuine care. A truly memorable stay, highly recommended for anyone seeking nature, comfort, and authentic Sri Lankan hospitality.
title: A tranquil escape into nature – Simpson’s Forest!!

ownerResponse/text:

Warmest regards

text:
I had a relaxing getaway at Cinnamon Bentota Beach. I’ve stayed here several times with my family and each visit has been consistently enjoyable. The food is always a highlight, and this time was no different. A very special thank you to Priyantha, as well as Dharaka, Chef Mark, and Chef Sunny, whose Indian specialities are exceptional. Thank you as well to Udyangani, Chandima, Sathya, and Nirusha for their wonderful service.

Chaminda from Housekeeping and the rest of the team did an excellent job keeping our rooms clean and comfortable, and were always warm and welcoming.

The pool bar team were friendly and added to the laid back atmosphere by the pool, while Harindu at the lobby bar served us some excellent cocktails and snacks.

Thank you to Lakmi and the front office team for accommodating our late checkout request so kindly and efficiently.

I’d also like to thank Vindya from the engineering team, who handled our request promptly and professionally, along with support from the security team.

Finally, thank you to General Manager Johan and Resort Manager Sriyangani for ensuring everything ran smoothly and for making our stay so enjoyable.

We loved the experience and will definitely be back.
title: Yet another relaxing getaway at Cinnamon Bentota Beach

text:
🌟 Even Better the Second Time – Cinnamon Bentota Beach is Truly Exceptional! 🌟

This was my second stay at Cinnamon Bentota Beach, and once again, it exceeded all expectations. From the warm welcome on arrival to the gracious send-off, everything was handled with care and professionalism.

The staff are outstanding – genuinely kind, attentive, and always ready to help with a smile. It’s clear they take great pride in making every guest feel special.

My room was clean, spacious, and beautifully decorated, with a stunning view of the ocean and lush surroundings. Waking up to that peaceful scenery was a perfect way to start each day.

Both dinner and breakfast were excellent – fresh, flavorful, and beautifully presented. The dining experience is a true highlight here.

This hotel keeps getting better. It’s rare to find a place where you feel so welcomed and relaxed every time you visit.

Looking forward to coming back again – highly recommended for anyone visiting Bentota!
title: 🌟 Even Better the Second Time – Cinnamon Bentota Beach is Truly Exceptional! 🌟

placeInfo/address: Matara Road 153 Km Post, Kamburugamuwa, Matara 81750 Sri Lanka
text:
We had a superb stay at the best location, the team of staff are generous with their time, kind and endlessly helpful.
We loved our breakfast (everything on offer- western, continental, fruit platters and super tasty rice porridge), lunch (calamari & samosas were a favourite) and fresh caught fish dinners all delicious and beautifully presented, whilst watching the rolling ocean (we were not here for a flat calm sea).  The  long pool is divine and so magical next to the beach.
Our rooms were amazing, with views of the sea, and beautiful gardens, and the layout was extremely comfortable and creatively designed to feel spacious and airey. Cloud like linens and with great bathrooms.And do try the shoulder massage.
It simply feels like paradise.
title: Paradise setting and brilliant hospitality

placeInfo/address: Matara Road 153 Km Post, Kamburugamuwa, Matara 81750 Sri Lanka
text: The superior deluxe room was amazing and so relaxing. We stayed here for 3 nights on our honeymoon and would definitely recommend choosing this room.  The staff were welcoming and tried their best to be helpful. Dinner by candlelight close to the beach was a very special and memorable occasion. The food was always good and the staff serving the food friendly and very knowledgeable.
title: Candlelight meals by the Indian Ocean

placeInfo/address: Matara Road 153 Km Post, Kamburugamuwa, Matara 81750 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Sleep with the doors and windows open to really appreciate the  cool breeze and sound of breaking waves throughout the night, instead A/C
text: We stayed in one of four 'Signature' suites of Sharavi Villas and couldn't have been happier. The clean white shuttering and individually colour coded rooms add a touch of individuality but the main prize goes to the well designed bedroom, lounge, seating areas, all of which benefit from an uninterrupted view of the rolling waves as they break on the shore alongside the huge 40metre swimming pool that fronts the four 'pavilions' each of three sizeable rooms. Dining is 'whenever you wish' and staff couldn't do enough for us. There's plenty to do locally and we took a lake boat ride to see thousands of fruit bats migrate from treetops to village pastures at sunset, followed by an early morning whale watching trip. If you don't really wish to move too far then visit the beautifully decorated Buddhist temple locally, Coconut Tree Hill or failing that why not participate in  cooking demonstration at the villas - we did - but be warned the hospitality is such that we felt that we never stopped eating (quite willingly) while at Sharavi. A very special stay in Mirissa
title: Clean and simple luxury on a beautiful sea shore

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Lynne-Michelle and Ian,

Thank you so much for your kind words! We’re thrilled to hear that your time at Sri Sharavi was just what you needed after your busy trip around Sri Lanka. It’s wonderful to know that you felt welcomed and well taken care of from the moment you arrived.

We’re delighted that you enjoyed the beautiful views, the pool, and the cocktails during happy hour! It’s also great to hear that the food brought back memories of fine dining in Australia, especially the fresh fish – we’re glad it lived up to your expectations.

We’re happy you appreciated our peaceful location, with the convenience of being close to Mirissa’s lively spots, and we’re especially grateful for the special mention of Suranga and Mudu. They will be so pleased to hear your feedback.

text: After a busy trip around sri lanka, Sri Sharavi was just what we needed. From the moment we arrived we felt welcomed and looked after. The rooms are absolutely beautiful overlooking the ocean that has waves flowing day and night. The pool was fantastic as were the happy hour coctails. The food reminded me of early fine dining days in Australia, the fresh fish was magnificent. Keep up the great work, Lynne-Michelle and Ian Hancock

placeInfo/address: Matara Road 153 Km Post, Kamburugamuwa, Matara 81750 Sri Lanka
text:
Sri Sharavi Beach Villas and Spa was the perfect resort to spend our last night and final full day in Sr Lanka. 
The welcome on arrival was warm and we were grateful for the cool towel and refreshing drink. 
Our villa was spacious and beautifully appointed and the view spectacular. We especially enjoyed the sound of the waves coming into shore. 
We dined on the balcony of our villa and appreciated a delicious dinner. The wait staff were friendly and attentive and looked after us brilliantly. 
Lounging by the pool was relaxing, and again the service was excellent. 
We had an early start for whale watching and the resort kindly prepared a packed breakfast for us to take along. 
Our stay here captured the beauty of Sri Lanka and the friendliness of the Sri Lankan people.
title: Hospitality at its finest

placeInfo/address: Matara Road 153 Km Post, Kamburugamuwa, Matara 81750 Sri Lanka
text:
We stayed 7 nights in this “paradise”
What a great hotel this is. Upon arrival we were taken to our room. We had booked the Ocean Signature suite. 
In one word, great. We have already visited many hotels. But never experienced this before. 
It felt like you had your own villa. 
Everyone can use a luxurious living room downstairs, where you can relax. 
The sound of the big waves all day long, wonderful!!
The staff also does everything for you. All so friendly. The hotel also exudes a certain tranquility. We completely recovered from a 13-day tour in Sri Lanka. 
It's just a shame that the food in the restaurant is so expensive. And especially because there is also an additional 30.5% in taxes, fees, etc. on top. Partly because of this, we hardly ate at the hotel. 
It was a holiday and hotel we will never forget.
title: Best hotel ever !!!

placeInfo/address: Matara Road 153 Km Post, Kamburugamuwa, Matara 81750 Sri Lanka
text: The kindest and most helpful staff we could wish for on our honeymoon and we believe the best food in Marissa.  We feel as though we are leaving friends behind.  Thanks Dimatu, Madu, Gayan, Chataranga and Suranga.  Sorry about my terrible spelling!
title: The kindest staff on our honeymoon

placeInfo/address: Matara Road 153 Km Post, Kamburugamuwa, Matara 81750 Sri Lanka
text:
We had a wonderful stay at the Sri Sharavi, the accommodation and service was excellent

All the accommodation was lovely, but if budget will allow I would highly recommend the ocean signature suites, which have wonderful views of the ocean.

The rooms are split between4 villas and you are able to use the open air lounge  and kitchen in your villa which is a lovely touch, breakfast and dinner can also be served here , it gives you that feeling that you have your own private villa.

The beach side dining area is a real treat and I will remember that view long after my tan has faded.  Food was expensive but of a very high standard.

We can't single out any one member of staff as they were all so wonderful, always ready to help, no request to small and always with lovely smiles on their faces.  You got the impression that they enjoyed working at Sri Sharavi and they wanted us to love it as much as they did.

The location was beautiful, so photogenic, it was a real shame that the beach had disappeared and that  access to the beach either side is limited,  but reading a reply to a recent review it looks like its on its way back. That said once you get used to  it not being there and with the pool being so lovely we didn't really miss it anyway.
title: Wonderful Stay, Wonderful Staff, Wonderful  View, Wonderful Experience

ownerResponse/text:
Thank you Annie - we are so glad you chose to stay at Sri Sharavi Beach Villas & Spa and had the holiday of a lifetime!

It is a pleasure to hear how Kenny and his team went out of their way to make your time so special.

We wish you safe onward travels - and we do hope to see you another time!
placeInfo/address: Matara Road 153 Km Post, Kamburugamuwa, Matara 81750 Sri Lanka
text:
If you’re looking for pure relaxation in paradise, complete with the biggest pool, you’ve found the perfect spot. Kenny and his team went above and beyond to make our stay unforgettable. The staff were incredibly attentive, making us feel like friends rather than guests. From amazing food and cocktails to a stunning villa, this place truly has it all.

One highlight was the best massage we’ve ever had in Sri Lanka – Kumara’s expertise is unmatched! A heartfelt thank you to Madha Gaean, Dimrhu, Surgha, and the fantastic pool attendant (apologies for not knowing how to spell your name) who ensured we always had fresh towels on our sunbeds every day.

While it’s not a budget destination, if you’re after something truly special and a holiday of a lifetime, this is the place to be.
title: Paradise on earth

ownerResponse/text:
We are very grateful to receive your review, and so glad to read that you had the best relaxing holiday! Thank you for noting the great service provided by our team, and that you enjoyed time at our Beach Hut Restaurant. 

And we hope to see you another time!
placeInfo/address: Matara Road 153 Km Post, Kamburugamuwa, Matara 81750 Sri Lanka
text: Sri Sharavi has a few Villas by the beach front with an amazing long pool. We stayed at the ocean facing room and it is amazing, the room is cleaned and made up regularly. We loved having drinks at the Hut and the bar staff has been very attentive and their service was top notch. Kenny and team at the front desk are super helpful as well, and helped sort out our stay and gave us great tips during our stay. The villa is located afew min from Mirissa Beach and Welligama, quite convenient with the tuk tuks. We spent the most in this stay during our two weeks in Sri Lanka, and we'd absolutely loved it, as it is reflected in the service level, cleanliness and the staffing resources they have.
title: Best relaxing Dec stay for family

ownerResponse/text:
What a pleasure it was to welcome you to Sri Sharavi! Kenny and our team enjoyed showing you around the property, and sharing all that we offer our guests. We are so glad to hear you enjoyed your meal and were well looked after by our team. 

We thank you for the recommendation - and next time, we hope you are able to stay a night or two with us!
placeInfo/address: Matara Road 153 Km Post, Kamburugamuwa, Matara 81750 Sri Lanka
text:
We were back in Mirissa and Weligama, our all-time favourite hotspots, and kicked off our holiday with a visit to the stunning Sri Sharavi Beach Villas for lunch , just a short 10-minute drive from Mirissa.
 
From the moment we arrived, we were warmly welcomed by Kenny, the villa manager, whose hospitality set the tone for the rest of our experience. The layout of the property is absolutely beautiful, with four stylish buildings, each housing three elegant rooms and suites, plus two additional rooms alongside a serene spa.
 
One of the standout features is the 43m infinity saltwater pool, which I believe is the largest in the area, an absolute showstopper! We couldn’t resist spending some time by the pool, soaking in the views and enjoying the tranquil atmosphere.
 
The food was equally memorable, with every dish served to perfection. The service from the team was nothing short of outstanding, friendly, attentive, and always ready with a smile.
 
I highly recommend Sri Sharavi Beach Villas to anyone looking for a mix of luxury, relaxation, and exceptional service in Mirissa. Whether you’re stopping by for a meal or planning a stay, it’s a place that will leave a lasting impression.
title: A Perfect Start to Our Holiday at Sri Sharavi Beach Villas!!!

Fantastische ervaring was het om in dit stijlvolle hotel te verblijven. Alles is tot in de puntjes geregeld. Het is enorm schoon en heeft prachtige grote kamers, met een mooie tuin als je het hotel binnenkomt. Een mooi zwembad met zout water. 
Vanaf het hotel kun je het strand op om de kracht van de natuur te ervaring door de hoge golven. In de avond hebben we een privé diner gehad met uitzicht op het strand. 
Madu willen we even in het bijzonder bedanken. Wat een prachtig mens ben je. Je straalt enorm veel positiviteit uit door je stralende lach. Ook de andere medewerkers bedankt voor jullie vriendelijke en goede service. Het voelde voor ons alsof we de koning en koningin waren...
title: Verwennerij in een luxe omgeving met prachtig uitzicht op de oceaan

The Dickman Resort is a lovely (very small) hotel, very very clean, with large comfortable beds, a good shower and delicious breakfast.

All the staff were really friendly and helpful, we would definitely recommend if you are looking to relax for a couple of days before exploring Sri Lanka - or at the end of your holiday if you want to be close to the Airport for your return home.

text:
We had the pleasure of staying 4 wonderful nights in this boutique hotel in Negombo.
Location is perfect, a block inland from the main street, so very peaceful.
Staff are a true highlight, with top class service in every respect, starting with the excellent breakfast service and continued throughout the day around the pool and hotel grounds.
Breakfast is excellent, with fresh fruit and a choice of main dishes such as omlettes and scrambled eggs with toast.
Pool area is amazing with plenty of both sun and shaded loungers. 
Just 15 mins from the main international airport (CMB) so the perfect hotel to begin or end your time in Sri Lanka!
Rooms are very comfortable, with full air-conditioning, TV, tea & coffee making facilities and a hairdryer. 
Wifi network also very strong and reliable. 
Highly recommended!!!
title: Hidden Gem in Negombo

roomTip: Ask for the Sri Lankan breakfast if you like spicy food!
text:
I hardly ever write reviews but the Dickman Resort is one of those places where you just feel so positive after staying with them that you want to tell people how wonderful it is.  From the beginning of the booking experience 
 with reliable, quick communication prior to my trip, to the 2:00 a.m. pickup at the airport upon arrival, to the great conversations with staff and other guests, to the peaceful warm feeling you can't help but have while you're there, I can't say enough good things about staying here.  The room is spacious and very comfortable.  The bed was excellent.  The early morning swim in the lovely pool listening to the birds wake up around you is really a treat.  The breakfast is outstanding and they even made me a special breakfast of dahl curry, roti and fried eggs with coconut sambal that I wish I could eat every morning.  The fresh fruit plate that comes with breakfast is heavenly.  Most importantly, the staff make you feel like you're part of the family from the minute you arrive and throughout the whole stay.  I will come here anytime I will be in Sri Lanka and would highly recommend it to anyone looking for a small, personal boutique hotel experience.  Thank you Dickman Hotel for making the start of my trip fantastic!
title: Can't imagine a better experience

text: For accommodation options in Negombo, I can unreservedly recommend the Dickman. It's really a mini-resort, built around the central courtyard and pool. Its shade and tropical colours offer relief from Negombo's dusty streets. The rooms are large, airy, cool and clean; there's a nice selection of sizes and aspects. Reliable aircon and wifi. But it's the staff who make the place: Thilina, Danu, Damith and colleagues are welcoming and charming, always happy to assist no matter your request or query, including (most valuably) about Sri Lankan culture. I'm fresh from my third visit - a real home away from home.

What a pleasure it was to read your heartfelt review — thank you for taking the time to share your experience and for your generous recommendation!
We’re truly delighted to hear that your stay exceeded expectations and that you felt genuinely valued during your time with us. Creating an atmosphere where our guests feel special, respected, and well cared for is exactly what we strive for every day, and your words are a wonderful reminder that those efforts matter.
It’s fantastic to know that the value and quality of your experience matched your expectations — and more. We're so pleased the room design, especially the in-room hot tub, made a lasting impression. It’s meant to be a luxurious touch, and we’re thrilled it became a highlight of your stay.
We’re also glad you appreciated the overall cleanliness and daily maintenance of the property. Our housekeeping team takes great pride in keeping everything immaculate for our guests to enjoy. And it’s lovely to hear that the pool area — with its refreshing water and shaded spaces — offered a perfect setting to relax and unwind.
Your compliments about the restaurant and the convenience of in-room dining mean a lot to us. Whether enjoying a quiet meal in your room or exploring nearby restaurants on foot, we’re happy to offer options that suit every mood and moment.
Though your visit was brief, we’re truly grateful you chose to spend it with us. We sincerely hope we’ll have the pleasure of welcoming you back for a longer stay in the future — one that allows even more time to relax and create lasting memories by the bay.
With Grateful Hearts, Amaranthé Bay.

text:
After Our wedding we arrived early morning to Trincomalee by Night Express Train. We arrived to the Amaranthe Bay at around 06.30 am on 19th April. The boy who was at the reception welcomed us at the entrance and given welcome drinks & treated us.
We booked only 01 night but we extended 02 nights as well, 01st night Deluxe room and 02nd Night Junior Suite Room. Mr. Priwin helped me to make the reservation over the phone and did the reservation properly. Mr. Sri (Manager Of the Hotel) is genuine &  he also helped us a lot in our whole stay. 
Arranging Fruit platters & Bed decoration was amazing. Junior Suite room with Jacuzzi also was amazing !! 
Jacintha from Housekeeping, Dilshan from Bar (Barman), Restaurant all staffs & Singam from Pool are very kind of us & very helpful.
Mr. Sri arranged a Lagoon boat tour and it was amazing. Nothing to say bad experience. All good and hotel management selected the best hotel associates to manage their property. Specialy Should be mentioned Mr.Mayuran's (Front desk associat) service also excellent. I don't know the name the boy who carried our luggages,he also given a good service. 
Foods, Rooms & Service is Five Star !!
Thank You for your kind hospitality Mr. Sri & Team !!
Cheers !!

ownerResponse/text:
Thank you so much for taking the time to share your lovely review — and for choosing Amaranthé Bay as the destination for such a meaningful and once-in-a-lifetime moment Kemeko!
It was truly our honor to be part of your honeymoon, and we are absolutely thrilled to hear that your stay was everything you hoped for and more.
Your kind words about our hotel and team genuinely mean the world to us. We believe that the heart of a great stay lies in genuine hospitality, and to hear that our staff’s warmth and attentiveness left a lasting impression is the greatest reward we could ask for.
We’re so happy to know that you found the rooms beautiful and spacious — the perfect setting for comfort and relaxation. The natural beauty of the bay, with its gentle waters, hermit crabs, and fish, is one of the most magical parts of our location, and we’re delighted that you were able to enjoy it during your time with us. Many of our guests find a sense of peace and wonder watching the life around the lagoon, and it’s lovely to know it added to your honeymoon experience.
We’re also truly pleased that you enjoyed the meals included in your breakfast and dinner plan. Our culinary team pours a lot of heart into crafting dishes that reflect both flavor and warmth, and your appreciation for the rice and our kitchen’s responsiveness will certainly bring a smile to their faces.
It’s incredibly rewarding to know that you would love to stay with us again during your next visit to Trincomalee — we would be absolutely delighted to welcome you back. Whether for another romantic escape or a peaceful retreat, we’ll be here to make your stay just as special as the first.
Wishing you both a lifetime of happiness and love, Amaranthé Bay.

roomTip: ホテルの近くに飲食店はありますが、道が暗いのでホテルでの夕食をおすすめします。
text: 新婚旅行で、朝食と夕食つきプランを予約しました。まず、ホテルのスタッフさんがとても親切で大変素晴らしいホテルでした！お部屋も綺麗で広く、ホテル前の湾ではヤドカリや魚を観察でき、楽しく過ごせました。また、ご飯もとても美味しく、スタッフさんの対応もとても良かったです。トリンコマリーに滞在する際はまた利用したいです！

text: Были с женой в конце марта в отеле Thaproban Pavilion Waves. Очень понравилось расположение отеля, вся инфраструктура в пешей доступности. До пляжа 10 минут пешком, город Галле в 15 минутах езды на тук туке. Нам предоставили прекрасный номер с видом на море. В номере есть все необходимое: фен, мини-холодильник, большой балкон с шикарным видом на море. Номер убирали ежедневно, уборка выполнялась качественно. Единственный минус номера - запах в ванной то ли канализации, то ли сырости. При работе вытяжки запаха не было. Но было бы хорошо, если бы этот недостаток исправили. Персонал очень приветливый, отзывчивый, решают все вопросы. Огромное спасибо сотруднику ресепшена по имени Парсад, он сделал наш отдых незабываемым!
title: Полная Акуна Матата на Шри-Ланке🏝️

text:
Долго выбирали отель и наткнулись на этот. Любовь с первого взгляда. Оправдал все ожидания. Маленький, тихий, уютный. Виды из номера потрясающие. Шум волн за окном. По камням бегают крабики, а в бассейн перед камнями волной забрасывает рыбок - снорклинг не нужен.
Завтраки разнообразные и вкусные, а персонал улыбчивый и дружелюбный. Есть два бассейна. Один с морской водой. Лежишь в нем и смотришь на океан. 
До моря спокойной хотьбой минут 5-7. Вся туристическая инфраструктура под боком. До пляжа Джангл бич можно пешком дойти. 
Номера убирают ежедневно.
Не помешал бы косметический ремонт номерного фонда, но  это уже мелочи. Плюсов гораздо больше. С удовольствием вернулись бы в этот отель снова.
title: Шикарный отдых на Шри Ланке

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,
We are really happy for your wonderful review as a TEAM. Thank you for taking lot of time to appreciating our team and sharing your awesome experience with other readers. We are look forward to welcome you once again as usual. 😊
placeInfo/address: Wella Devala Road, Yaddehimulla, Unawatuna 80600 Sri Lanka
text:
Всем привет 👋🏻 уже второй год подряд мы с подругой выбираем эту страну для отдыха и вернёмся сюда вновь. В этом году выбрали отель Thaproban Pavilion Waves  и не ошиблись. Для Унаватуны это очень достойный уровень. 

Месторасположение: Отель красивый, расположен в живописном месте. Утопает в зелени с одной стороны и имеет прекрасный вид на океан, к сожалению не купабельный.  До пляжа 5-7 минут пешком по прямой дороге и минут 15 в обход ( попадаешь почти в центр пляжа). Зато в этот раз мы отлично изучили эту часть Унаватуны.  В пешей доступности Джангл Бич, вокруг очень много неплохих кафе.

Номер: Весь номерной фонд расположен с видом на океан, у каждого номера на 2 этаже есть балкончики ,в категории номеров Queen king size (такой был у нас) окно с балкона небольшое. Номер просторный, хорошая кровать, диванчик, телевизор, чайник и чайные принадлежности, кофе, заварка, сахар, исправно работающий кондиционер, сейф, холодильник. В ванной фен, ванные принадлежности, полотенца, шапочки для душа, мыло для рук, крем, гель для душа, шампунь, кондиционер для волос. Все с местными ароматами поэтому мы использовали свои средства. Каждый день приносили по 0,5 чистой воды на человека. Переходники для розеток нам не понадобились, все подходило. 
Уборка была каждый день, полотенца чистые в номере меняли каждый день, бельё постельное несколько раз, возможно через день. Номер в принципе был достаточно чистый, хотя все пишут что отель нуждается в косметическом ремонте. 

Завтраки: Достойные завтраки.  В сравнении с тем же Тайландом возможно скромнее,  но за 10 дней нам ничего не надоело. Дома питаемся однозначно не в таком разнообразии. Омлет, яичница, соки, выпечка в разнообразии, овощи, фрукты, сыры, сосиски, бекон, каши, местная еда, блинчики, чай, кофе. За отдельную плату можно заказать кофе из кофемашины, вполне кстати сносный. Все вкусно. Персонал внимательный. 

Развлечения: за 10 дней нашего прибывания отель устраивал 3 мероприятия, с танцами, с музыкой. Один раз выступал Life Band, в другой день был DJ. В эти дни действовала система фуршета на ужин. Мероприятия длились максимум до 11 вечера. Неплохой вариант для тех кто привязан к деткам и так далее. 

Персонал: Персонал отзывчивый, приветливый, дружелюбный, заботливый. Все просьбы выполнялись охотно. Менеджер гостиницы всегда интересуется все ли нам нравится. Каждый день с улыбкой нам выдавались пляжные полотенца. В принципе все делали для того чтоб наш отдых был отличным. 

Окружение: местоположение отеля ещё прекрасно и тем что находится слегка отдалено от шумных улочек и прогуливаясь от пляжа до отеля можно встретить павлинов, варанов, дружелюбных собак, обезьян, пальмовых белок. 

Хотим поблагодарить всю команду отеля за теплый приём. Желаем вам процветания.
title: Наша вторая и не последняя поездка на Шри-Ланку

placeInfo/address: St. Sebastian's Road, Kalutara 12000 Sri Lanka
text:
From the moment we arrived at Anantara Kalutara, we were immersed in a world of serene luxury and warm hospitality. The location is stunning—nestled between a peaceful lagoon and the Indian Ocean, the resort offers breathtaking views and a sense of calm that’s hard to find elsewhere.

The staff were exceptional Specially Uneska —always attentive, smiling, and ready to assist with anything we needed. Check-in was seamless, and we were welcomed with a refreshing drink and a warm introduction to the property.

Our room was spacious, impeccably clean, and tastefully designed with traditional Sri Lankan elements blended beautifully with modern comforts. We especially loved the private balcony overlooking the water and the open-concept bathroom with a luxurious bathtub.

Dining was a highlight of our stay. Each meal was a treat—from fresh seafood at Olu to the delicious international breakfast buffet. The chefs clearly take pride in their craft, and the variety offered meant there was something for every palate.

We also enjoyed the spa and yoga sessions, which added an extra layer of relaxation to our stay. The resort grounds are beautifully maintained, with lush gardens, a quiet beach, and tranquil pool areas perfect for unwinding.

Whether you’re looking for a romantic getaway, a family holiday, or simply a break from the hustle and bustle, Anantara Kalutara offers an unforgettable experience. We left feeling refreshed, pampered, and already planning our return.

Highly recommended!
title: A Tranquil Luxury Escape – Anantara Kalutara Exceeded Expectations

placeInfo/address: St. Sebastian's Road, Kalutara 12000 Sri Lanka
text:
Остались под большим впечатлением от этого отеля . Очень чуткие к желаниям гостей , хорошее настроение посетителей у них искренне в приоритете . Первый раз летели в Шри Ланку, немного опасались что не подойдет кухня так как не любим белый рис, карри и традиционную Азиатскую кухню . Но в этом прекрасном отеле была европейская кухня и так же азиатская, мы в итоге прониклись и азиатской тоже . Все было очень вкусно . Пару раз за ужином подходил шеф позвал и спрашивал что мы хотим , сказал что приготовлю что пожелаете . 
Я сама дизайнер Интерьера и могу сказать что номер в котором мы жили с очень красивым дизайном и качественным ремонтом . В номере каждый день качественно убирались , много комплиментов вроде большой фруктовой корзины , или милого набора конфеток .
 Погода так же была супер хотя нам говорили что в апреле будут дожди ,но за 2 недели дождь днем был только пару раз , быстро закончился . В общем в восторге от шри ланка, от отеля . Однозначно его всем смело рекомендуем . 
Спасибо этим работникам отеля : Сампат, Иша, Таринду
title: Спасибо за наш прекрасный отпуск !

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Valued Guest,

Thank you for sharing your recent experience with Anantara Kalutara Resort.  It’s wonderful to hear that you appreciated the natural beauty of our setting, the attentive service from our team. That said, we’re very sorry to learn that certain aspects of your visit did not meet your expectations.  While our aim is to create comfortable and relaxing environments throughout the resort, we understand that Sri Lanka’s climate can be challenging, and your suggestions about enhancing cooling options in the bar and restaurant areas are greatly appreciated. We are actively reviewing this to explore better solutions. 

We also regret the inconvenience caused by the room’s location and the lack of orientation upon arrival.  Regarding your ocean view room upgrade, we’re truly sorry that it did not meet your expectations in terms of value or distinction. We continually strive to enhance our standards, and your feedback provides us with important insight into areas that need more attention.

We genuinely hope you left with some fond memories, despite the areas of disappointment, and we would welcome the opportunity to host you again with an experience that truly reflects the excellence we aim to deliver.

Warm Regards, 
Keith Tomkies – Cluster General Manager 
Anantara Kalutara Resort
placeInfo/address: St. Sebastian's Road, Kalutara 12000 Sri Lanka
text:
This is an undoubtedly beautiful hotel in a lovely setting.
The service throughout is fantastic and having room service and drinking sundowners on the balcony to the sound of the ocean was very special.
Food at breakfast very nice with a wide variety and the best cheese we had on our whole tour .
The room servicing by Saman was very thorough.
The room and shower were both lovely and aircon and fan provided a lovely cool haven. 
However there are issues :

The room is the only place to cool down in the whole complex, even the pools are warm . The climate in SL is brutal at times and the bar ( with only one portable air conditioner) and the restaurant ( with none ) are just too hot .

Our room was a very long way away from bar/reception , it took us our whole stay to find the easiest route , we were never shown on arrival.

The cooling system in room needs tweaking. When on balcony at night if doors are open ( which they need to be to cool balcony) the room floor turns into a lethal skating rink .

On night one we had the buffet at a cost of £25 each ( and that is with allegedly 40% off ) , it was ordinary at best , and the restaurant is too warm .
There are 2 other eateries up the road , Red Lobster and Coconut Bay far superior and much cheaper 

Finally we paid over £300 for a room upgrade to a “ deluxe ocean view room “ …. the room was the same as others in our group and the ocean view was at a distance and partially obscured by trees .
There were no other added extras which on other upgrades we’ve had in e.g Costa Rica and Malaysia, disappointing
title: Mixed bag

placeInfo/address: 01, Radella, Avissawella - Hatton - Nuwara Eliya Hwy,, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/addressObj/street1: 01, Radella, Avissawella - Hatton - Nuwara Eliya Hwy,
text:
As a stop in the tea country you can’t really go wrong with the Langdale. Definitely a little bit of Britain so make sure you’re OK with that. The rooms are simple but have most of what you need except a fridge. Views are lovely and the main areas have a bit of the feel of your Gran’s house but clean and tidy nevertheless. All food is prepared individually and the waiting staff are friendly and don’t miss a trick.
If you are staying definitely go half board as it is about 20 minutes from Nuwara Eliya. 
They have a short hike you can do, a lovely heated but small pool and tennis and badminton court. Some previous reviews said it was in a busy area but we struggled to find any business nearby.
The only thing you need to be aware of (and it did not bother us) is that there are some lovely rooms in an annexe which is very peaceful and where we stayed. Room 208 has views to die for but is near an extractor duct from the kitchen. They do turn it off when not in use and it did not disturb our sleep. However in the early evening you can’t really have balcony doors and windows open unless you like the smell of cooking onions and garlic!
title: A lovely British style hotel delivered superbly by the dedicated staff.

placeInfo/addressObj/street1: 01, Radella, Avissawella - Hatton - Nuwara Eliya Hwy,
text:
This is the one and only Boutique hotel we stayed during our tour around the country. We felt the difference when we arrived at the site with a contemporary welcome. This is at Nanu Oya, about 15 minutes’ drive away from Nuwara Eliya Town towards Thalawakele.

We had to change the allocated room as the view was a bit obstructed. It is a small hotel with about 14 rooms in total with few room categories in an old bungalow. There was a temperature controlled (manually) stunning swimming pool in this hill country. Garden was very nicely decorated. They have their own vege garden in the hotel itself. Meals were very good.

There was a heater but no Air Conditioner in the room as it’s in Nuwara Eliya, but we felt too hot in the nighttime and had to use the fan. It was a different experience for us. Collection of Amenities were very good
title: Boutique hotel in Nuwara Eliya

text:
We stayed at the Langdale Boutique Hotel at the end of October 2024. The hotel impressed us with its views, interior and friendly staff. Imagine, you are having breakfast on the terrace with wide windows, behind which there is an amazingly beautiful landscape - green tea plantations, small villages, country roads. Everything is like a toy. Then you go for a walk along the road around the hills, where even more beautiful views open up. We did not have time to take photos. We wanted to capture every moment of our walk. After the walk, you swim in the pool and in front of you are heavenly meadows. There is a wonderful spa here that will allow you to completely relax and dissolve in nature.

Thanks to the hotel staff for their hospitality and help. We would like to come back here again.
title: Two days of paradise

roomTip: Absolute aanrader in de buurt van Nuwara Eliya wilt verblijven. Beter hier dan in de stadje en je bent zo in Nanuoya voor de trein naar Ella
text:
Alles vanaf het moment van aankomen tot aan het vertrek was een prachtige ervaring . De gastvrijheid en de oprechte vriendelijkheid van het personeel is gewoonweg heel fijn om te ervaren. 
De kamer 205 is heel mooi , met adembenemend uitzicht over de vallei en theevelden. Het diner was erg lekker en met zorg bereid.
Na ons heerlijke ontbijt deze maakte we een hele mooie wandeling door de theeplantages rondom het estate. 
Nog even lekker liggen bij het verwarmde zwembad, voordat we netjes werden uitgezwaaid door het lieve personeel, die ons nog wat lekkers meegaven voor onderweg.
Jammer dat we maar 1 nacht konden blijven. Dit hotel is een echte aanrader.
title: Langdale Estate Een paradijs in Nuwara Elyia

text:
Everything about this boutique hotel was wonderful.
We had a warm welcome and there was always someone to help us get whatever we needed. The pool was beautifully warm and we had an unforgettable afternoon swimming in the pouring monsoon rain.
Everyone was prepared to go the extra mile, from Shashila on the reception desk to  Selvi in the spa and the executive chef who made up our favourite coconut buns especially for us.
General manager Fouzi Mohideen even arranged a private tea tasting at the Somerset Estate, which was lead by the regional manager and turned into a 2 hour 'master class' on tea growing, manufacture and distribution.
The whole team from top to bottom deserve commendation and we will be back.
title: A stunning  place to stay

placeInfo/address: Dutch Bay Road Kudawa Road, Kalpitiya 61360 Sri Lanka
text:
I have never seen this high level of hospitality, as KSL has
The management and the staff makes this place, they have been collected like jewels from all over the country and brought to this place. I always had a feeling of home

Mr. Leon - the boss of the bar, he healed my cold with his signature cocktails. He is so passionate about his job, that inspires to come back to the bar :))
Ms. Anne - gives such a friendly vibes to everyone! She has this talent to be blended with guests and still perform her duties on high level at the bar
Tikiri - I believe he is a local legend, because whatever is a question: kite surfing lessons, transportation, helping with accommodation - he is the one. Super patient and inspiring as an instructor, it was easy for me to improve my kiting skills with him
Sebastian, Dil, and the main man at the dining area (I forgot his name) are the guards of the place: caring of all guests, helping the team when needed and at the same time always up to chill together with guests when work is done. 

The vibes are awesome!
Even when there is no wind - there are plenty of things to do and the team cares about it: yoga, massage (god bless this guy, his hands are healing), wake boarding, games, library

Place is super clean, plenty of choices for the food (so tasty, it’s easy to gain some weight😀), artistic touch of each bungalow and common area - I felt love in every detail

Bravo 👏 to the management and the staff, who bring soul to this place. Will definitely come here again
title: Amazing vibes

placeInfo/address: Dutch Bay Road Kudawa Road, Kalpitiya 61360 Sri Lanka
roomTip: The new beach bungalows look amazing.
text:
I have been visiting KSL for more than 5 years. Everything you could want for is taken care of. Originally I went as a solo traveller and the lodge style  with long communal table in the dining area was always great to meet like minded people. But this time I took the whole family and had my son learn to kite. Their food is buffet style but always amazing  and a great variety of different dishes over the 5 days we spent. They have a range of very basic accommodation through to decent mid range bungalows and are now developing more high end options. In the summer we used to kite in the Lagoon with daily shuttles taken care of. But this time we were able to kite directly from the beach, which was amazing, and then chill out in the new beach bar. 

They have incredible staff onsite and I really cannot reccomend this place more highly. Just book early as they were fully booked for this trip.  All these new improvements since my last trip reinforce the best is getting better.
title: Still the Best in Kalpatiya and getting better

ownerResponse/text:

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Valued Guest,

Thank you very much for sharing your wonderful feedback on the architecture tour. We’re truly pleased to hear that your experience with Ms. Sanduni de Fonseka was both insightful and inspiring. Her passion for Geoffrey Bawa’s design philosophy and Sri Lankan architecture truly brings the tour to life, and we are glad that you were able to enjoy such an enriching conversation with her.

The architectural brilliance of Cinnamon Bentota Beach is indeed a journey of emotions and details, and we’re delighted that you took the time to appreciate every aspect of it.

Thank you once again for your kind recommendation, and we look forward to welcoming you back for more memorable experiences in the future!

Warm regards,
Piyumithara Yapa
Guest Relations Officer
Cinnamon Bentota Beach
placeInfo/address: Galle Rd Colombo-Galle-Hambantota-Wellawaya Highway, Bentota 80500 Sri Lanka
text:
We had such an enriching experience during the architecture tour with the lovely Sanduni de Fonseka, Curator of Art and Culture at Cinnamon Beach Hotel by Geoffrey Bawa. You can see her passion beyond her work. It was a pleasure to hear not only the accurate historical and theoretical notions, but also the person behind the architect through his design. We had a very interesting conversation about Sri Lankan architecture, Geoffrey Bawa and Minnette de Silva and she could answer excellently to all our questions with a personal and critical view!

Not to mention the architecture itself: emotions will play a relevant role. Don’t forget to pay attention to all the cleaver and beautiful details! ;)

For all these reasons we can highly recommend the tour!
title: Not only a tour but an exciting journey into architecture!

text:
Das wunderschöne Hotel liegt auf 600 m inmitten einer Teeplantage. Die Zimmer sind traumhaft und allein der Pool macht einen Aufenthalt zu einem Erlebnis.
Besonders haben wir uns jedoch die Freundlichkeit des Personals verliebt.
Alle sind sehr zuvorkommend. Der Hotelmanager kümmert sich persönlich. Mit Isuru hatten wir einen erfahrenen Wanderführer, der uns bei einer Wanderung ums Hotel die Pflanzen, Tiere und Geschichte des Hotels erklärte.
Das Essen war sehr gut. Vielen Dank nochmal an alle 🙏
title: Ein Träumchen

placeInfo/address: Elkaduwa Road Meenawatte Estate, Kandy, Wattegama 20000 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: Simpson's Forest - Luxury Boutique Resort & Spa
text:
We stayed for 2 nights as part of a private drive tour of Sri Lanka, but wish we could have stayed longer.    From the moment we arrived we felt we were special.   The staff were welcoming, smiling, polite and ready to deal with any queries we had.   We were taken on an evening nature walk by ....., the resident naturalist, who was very knowledgeable and informative of all the different vegetation and wildlife we came across.   A memorable experience thanks to Tashani who is a valuable asset to Simpson Forrest, always on hand to help and answer any questions on nature.

The rooms were delightful and well equipped with comfortable bed in the colonial style, leading a good nights sleep.    All the food was delicious, which coupled with the great presentation equalled  a fine dining restaurant.      The chef Ranga who came out to talk to us after the evening meal, deserves a special mention and commendation, though all the staff deserve a compliment as well but cannot recall all their names.

We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and cannot fault anything.    We would happily return for a longer stay.    On this tour we have stayed at a total of 8 different hotels all rated 3 or 4 Star.     One was abysmal, while all the others were very good and one, Simpson's Forrest, exceptionally good.     Book it, you won't be disappointed.
title: A truly great and memorable experience

text: We stayed at Simpson’s Forest for one night in March 2025. The beautiful and serene hotel is situated around 40minutes by car and therefore most Uber and PickMe drivers will not come to the hotel. It is however a great place to relax away from the city which the hotel staff will make sure you do. We were offered a tour with Isuru who is very knowledgeable not only about tea but about the entire flora surrounding the stunning hotel, telling us many interesting facts. We also had nice lunches and dinner and the wait staff was super attentive and friendly. Especially our lovely waiter Wasantha exceeded our expectations. Thank you for a great stay!
title: Lovely stay in the hills around Kandy

This hotel was simply amazing we thoroughly enjoyed our 2 day stay everything about it was incredible even the food was excellent. 
I would like to say something about ISURU, the naturalist who gave us a personal tour of the hill behind the hotel which included a tea plantation which produces “Simpson tea”.

I highly recommend anyone staying at this hotel take the tour with ISURU.

roomTip: Der Pool ist super aber es gibt nur wenige Liegeplätze
text:
Er hat uns bei einer sehr schönen Tour Tier und Pflanzenwelt der Gegend näher gebracht. 
Dabei geht er so in seiner Rolle auf, dass man das Gefühl bekommt das man mit einen guten Freund gerade durch seine Heimat lauft. Der seinem Fachwissen mit einen teilen möchte. 
Dabei ist er aber keinesfalls aufdringlich.
Zudem ist er sehr wissbegierig, und sprich auch gut Englisch.
So das man sich gut mit ihm austauschen  kann. 
Und selbst wenn die Leute nicht gut Englisch sprechen versucht er sie aktiv zu verstehen und fragt zur Not auch nochmal nach.
 Insgesamt war es eine sehr schöne Tour die unserer ganzen Reisegruppe gefallen hat.
title: Tour mit Isuru

placeInfo/address: Elkaduwa Road Meenawatte Estate, Kandy, Wattegama 20000 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: Simpson's Forest - Luxury Boutique Resort & Spa
roomTip: Stay for longer than a couple of nights
text:
We spent 5 nights at Simpson's and enjoyed everything about it. 

Temperatures were very pleasant being in the tea country and away from the heat.

Our room was superb and although I am not a fan of buffet food the choices and quality on offer were excellent and changed my mind. 

The infinity pool is a short distance from the rooms but a buggy is available, although it made for a pleasant stroll with a viewing platform along the way to watch any birds. 

The resident naturalist, Isuru, was always available to guide and explain the local wildlife and added to our time there.

We ventured out to Sembuwatta Lake (awful road, but fun) and Hunas Falls for a change of scenery and would not hesitate to return or recommend.
title: Great location with spectacular views

text: We stayed in 8 hotels in Sri Lanka, all luxury boutique-this was probably my favourite. The room was a self-contained villa with 2 bicycles to get around. The property is in a stunning rural location surrounded by their own organic rice paddies. Birds and animals everywhere especially peacocks. Stayed for 2 nights and felt completely spoilt. Cannot comment on value for money as part of a package.
title: Stunning rural location and everything else to match

placeInfo/address: Kotikambokka 91200 Sri Lanka
roomTip: De bungalows aan de bosrand lijken vrij donker
text:
Prachtig gelegen ecoresort in een dembenemend mooi natuurgebied. Fantastische staff, zalig eten en heerlijke slaapervaring doordat je je echt onderdeel voelt van de natuur. De huisjes hebben een mooie grote veranda en wij sliepen in de Wel Vidana bungalow waardoor we uitkeken over de rijstvelden en genoten van een open badkamer wat een extra mooie ervaring gaf. We genoten van iedere seconde. Ook het zwembad is prachtig gelegen en onderhouden met perfecte ligbedjes. Tijd om te lezen heb je niet, omdat je je ogen uitkijkt naar de wonderschone omgeving. 

Een tip voor het hotel is om te denken aan het aanleggen van een zitterras bij het zwembad met een kleine kaart en de mogelijkheid om daar iets te drinken te bestellen. Een algehele opfrissing/restyling van het interieur van de lobby, het restaurant en de kamers kan wat ons betreft voor een nóg mooiere ervaring zorgen.
title: Prachtig gelegen ecoresort met perfecte service en keuken

text:
The best relaxing experience ever !! I’ve always loved the A-la-carte menus than the typical buffet food and this had the best ever home made authentic Sri Lankan dishes !! More than anything the view of the hotel is just amazing as even if we sit outside the room to have morning tea or to have a dip in the pool to chill over a drink/chat or while having dinner or morning walks down the paddy fields, we were always surrounded with a beautiful calming view that cannot be just explained in just view words !! 

Most importantly I would like to mention the amazing talented and friendly staff who supported us as their hospitality, caring service and knowledge shared with us on the paddy fields were superb !! One special note to be added is on the support they gave me to hold my 4 months old baby while we enjoy our meals were truly loving and caring !! Not that the hotel has a day care as such but the generosity of the staff including Sanduni and her team were just great !! 

Special credit goes to the General Manager of the hotel; Mr. Nadhun by attending to each and every detail not only for us but for all the other guests too as the hotel was fully booked but still he ensured to communicate with all the guests as possible and make them feel comfortable. The rooms were perfectly cool even without AC, and the open washroom was the best as we chose those unique rooms !! We went for two nights but felt like staying further so I’m definitely going again ❤️
title: One of the best honeymoon destinations!!

placeInfo/address: Kotikambokka 91200 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Get out of your comfort zone and try all the local foods.
text: The location and lush grounds overlooking the paddy fields with wild peacocks, peahens, and lush foliage are extremely tranquil. The rooms were large, well-appointed, and so very comfortable. We ate dinner and breakfast here, and the meals were fabulous. A special thanks to Faisal, in the dining area, who walked us through the hotel’s philosophy and local food to try and provided excellent service along with the rest of the dining staff members. Our personal room butler, Lishali, was extremely helpful and very sweet. Overall, we loved our stay.
title: A wonderful and ecologically friendly stay!

placeInfo/address: Kotikambokka 91200 Sri Lanka
roomTip: At least plan for two night for the best experience
text:
Our one-night stay at Jetwing Kaduruketha was an unforgettable experience! We booked the Wele Vidana Villa, which offered stunning views of the paddy fields and the Punagala mountain range—truly a feast for the eyes.

From the moment we made the reservation to the time we checked out, the hospitality was exceptional. A special shoutout to Shakya Manamperi, who ensured that every detail of our stay was handled perfectly. From the warm welcome with delicious raw mango juice and sweet snacks to the thoughtful arrangements, everything was impeccable. The Sara Vita session was an added delight!

The personalized butler service, led by Ayesha, was top-notch. She went above and beyond to take care of all our needs, ensuring our stay was as comfortable as possible. The entire staff deserves praise for their friendliness, attentiveness, and willingness to accommodate every request, from luggage assistance to customized experiences.

Jetwing Kaduruketha spans over 60 acres of natural beauty, with a variety of villas and options to suit every preference. The food was absolutely delicious, with generous portions and a wide range of options, including healthy village-style meals. Every meal was a treat!

The activities offered are incredible and customizable. From bird watching and trekking to an immersive village experience, there’s something for everyone. We even had the option of arranging a pool deck candlelight dinner, which is perfect for special moments.

This place is ideal for a relaxing getaway, whether you’re traveling as a couple or with family. We wholeheartedly recommend Jetwing Kaduruketha for anyone looking to unwind amidst nature with unparalleled hospitality. We can’t wait to visit again!
title: A Memorable Stay at Jetwing Kaduruketha

placeInfo/address: Kotikambokka 91200 Sri Lanka
text:
If you want to experience the best hospitality and best views of farming culture you should never miss Kaduruketha of jetwing .
Every single person from the crew is dressed with a helping smile to make the atmosphere friendly and welcoming.
Special note on food , it will be really hard for you to find a food with bad taste.
Every side of the food is taste wonderful. 
Ayesha and Sanduni was behind us for any requirement and never said no to anything.
So highly appreciate their hospitality through out.
title: Awesome

placeInfo/address: Kotikambokka 91200 Sri Lanka
text:
It was after 8 years that we stayed in Kaduruketha again. Most of the hotel appearances, buildings, and surroundings were the same. But the welcome was changed. It was a remarkable welcome with their authentic and traditional condimental snacks and the welcome drinks options.  ‘Sara Bulath wita’ introduction was quite an attractive and unique factor which distinguished Kadurukeda from all other hotels.  

Dinner was Ala carte. We receive very good portion sizes from every meal. “We mostly loved ‘black pork curry’ and ‘Watalappam’. Special Thanks for ‘Nana- Faizal (Restaurant executive)’ for his tremendous explanations of food, drinks and mainly every aspect of the meal and service. Finally, the ‘Sukku Malli Coffee’ was great too after a huge diet. Cheff, your meals were great. Sorry we couldn’t talk to you.  

Nadun (GM), Thank you very much for keeping this agriculturally based hotel with organic paddy fields and all other hotel components. Special thanks for all the staff for maintaining this beautiful place with great hospitality.  We tasted the heirloom rice packets (Sri Lankan Organic) we received from the hotel and they are very soft and quite fresh with a great taste.
title: Great accommodation based on theme paddy fields

placeInfo/address: Kotikambokka 91200 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Book one of the nicer rooms!
text: We stayed two nights in this little gem of a place, nestled at the foot of a mountain, surrounded by rice paddies and beautiful peacocks! Pros- amazing views, food was excellent (no buffets here but fresh made to order food), great service from Faisal in the restaurant. We appreciate that he takes time to get to know the guests and shares his life experiences too- it makes for a very personalized and enjoyable experience. The tea and French press coffee were exquisite. They have an a la carte menu but quality is top notch! Nice pool are and loungers. Cons- no A/C but there is a fan and mosquito nets; rooms are old and could use refurbishment in way of new floors and updating the furniture and bathroom. Also the rooms to the left of the dining area appear nicer with huge front balconies and nice furniture. We were in the cottages on the other side. There are no windows but areas that look like windows, have screens and bamboo blinds. The vibe here is being one with nature but I think they still need to upgrade the rooms and can maintain that theme. We very much appreciated the parting gift of black pepper to take home and use in our cooking- sweet touch! If you want the party Ella experience, this is not the place for you. This is a tranquil and scenic respite without much of a hotel vibe. I would consider returning if they updated the rooms. Also, they should get golf carts so young boys don’t have to push a wheelbarrow with heavy guest luggage- this broke my heart.
title: Know what you want before you book here. It’s not for everyone!

placeInfo/address: Kotikambokka 91200 Sri Lanka
text: Our stay at Jetwing Kaduru Ketha was absolutely wonderful! The hotel’s commitment to eco-friendly practices was truly inspiring, from the sustainable design to the thoughtful green initiatives. A special mention goes to Sanduni and Nadun, who provided us with exceptional service throughout our stay. Their warmth, professionalism, and attention to detail made our experience even more memorable. It’s rare to find such dedicated staff who go above and beyond to ensure guests have the best possible experience. Highly recommend this hotel for its eco-conscious approach and outstanding hospitality.
title: Excellent

placeInfo/address: Kotikambokka 91200 Sri Lanka
text: Situato in una valle di una bellezza fuori dal comune e abitato da simpatici pavoni, l'hotel dispone di una bella piscina dove rilassarsi e, come ovunque in Sri Lanka, il personale è disponibilissimo. Si mangia bene. Le stanze sono un pò troppo spartane (unico neo) ma il bagno esterno è comodissimo.
title: Un paradiso

placeInfo/address: Kotikambokka 91200 Sri Lanka
roomTip: It’s a slightly more remote and peaceful resort away from the hustle and bustle of Ella.
text:
Loved the Jetwing. We had actually checked out of another hotel in central Ella as it was so uncomfortable - this was a breath of fresh air! Its location is a bit further out but for that you wake up to paddy fields and peacocks and the setting is just beautiful! The food was fantastic and they are happy to tailor to your requests. 
It is an eco resort so don’t expect plasma tvs and high speed wifi but do expect charm and hospitality at an amazing hotel. Spa treatment was nice and very relaxing. 
Big credit to the chef and restaurant manager - they really go all out.
title: Beautiful and peaceful resort

placeInfo/addressObj/street1: 01, Radella, Avissawella - Hatton - Nuwara Eliya Hwy,
roomTip: Go by train from Kandy as the journey is wonderful. As for a room with a view.
text: As a family with two teenagers we all loved this place perfect as a chilled out stop in between busy tourist destinations. It’s a beautiful retreat high up in the tea plantations and a lovely relaxing alternative to the bigger hotels. This friendly homely hotel is an original governors mansion restored and themed in the English country style along with white picket fences and wrap around rose gardens. The surrounding hills are a stunning backdrop with a heated infinity pool, there is a mapped walk around the area with view points. There’s even a spa, tennis and badminton court on site! The staff are super friendly and chatty and the chef even designed a menu for us as vegetarians 🥰 The kids enjoyed it but I would say it’s especially romantic for couples with individually designed bedrooms with amazing views.
title: A beautiful and relaxing retreat amongst the tea plantations.

Special mention to Anoj, who made us feel at home, and the manager Fowzi, who ensured we had the best time and even provided us with a special dish on the house. The food, all freshly made, was scrumptious and definitely one of the highlights of our stay. Don’t forget to play badminton and mini-golf; we had so much fun. We’re so glad we chose Langdale and will definitely visit again.

placeInfo/address: 01, Radella, Avissawella - Hatton - Nuwara Eliya Hwy,, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/addressObj/street1: 01, Radella, Avissawella - Hatton - Nuwara Eliya Hwy,
text:
Excellent service, especially by Kevin, Saif, Anoj and Hussain.

Location is very nice with good views. However it's away from the town area.

For breakfast, both local and international selections were good. For lunch or dinner, their local menus are good. International dishes could be better. Dining area can be warm during the day due to sunlight and a lack of wind.

Rooms were good. However there's no air conditioning in this hotel due to the cold highlands weather. During the day it can get warm. Advised to leave the windows open. Water pressure in the shower was bad, and wifi can be unstable.
title: Excellent service, especially by Kevin, Saif, Anoj and Hussain.

placeInfo/address: 01, Radella, Avissawella - Hatton - Nuwara Eliya Hwy,, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/addressObj/street1: 01, Radella, Avissawella - Hatton - Nuwara Eliya Hwy,
text:
This old, but beautifully refurbished, planters bungalow with 13!rooms is a gem of hospitality amongst the tea plantations. Bedrooms  are large and comfortably furnished. Ditto the common areas where one can lose oneself in a book or admire the stunning views. 
The carefully maintained gardens include a heated infinity pool (refreshing but not bracing) and a challenging mini golf course set on hill. 
The food was excellent. 
Staff are polite, attentive and efficient. 
Lack of air conditioning was a minus but balanced by the constant cool breeze through windows that open. Insects didn’t seem to be a problem. 
We stayed one night but could happily have stayed two or three.
title: Heaven in the Hills

text: A charming boutique hotel in a stunning setting. The staff was truly wonderful,  the food was great and the room was large and very comfortable. ownerResponse/text:
Dear Expedition,

Thank you for sharing your experience with us! We're delighted to hear that you spent three enjoyable nights at our hotel during your Sri Lanka holiday.

We're thrilled that you found our staff delightful and accommodating. Ensuring that our guests feel welcomed and well taken care of is our priority, and we're glad that nothing was too much trouble for our team.

We appreciate your feedback regarding the food, and we apologize for any disappointment caused by the eggs Benedict. We'll certainly take note of this and work on improving the dining experience for our guests.

It's wonderful to hear that you found the room spacious and the bed extremely comfortable. Providing a comfortable and relaxing environment for our guests is important to us.

We're glad that you found the laundry service efficient and quick. Our team works hard to ensure that our guests' needs are met promptly.

We apologize for any frustration caused by the availability of items on the bar menu and the number of sunbeds by the pool. We'll take your feedback into consideration as we strive to enhance our services and facilities.

Thank you for choosing to stay with us, and we hope to have the pleasure of welcoming you back for another lovely stay in the future!

Warm regards,
Management - Boutique Collection by Amaya

text:
We spent three nights here on our Sri Lanka holiday. The staff are delightful, nothing is too much trouble. We took the half board option and the food was mostly very good. The eggs Benedict is not to be recommended! 
The room was spacious and the bed extremely comfortable. 
The laundry service operates like greased lightning - no idea how they manage it!

text:
This is a beautiful small hotel set a few minutes from Mirissa.
The staff were very attentive and any requests were quickly  dealt with.  Our room had the most amazing view across the beach to the ocean.  The suite as spacious and the bathroom very well equipped.
The breakfast was well catered.  We ate at the hotel most nights because the menu was a great mix of traditional Sri Lanka cuisine and European and it was excellent.
The whole hotel had tranquil feel and we relaxed into doing nothing at all after a busy previous week traveling throughout Sri Lanka.  If you wanted to do any excursions they can organise this, but we just made it to the spa for a wonderful massage.
This small resort hotel is a gem - we highly recommend a stay here!

placeInfo/address: Matara Road 153 Km Post, Kamburugamuwa, Matara 81750 Sri Lanka
text:
Don't let entrance to this Villa hotel from the main road put off on arrival. It is difficult to describe how wonderful this location is from the beach side of the property. Everything about our stay exceeded our expectations, from the service to the best food we have had in Sri Lanka three weeks into our month long trip.

The beach and villas are stunning and we had a lovely cool breeze blowing off the ocean during our stay, which just added to the experience. The 43m pool that  fronts the villas and overlooks the beach is great if you enjoy swimming. 

There are 4 Villas and guests get to use the communal area at the front of the villa they are staying in, which is a nice touch. With only 14 rooms in total across the 4 Villas, the experience and service feels very personal.

We arrived early in the morning (4:45 am) and were quickly taken to our room without checking in to get settled. The room was large and really well appointed with a lovely comfortable bed with soft, clean bedding. 
When the sun came up we could see what a beautiful location we were in, the ocean signature suite overlooks the pool and then directly beyond that, the ocean. 
Eating a delicious breakfast between the two was wonderful. The staff were all friendly and welcoming, the food was delicious and the ambience perfect. 
Great location for getting around in a tuk tuk to Mirissa beach, Matara or indeed anywhere!
Had such a great experience and would highly recommend.

placeInfo/address: Matara Road 153 Km Post, Kamburugamuwa, Matara 81750 Sri Lanka
text:
We spent our last three nights in Sri Lanka at Sri Sharavi and it’s been heavenly.

The villas are beautiful - we had a signature suite overlooking the pool and beach with the most gorgeous view. It was the ideal size for a family of 4 and so comfortable. 

The beach is untouched and the best we’ve seen in Sri Lanka. The infinity pool is huge and such a lovely setting right on the beach.

Housekeeping and the grounds staff did a fantastic job of keeping everything spotless. And the waiting staff gave faultless service at breakfast, dinner and all day around the pool. Special mention to Suranga and Dimuthu who had such big smiles every day and couldn’t do enough for us during our stay. 

We were also allowed to use the facilities and shared lounge area in our villa all day before our flight, meaning we can spend our last few hours by the pool before heading back to the airport. 

We’ve been to see the turtle sanctuary, whale/dolphin watching on a catamaran, and a trip to the wonderful Galle Fort while staying here. 

We’re very sad to be going home today and hope to come back one day. Thank you to all the team for making our stay so enjoyable!
title: A blissful beach retreat in Sri Lanka

ownerResponse/text:
Wow! Thank you for sharing your detailed review and highlighting so many aspects of your stay at Sri Sharavi. It was such a pleasure having you stay - and we are so glad you enjoyed the Ocean Signature Suite in one of our Beach Villas. 

We pride ourselves on our menu with options for everyone at all times of the day - we are glad you enjoyed your meals, and the dining experience at our Beach Hut Restaurant. 

We wish you all the best with your travels and we hope to see you again one day.
placeInfo/address: Matara Road 153 Km Post, Kamburugamuwa, Matara 81750 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Ocean Signature Suite was an amazing room with a beautiful outlook
text:
This small hotel was perfectly positioned on the beach, and was a calm and restful place save for the occasional traffic noise from the main road, which didn’t really trouble us.

Service was very good, and the staff were always helpful.

The hotel rooms were subdivided across four ‘villas’ that nestled along the pool, beyond which was a grassed area leading to the beach.  We were fortunate to be staying in Ocean Signature Suite overlooking the pool and sea.  

The room itself was large, light and airy, and had a wide balcony area with sun beds and table/chairs, with a delightful view over the pool and the sea (see photos).  The bathroom was also large and airy with a walk-in shower.

We ate most meals outdoors between the pool and the beach, which was superbly tranquil save for the waves crashing on to the sandy beach.  In the evenings the crabs would appear scuttling along the sand while we ate, and if you’re lucky, turtles too.

Food was excellent.

Would thoroughly recommend this beach resort …
title: Delightful beach hotel - total relaxation

text: This was the last stop on our 3-week Sri Lanka trip.  4 perfect nights.  Everything about this hotel hit the right note.  Location was ideal on a beautiful beach.  Entire staff was exceptional and lattentive without hovering.  Accommodations, villa setup, access well-designed.  Exceptional, large salt-water pool.  Excellent restaurant breakfast and dinner menu.  Special shout-out to Dulip for one of the best massages I've ever had-- book him early--he's poplular!  If you can spring for the signature ocean suite, the balcony overlooking the water is worth it, but the superior deluxe suite is also a beautiful, spacious room.  A very special place and a perfect way to end out trip.
title: Book it now!

We’re thrilled that you found your room so comfortable and spacious, with a stunning view over the lagoon. Creating a relaxing and serene atmosphere is so important to us, and we’re so glad you were able to unwind and fully enjoy your surroundings.
Thank you so much for your kind words and for choosing our resort for your stay. We would love to welcome you back with open arms for another unforgettable experience. text: We stayed 3 nights at the resort. It was very peaceful and a great place to relax after touring Anuradhapura. It’s also a great base for exploring the surrounding area. A big thank you to all of the staff who without exception were warm, friendly and responsive to any request. It suited us that they had an la carte dining menu as we are not buffet fans. My partner had Sri Lankan rice & curry one evening which was an amazing fish curry with a selection of vegetarian dishes. We had a beautiful and very spacious room with a great view over the lagoon - thoroughly enjoyed our stay here.

ownerResponse/text:
What a pleasure it was to read your wonderful review Ajbush! 
We are absolutely delighted that your stay at Amaranthe Bay in February was everything you had hoped for—and more. Your kind words truly bring a smile to our faces, as we take great pride in offering a peaceful retreat where our guests can unwind and enjoy the natural beauty of Trincomalee.
It’s fantastic to hear that you loved the serene ambiance of our landscaped gardens and the superb pool, which we’ve carefully designed to create a haven of relaxation. The Mahaweili River Estuary is indeed a breathtaking sight, and we’re so pleased that you had the chance to admire the thriving wildlife from the comfort of your mini suite. The presence of diverse bird species and fish makes it a truly special experience, and we love that you found it just as mesmerizing as we do!
We greatly appreciate your compliments on our modern fixtures and furnishings. Over the years, we have continuously upgraded our facilities to ensure that our guests enjoy both contemporary comfort and an elegant touch of nature. Knowing that you noticed and appreciated these enhancements reassures us that we are on the right path in creating an exceptional guest experience.
Your generous praise for our staff is truly heartwarming. We believe that hospitality goes beyond service—it’s about making genuine connections and ensuring every guest feels at home. We are so glad that our team’s friendliness and attentiveness made your stay even more enjoyable. Your special mention of Kirujan is greatly appreciated, and we will be sure to pass along your kind words to him. He will be thrilled to know that he contributed to making your time by the veranda, terrace, and poolside even more memorable.
It was also our pleasure to arrange your excursions and assist with Tuk-Tuk rides to explore the local attractions. Trincomalee is a place of rich history and stunning natural beauty, and we love helping our guests experience all that it has to offer.
We are especially delighted that you enjoyed our Valentine’s shellfish banquet by the river. Creating magical moments for our guests is something we are passionate about, and knowing that this special evening was a highlight of your stay brings us immense joy.
Thank you once again for taking the time to share such a detailed and thoughtful review. Your words mean so much to our team, and we couldn’t be happier that you had a fantastic time with us. We truly hope to welcome you back in the future for another tranquil escape in Trincomalee!
Gratefully Yours, Amaranthé Bay.
placeInfo/address: No. 101/17 Alles Garden Road, Trincomalee 31000 Sri Lanka
text: We spent a week at Amaranthe Bay Hotel in Trincomalee in February 2025. It is a wonderful hotel with delightful landscaped gardens and a superb pool. We had a mini suite on the ground floor with fabulous views over the Mahaweili River Estuary which was teaming with wildlife such as birds and fish. The hotel fixtures and fittings are very modern and it has obviously been updated since some of the reviews from the last decade. The staff were all incredibly friendly and helpful and the food and service were fabulous. They even went as far as to lay on a special shellfish banquet next to the river on Valentine’s evening. Reception were very helpful at organising excursions or arranging for Tuk-Tuks to visit local attractions. As I have already said all the staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful but we must give a special mention to barman Kirujan who always ensured we were supplied with drinks whether on the veranda, terrace or next to the pool!
title: Tranquility in Trincomalee.

text: Great setting with beautiful rooms in a beautiful tropical garden. The staff goes to incredible lengths to make you feel at home. We got an upgrade for a small additional charge, the room with jacuzzi is very spacious and comfortable. With a beautiful view of the beautiful pool, the tropical garden and the river. The beautiful pool bar and the fantastic restaurant make the stay complete. After a biting incident with a monkey, we received maximum support from the staff who always advised us. They even went with us to the hospital and pharmacy, everyone showed a lot of interest and offered care and help. To ease the pain, we were pampered and spoiled extra. Unbelievable and never experienced before. We already thought it was a great place with very nice and service-oriented staff, but because of the way they supported us, they deserve a big 10+. Thanks again to the management and the entire team.
title: Beautiful setting with an amazing team/ service

text:
So a review for Dickman Resort? it’s easy – It’s Excellent!
I recently stayed 15 nights and enjoyed every minute.
Checked in at 19:30 and the staff took my bags to the room ‘Mango Suite’. I finally made it to my room at 01:00 because I was having a drink and talking with the staff all that time, such a warm welcome and an excellent introduction to Sri Lanka.
The rooms are spacious and clean. The garden and pool and well kept. I cannot think of a bad comment to make. The breakfast, as most people have commented on, is fabulous.
BUT….Its the staff... if you want to stay in a hotel where you are treated like gold, then this is the place to go. 
After just 4 days I posted this on my FB account:
‘I’ve stayed in Intercontinental’s, Hilton, Raddison, Marriott, Best Western along with a lot of other hotels but this has got to be one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in’
The feeling is just the same now, cannot wait to go back.
If any hotels want to learn how to look after guests and make them feel welcome, then visit Dickman Resort.
title: Amazing!

Dear Guests, Thanks for your wonderful review with the start of your stay  with us of your Sri Lanka Round Tour .
You are our last guests before closed with the Covid 19 Lock down and happy  that  Sri Lanka government did great job to stop and controle Infection nationwide so that international guests can soon visit the country again .
