roomTip: Our ground floor pool facing room was perfect for off-season, but would lack privacy and tranquillity at other times.
text:
Dickman Resort was our first stop at the beginning of a two-week private tour of Sri Lanka.
I had chosen it rather by default, as I was not very impressed by the other hotels on offer in Negombo. 
My preference is for small, authentic-style hotels and, despite being a little put off by the name, Dickman Resort seemed to have individual charm and character – particularly the brightly coloured décor. I was not disappointed; in fact, it far exceeded my expectations!
We were warmly greeted by the courteous staff, offering freshly squeezed passion fruit juice whilst we checked-in. Flowers adorned our bed and we were supplied with a generous fruit plate and cold water in refillable glass bottles (a plus point for eco-awareness; but the staff need to remember to offer this at breakfast time, as they automatically brought me water in a plastic bottle, versus filtered in glass). The Standard ground floor room was the only one available when we booked, but it was very quiet on account of few people in the hotel, and perfect for a 24 hour stay, despite its location (it is right next to the reception area and its large windows open directly out onto the pool, so no privacy when the curtains are open). It is tastefully and colourfully decorated, albeit a little tired and quirky in parts (atrium-style shower opens out onto a scruffy rooftop). 
I enjoyed a couple of quiet refreshing swims in the pool, where the friendly pool attendant was eager to provide me with a chaise longue, towel and even a Yoga mat! I also liked the fact that there were no time restrictions, so I could have a 6 o’clock swim before breakfast.
The manager’s recommendation for dinner at a local restaurant was rather disappointing, especially as I had specifically said that I was seeking something typically Sri Lankan. It turned out to be a restaurant for tourists, complete with purple neon lighting and live English golden oldies! To be fair, the Sri Lankan food, on the extensive menu (principally international!), was rather good. In hindsight, being somewhat jet-lagged, we should have followed the manager’s suggestion to order food from the said restaurant, and dine in the hotel’s tranquil tropical garden (particularly as authentic restaurants in Negombo are few and far between – according to TA).
Breakfast at the hotel did not disappoint, being a copious fruit plate (we soon realised that this portion was the norm, reflecting Sri Lankan generosity; so we used to share one between us to avoid the carefully cut fruit being wasted). We politely declined the kind offer of eggs and bread, which we don’t eat in the mornings. Healthy options such as muesli, granola or porridge with yoghurt/coconut milk (offered by similar Sri Lankan hotels), would have been a bonus, as would good coffee versus instant – but, I was seeking authenticity in the land of tea, so you can’t have it all!
I would definitely stay at the Dickman Resort again, and I would certainly recommend it as a good temporary stopover, particularly as it is just 30 minutes from Colombo airport.
title: Great Stopover

text:
I never expected the Dickman Resort to be quite as wonderful as it is. I think it comes down to its “X-Factor”... This was our first trip to gorgeous Sri Lanka and the hotel organised a driver to collect us at the airport. When we arrived at the high terracotta colour walls of the hotel the electric gate opened and a uniformed security guard said hello which was nice as it was way past midnight - then, suddenly, THREE young guys hopped into view and took all our luggage while we did a rapid check-in. The complimentary passion fruit drink was divine and we were shown to our suite; they are larger than the rooms (though all rooms are nice) and we had our luggage placed down and were given a quick guided tour of it from the main bedroom area, into the bathroom and also onto the large terrace with daybed and dining table - actually very impressive as a stand-alone accommodation unit but when you factor in the hotel lobby, the hotel pool, the hotel gardens etc. then you really begin to understand all the excellent reviews.
We slept well on the HUGE bed and woke up at 7 just before breakfast at 07:30 - again, nothing was too much trouble and coffee & more passion fruit juice was whizzed to my table. The staff change shifts at 07:30 which is when the chef, “Cookie”, comes on duty and starts preparing huge platters of lovely ripe tropical fruit; it looked like a fruit-basket as there was so much but at least four of the day shift staff had now introduced themselves to me and EVERYONE wanted to offer more of something nice! Cookie came out of the kitchen and asked what we wanted for breakfast so I had omelettes with bacon and it came with homemade bread and coconut dal. My partner joined me and more pampering fuss was then made of him; when you are in a new country you can often feel cautious or disoriented but Dickman’s staff are simply wonderful - we barely left the hotel whilst we were there for three days/nights as, with the beautiful pool, wooden sun loungers and the attentive service, the time simply flew by.
I have already emailed to discuss returning again next year as our experience was like that of VIPs in a First Class cabin on a large aeroplane - nothing was ignored or forgotten and we felt so special and so happy for the full 72 hours of our stay.
*I’d like to say extra-special thanks (again) to Cookie & Akila for their unfaltering service and time, and to Damth & Treshan for managing such a great hotel environment- a class act and one that we’re keen to revisit in the near future.
title: Exemplary Staff Service, Professional Management and high quality rooms in a beautifully relaxed setting; Nirvana.

Dear Guest,

Thank you for your lovely review! We are absolutely delighted that you had such a wonderful time with us over the Christmas period.

We are thrilled that both the Ocean Suite and Penthouse Suite met your expectations in comfort, cleanliness, and design. Our housekeeping team takes great pride in maintaining high standards, and they’ll be so pleased to hear your kind words.

A special thank you for recognizing Kasun and Mudali—they, along with the rest of our team, are dedicated to making every guest’s experience memorable. We’re so happy they helped make your stay extra special.

placeInfo/address: Matara Road, Habaraduwa 80630 Sri Lanka
text:
We stayed for 6 nights at KK Beach over the Christmas period and had the most wonderful time. The location of the hotel is incredible as it is set right on the beach with breathtaking sea views and perfect for sunset strolls. It also has a lovely pool which is great for swimming and sunbathing if the beach isn’t for you. 

The hotel is very close to close to Galle Fort by Tuk Tuk so you can easily go there as it has great restaurants. It is also located close to Weligama beach (great for surfing), and Mirissa (good shopping and beach). 

We stayed in an Ocean Suite and a Penthouse Suite and both the rooms were fantastic. They were extremely comfortable, immaculately clean, beautifully designed and decorated and we were completely spoilt with cleaning everyday by the housekeeping team as well as an evening tuck down service. 

The staff are all exceptional. They were always very observant, friendly and went out of their way to make our time comfortable and relaxing. Particular shoutouts to Kasun who was extremely attentive and helpful when we were lying by the pool. As well as Mudali who made the best cocktails and was great fun to talk to. The breakfast staff were also wonderful, and everyone is an utter credit to the hotel! 

We can’t recommend Sri Lanka as a holiday destination and especially this hotel enough. And we will definitely return again one day. 

Jack, Lettie, Lucie & Jonathan
title: An incredible Christmas at KK Beach

text: Four nights at the end of a two week tour of the island and we couldn't have picked a better location. The hotel is everything the other reviews say but, we were particularly fortunate to have the place virtually to ourselves. The staff, without exception, couldn't have been more helpful and had that nice balance of being there if you needed but not overly solicitous. Stand out man is Kasun the pool guy; always happy, helpful and meticulous in his attention to detail, from trimming the lawn with scissors to topping up the drinking water just when you needed it. The food is of a very high standard with a nice mixture of Sri Lankan and western options on the menu. We were treated to dinner on night overlooking the beach and had a whole local fish with all the accompaniments and all for less than $30 each. Overall we couldn't have been happier with our stay in Suite 1.

text:
My friend and I were looking for a boutique style beach front resort.  We were so happy we found KK Beach Hotel.  From the moment we arrived, we were met with smiling faces.  The manager and staff were always attentive, kind and willing to ensure we were comfortable and enjoying our time.  The restaurant staff, housekeeping and gardener were always welcoming to my friend and I.  We had purchased some fruits from a market and the manager happily assisted us in cleaning and preparing it for us.  The restaurant staff always helped us it our requests and were always happy to prepare our fruits for us.  We were so thankful for the kindness.  Also, the gardener went above and beyond his way to make the beachfront accessible for my friend and her leg injury.  He filled and carried heavy sandbags to create lower steps onto the sand.  He also helped us prepare our daily lounge chairs closer to the beachfront to enjoy the beautiful views.  Everyone was willing to help us or assist us in anyway.  We really appreciated all of the staff and their kindness.  It was a wonderful welcome for us in Sri Lanka.  The kitchen staff also made my friend a special requested meal of a
Seafood fried rice which she loved so much.  In terms of our accommodation, we loved the large and spacious suite.  We had ample storage for our luggage.  Lots of shelves, wide space to walk, separate bedroom to TV sitting room.  The bed was also very comfortable for us.  The view was fantastic.  We were able to lookout at the beautiful beach.  We also loved our balcony with table and chairs.  One morning I enjoyed writing my postcards with my coffee on the balcony.  The view was beautiful.  We would highly recommend this hotel for the beautiful beach, friendly staff and spacious, clean accommodation.
title: Wonderful Time with excellent hospitality from all staff!

text:
We stayed at KK Beach SriLanka for 8 nights after a hectic visit to india. We stayed in two double rooms which were very comfortable and en-suite. There are also a range of suites available. 
The hotels position is excellent being virtually on the beach and about 30 minutes from Galle. The facilities are very good with the lounge/ bar area and restaurant  opening out on to the  pool area which in turn  provides access to the beach. The only issue I found was getting down the steps to the beach but it was only an issue because I have false hips.
The service provided by staff is second to non. They go the extra mile to make guests stay as pleasant as possible. Literally nothing is too much trouble. It would seem unfair to mention individuals because each staff member that we encountered were superb. From the chap who looks after the pool and grounds keeping guests hydrated whilst they take the sun, right across the team. I  think this is because managers lead by example. The Food is also excellent providing both a set menu which changes frequently and a la carte.
Highly recommended
title: Outstanding

placeInfo/address: Matara Road, Habaraduwa 80630 Sri Lanka
text:
Recently spent 4 days at KK Beach on a return trip to Sri Lanka (having stayed at its sister hotel Kahandakanda in March) . 
The property is slap bang on a beautiful beach straight out of a tropical magazine image .
The rooms are beautifully furnished in blue and white with exceptionally comfortable beds . Lots of nice touches - blue striped kimonos and flip flops to wear down to the pool (which was cleaned daily) and mini bottles of mosquito repellent . 
The staff are all exceptional - very friendly and eager to please. Special mention to Mudali, Patham, Kasun, Sahan, Thisaru, Supun and of course Chef whose meals were a highlight of our stay. Apologies if I’ve missed any of the boys as you were all so nice to us.
title: Contemporary beachside relaxation

ownerResponse/text:

placeInfo/address: Matara Road, Habaraduwa 80630 Sri Lanka
text: One of the best stays, we were checked out after 2 days disappointed of some other place. (Moi Koggala) then we were passing this place just checked wether rooms available, from that moment till check out PATHUM has done an exceptional job, he has very good friendly team over there, rooms are cozy with the beach view and interior designs, food was amazing, we stayed only 1 night as the long weekend is over, we are coming back again for sure, thank you everyone for wonderful hospitality and friendly service, specially needs to remind the life guard who’s working at the poool area, he’s very friendly funny guy. Once again KK you’re the best ❤️
title: KK is the Best 🤩

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest, 

Thank you for writing a review of your stay with us - we are very fortunate to have a team that takes great pride in their work, and for them the ultimate prize is guest satisfaction. 

The Penthouse suites are particularly spacious and offer great relation whilst looking over the Indian Ocean from the balcony. We were very happy to offer you an upgrade and thank you for showing your appreciation.

With best wishes,

George Cooper
placeInfo/address: Matara Road, Habaraduwa 80630 Sri Lanka
text:
Had a fantastic stay in this gorgeous boutique hotel. The service was amazing from the start, everyone could not have been more helpful. We turned up very early and they went out of their way to get a room ready. We were upgraded to a penthouse suite which was huge and so comfortable. 
Every meal we had there was superb from breakfast to dinner. 
The hotel is only 20 min tuk tuk ride to Galle Fort so easy to go in the evening
title: Fantastic Boutique Hotel

placeInfo/address: Matara Road, Habaraduwa 80630 Sri Lanka
roomTip: This hotel is very relaxing and peaceful.
text:
We stayed at KK Beach in June of 2024. Without doubt it was one of most enjoyable and relaxing breaks we've ever had. 
The hotel is beautiful. The decor and furnishing are magnificent. The wonderful colours of the sea, the beach and the hotel gardens, pool and umbrellas all create a gorgeous setting.
Our room was on the top floor with wonderful views of the beach and the sea. The room had lots of light and space and was infused with the most wonderful scents from cinnamon oils.
The hotel food was superb, we enjoyed breakfasts especially the egg hoppers. Dinner was also fabulous with a great choice each night from a set menu along with an a la carte menu.
We ate at KK Beach's sister hotel, Kahanda Kanda one evening, I would definitely recommend this. We were also given a mini tour of the villas and would consider spending a night or two there in future.

A special mention must go the hotel staff all of whom were very welcoming and reflect the quality of both hotels. Kasun was especially helpful with useful information and in showing us the beach area. He also ensured that we always had cold water to drink on our lazy afternoons by the pool.
We plan to return and would recommend this hotel as a great place to relax and enjoy the Galle area.
title: A perfect place to relax.

placeInfo/address: Matara Road, Habaraduwa 80630 Sri Lanka
text:
When we first arrived we thought that we would hear the road as it is on a busy road. However the architecture and sound of the sea meant that we did not have any problems with road noise. It is a beautiful boutique hotel, very well run and well maintained. The room that we were in was not one of the suites but was gorgeous, great size, really well designed and an enormous comfy bed. AC worked really well and the en suite shower room is really trendy. The staff are all wonderful and attentive, we felt like visiting film stars. I would highly recommend this hotel.
We also chose to take up the complementary Tuk Tuk offer to visit their sister hotel The Kahanda Kanda (approx 7km away) for a meal on our second night. An equally beautifully designed boutique hotel in the middle of the countryside. Again we were treated like visiting film stars. The location is very peaceful and immersed in nature. Beautiful gardens and pool. We would certainly also recommend a stay at this hotel. The meal was also really good quality and good value.
title: Paradise by the sea

placeInfo/address: Matara Road, Habaraduwa 80630 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Stay here - a great central spot to explore Galle and the other beaches along the coast.
text:
My partner and I stayed at KK Beach for just over one week. It was the perfect end to a very busy tripped packed with exploring. We stayed in Penthouse II, which was a brilliant room with amazing views of the ocean. The food was excellent throughout - a special mention on the curries and Mahi Mahi 👌. 

The staff at the hotel could not have been more accommodating if they tried, nothing was too much to ask and they were always there to help. I don’t normally do trip advisor reviews but felt compelled to following our stay here as all the staff and the owner, George, deserve the praise. A special mention to Kasun who was non stop on the waters and the sun-beds and also to Mudali, Kasuntha and Nipuna (AM) who were all amazing as well. I have missed some names off here but thanks to all the staff. We will be back to this magical hotel. 

Thank you KK Beach and the entire team. 

Love Seb & Tash.
title: Amazing, Amazing, Amazing

placeInfo/address: Matara Road, Habaraduwa 80630 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Take plenty cash and use tuk tuk
text: We stayed at KK Beach in March 2024. It was an unforgettable experience. We stayed with two boys aged 12 and 10. It’s a perfect spot for anyone in need of full-time tranquil relaxation and peace, ideal for both couples and families. The cuisine was absolutely sensational, with compliments to Chef Lasantha; every dish was delicious, with an explosion of tastes and textures! Days by the pool were serene, with Kasun looking after guests. He provided 100 percent attention, smiles, and care, making us feel totally relaxed and well looked after. Lovely cocktails were served by the barman. The entire staff was friendly and caring. We enjoyed a full seafood platter on our balcony, which offered an amazing view of the ocean. The platter was well organized by Pathum, the head of food and beverage, who also served as an administrator. He was very helpful during our stay, ensuring our holiday was spotless . During swim in the ocean where currents can be strong Kasun made sure we are safe and guided us through it . We stayed in penthouse where rooms are big and spacious . Room were kept very clean during our stay . Beds are super comfortable. Mudali made our after dinner drinks the most enjoyable . Nice and well balanced cocktails . Beautiful hotel as seen on the pictures with the most hospitable and professional staff .
title: Paradise

Beautiful boutique hotel. The pool and beach are stunning. It was very quiet when we went. Super soft bedding too! We have to say that Kasun who looks after the gardens and pool area really made the trip super special. Kind, helpful and very caring. When we were swimming in the seas which can be quite rough he always kept an eye out and when relaxing by the pool he always ensured we had a cool glass of water and comfy sunbed. Thank you Kasun. 

There was also a couple of the bar team who made our cappuccinos exactly as we like them . 

Great place for our honeymoon, thank you

Dear Nancy

Thank you for taking the time to write a review of your stay at KK Beach, and delighted that you enjoyed yoursleves.  We are rather lucky that the beach, which is roughly 2km long,  is usually pretty empty - what more could you ask for?
Thank you again for coming to stay.

Best wishes,

placeInfo/address: Matara Road, Habaraduwa 80630 Sri Lanka
text: Stayed 5 nights here after touring SL for 12 days.  Fabulous boutique hotel. Only 10 rooms. We had penthouse suite VI which was massive with massive balcony with the best views.  Great pool with plenty of sun beds. Attentive pool attendant, in fact all the staff were great. Shout out to Mudali who always went above and beyond.  Quite a secluded property with not much around but there was always car or tuk tuk at hand to drive you to Galle or nearby places for lunch or dinner. We visited a few beaches but none as stunning as our one.
title: Piece of heaven!

placeInfo/address: Matara Road, Habaraduwa 80630 Sri Lanka
text:
KK beach was a fitting end to a superb holiday in Sri Lanka.
This is an amazing hotel in a beautiful location on the Indian Ocean, made even better by the staff in the hotel who couldn’t do enough for us , especially Kasun at the pool and in the beach.
We were lucky to stay in a penthouse suite, one if the largest rooms we’ve ever stayed in and waking up to a view and sounds of the ocean will never be forgotten.
The food was superb and the executive chef (sorry I didn’t catch his name)  even gave us an impromptu cooking lesson one morning !
Overall we couldn’t have asked for anything better to finish our holiday.
Thank you to all of the team at KK Beach.
title: Stunning hotel in a beautiful location

ownerResponse/text:

George Cooper
placeInfo/address: Matara Road, Habaraduwa 80630 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Try to go for penthouse room or bigger if you can
text:
This is without question one of the finest hotels I have ever stayed in
We came for5 nights at the end of a tiring journey round Sri Lanka and we were hoping for rest and relaxation and this hotel exceeds all expectation
We had a penthouse room which was huge and comfortable, the bathroom was enormous
Everything you could need was provided and the room was kept beautifully clean
The grounds whilst small are perfect for this 10 room hotel,loads of beds by the pool,sun terrace gardens and lovely swimming pool and an amazingly attentive pool attendant who cannot do enough for everyone. Loads of fresh good quality pool towels and just 3 steps down to the most beautiful beach, but beware the sea can be rough here so listen to advice regarding swimming safely
The food is exceptional and can be modified easily to suit all tastes and dietary needs and the open  front restaurant is comfortable with delightful service by all staff.
In conclusion you would have to be very critical not to love this hotel
Thank you all for a wonderful stay.
title: A little spot in paradise

placeInfo/address: Lane 3, Field View, Baddegama Road, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka
text:
This place was recommended and it didn't disappoint. Firstly the views are stunning, therefore a visit during the day is a must, it is in a quiet location, a little out of the way but easy to get to by tuk tuk, you can use the pool and sunbeds if you are eating and drinking there.  We went for an evening meal, I have the shepherds pie, the portion was very generous, it was made with lamb mince and was absolutely delicious, my husband had fish and chips (real chips) again the portion was large also very tasty. We returned the next day for lunch, the food was just as nice as the evening before. I can also recommend the sizzlers which again come with real chips, all at very reasonable prices.  The menu has more choice than all of the restaurants  we have been in in Hikkaduwa. The staff are very attentive and always smiling,  the hotel is very clean.  A great place if you want to relax. 
We would definitely recommend.
title: EXCELLENT FOOD IN A BEAUTIFUL SETTING

placeInfo/address: Lane 3, Field View, Baddegama Road, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka
text:
Spent many a happy evening dining at the Asian Jewel, as others have pointed out there is no competition when it comes to the food served at the Asian Jewel. Everything is of excellent quality, large portions and ridiculously good value for money. All salads are fresh and well presented. 

Staff are very attentive and pleasant.

Short ride in a tuk tuk to get you there, try and get there early enough to see the Eagles soaring over the Lagoon (booking is recommended).

Owner Dale is a mine of information regarding Hikkaduwa and Sri Lanka in general.
title: Excellent dining experience.

placeInfo/address: Lane 3, Field View, Baddegama Road, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka
text:
This place is a little slice of relaxed, stunningly beautiful paradise.
Just five minutes in a tuk tuk from the beaches, run by a friendly, helpful Englishman, Asian Gem is a small, peaceful getaway from the party vibe of the Hikkaduwa beaches.
There's a lovely swimming pool to relax in or by, gorgeous terraces with loungers surrounding and an out door restaurant area, all over looking the spectacular surrounding lagoons and tropical  jungle.
The food is spectacular and s far cry from the samyness of much of the beachfront grub - fancy a cracking steak, grab one here!
The place is full of nice little unique touches in the decor, the staff are friendly, attentive and very well trained by Dale, the owner.
I only got to see one of the rooms, as it was, unsurprisingly, fully booked on the dates I was there, bit it was exactly what you'd expect from a hotel calling itself 'boutique': sparklingly clean and tastefully luxurious with incredible views over the jungle and lagoons.
Can't wait to stay here next time I visit Hikka...
title: A hidden gem by tropical lagoons...

placeInfo/address: Lane 3, Field View, Baddegama Road, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka
text:
We saw this place in some blogger’s video because of food and decided to come. It’s a little bit out of Hikkaduwa center but it's definitely worth to visit. We took local curry selection and it was best local food during all our trip in Srilanka. Be patient to wait up to 1 h but you can be sure the food will be absolutely fresh cooked. While waiting, we enjoyed beautiful and tidy surroundings of garden. Extremely helpful and polite host even offered us to use their swimming pool and showed oldie music box. Fantastic variety of flavors, balance of spices and outstanding service. Special attention to every customer’s taste. This is a place for food gourmets! We really recommend this restaurant for everyone who wants to try local food in the highest level.
We hope the darkest times of covid pandemic are behind and your hotel and restaurant would be full of visitors. We wish you all the best! We hope to come back next year.
title: Best food in Hikkaduwa

placeInfo/address: Lane 3, Field View, Baddegama Road, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka
text: The best food we found in Hikkaduwa, everything we tried was amazing, fresh and delicious. No traffic noise and a short drive from Hikkaduwa town. Variety of dishes offered, book or call in advanced to check out unique menu options for the day. We had both western and Sri Lankan style items, delicious cocktails, drinks and desserts.
title: Eat here!

placeInfo/address: Lane 3, Field View, Baddegama Road, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka
text:
We stayed here for 9 days in Feb. The hotel is tucked away down a bumpy little backroad, but dont let that put you off, because once your through the gates you can start to relax. Check in was quick and easy and we were shown to our room which was large and airy and overlooked a beautiful nature reserve lake. The rooms are simply furnished but cover all your basic needs, fridge aircon, tv safe. There was shampoo, conditioner and body lotion in big ceramic dispensers which was a nice eco change from all the little plastic bottles. The rooms were always kept nice and clean and towels,sheets replaced at your wishes. The pool is wonderful and we spent lots of time there, it was so quiet and relaxing and they give you a bell to ring should you require anything.
The food was excellent, we ate there every night, sri lankan curry, fish and chips, stroganoff, steak, noodles, you name it, each one was spot on.
The staff were always friendly, helpful and accomodating, always happy to help organise trips etc.
If i had to give a negative our bathroom got very hot at night, but we just kept the door shut and the aircon on.
I wouldnt hesitate to recommend this to anyone and thanks again Asian Jewel for a great time.
title: Peaceful relaxing stay

placeInfo/address: Lane 3, Field View, Baddegama Road, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka
text:
I had the most amazing trip to Sri Lanka (February 2020). The island really does have so much to offer - nature, amazing beaches and countryside, beautiful wildlife, and, the most incredibly interesting historical and religious sites,

I stayed at the Asian Jewel which is situated next to a beautiful lake and only a short ride by tuk tuk to the beach.  Everything, at the Asian Jewel was wonderful the gardens and pool area are stunning, and the environment is tranquil.  All staff, from the room cleaning staff, the waiting staff and manager were so obliging and hospitable.  All meals were great and there was a good variety of dishes on the menu. I strongly recommend for you to eat here as it had the best meals in Hikkaduwa. 
The tuk tuk driver, who is in-house was also very hands-on to ensure that we had a wonderful stay. Thank you everyone at Asian Jewel for making our stay a very happy one!
title: Beautiful location with great service and food

placeInfo/address: Lane 3, Field View, Baddegama Road, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Luxury room has a lovely four poster bed and large bath. Family room has a 2nd twin bedroom.
text:
Third stay at the Asian Jewel and again no complaints whatsoever. From the welcome on arrival to the check out it was a superb stay. 

The hotel is located a short tuk tuk ride from the beach. It is situated next to an idyllic lagoon where you can watch much wildlife. The hotel has a well maintained swimming pool and sun loungers for each guest laid out first thing in the morning for you. 

The hotel can take care of your airport transfers and excursions if you wish. 

The hotel also has the best restaurant in Hikkaduwa where you eat breakfast. It also has an extensive lunch and dinner menu. 

The rooms themselves are very comfortable. Each room has air conditioning and a very effective ceiling fan. Plenty of wardrobe space, a free safe and a good amount of power sockets/USB sockets. There is also a great balcony to enjoy a drink in the sun or a nightcap on an evening. 

Rooms are maintained each day to a high standard. 

I highly recommend this hotel for your stay in Hikkaduwa.
title: Amazing Hotel in Hikkaduwa.

placeInfo/address: Lane 3, Field View, Baddegama Road, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka
text:
We stayed for three days at Asian Jewel hotel and had an amazing experience.The staff were so friendly and attentive.
Room was very clean and comfortable.had nice lake view with beautiful balcony. The garden and pool area was very lovely.
Service was excellent .i highly recommend this place and we"ll be back soon.thanks for all staff.
title: Great place for holiday

placeInfo/address: Lane 3, Field View, Baddegama Road, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka
text:
We have enjoyed another great holiday at the Asian Jewel.The staff at the hotel are what makes it so special to us.We had ten nights at the hotel this year and can honestly say that we have never been looked after better anywhere in the world than we were at the Asian Jewel.
As well as the hotel feeling like a home from home the food that is served up in the restaurant is second to none,and even though we had a fussy vegetarian with us,who doesn’t like any spice in her food,we were all highly delighted with everything that was served up to us.In fact because the food was so good we decided to eat at the hotel every night.The choice on the menu was so good that we eat something different every night and enjoyed every single meal.
The pool area is kept immaculately and there is always a sun bed and umbrella available when you need one.
The bedrooms are spacious and the views from the balconies of Lily and Jasmine are wonderful.If you are a bird watcher you can sit on your balcony for hours and the birds come to you,whilst overlooking a beautiful lake.
Overall Dale we would like to thank you and your wonderful staff for another great holiday and all being well we will see you again next year.
title: Thanks again Dale and the team

placeInfo/address: Lane 3, Field View, Baddegama Road, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka
text: Very calm and relaxing atmosphere. Very good choice on the menu. The food is top class and at a good price too. You won't be disappointed. Leave the beach and go to the  jungle side. Can't judge the hotel as we didn't stay here but it seems nice from the outside.
title: Probably best food in hikkaduwa.

placeInfo/address: Lane 3, Field View, Baddegama Road, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Lily or Jasmine best lake views for bird watching
text:
We've eaten at Asian Jewel a number of times over the years, but this was first time staying here, and what's fabulous stay we had.  Gorgeous surroundings, lovely pool area, quiet, serene and peaceful. Lovely room overlooking the lake - try for Lily or Jasmine rooms, best views.  All staff are friendly and helpful.  Dale the owner is friendly and checks all runs smoothly.  A real hidden gem.  
Even if you're not staying at the hotel do make the effort and get a tuk tuk from hikkaduwa for lunch or dinner, a lovely experience. A bit more than you'd pay on the beach but so worth it.
title: A few days, I wish it had been more!

placeInfo/address: Lane 3, Field View, Baddegama Road, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka
text: We stayed for 16 days over Christmas and New year and had an amazing time. The staff were so friendly and attentive and couldn't do enough for you. The food was superb so we ate there every night. Our room which overlooked the lagoon with a balcony was spacious and cleaned daily. The garden and pool was lovely. I would definitely recommend the Asian Jewell if you want a fabulous holiday in beautiful Sri Lanka.
title: Excellent hotel and food

text:
Bentota is situated at an ideal location for a weekend away from Colombo. We've tried most hotels in the area. And this was our second visit to this property. 

Highlights of the property - it's a very large and beautiful property designed by the famous architect Gefforey Bawa. There are also some lovely pieces of art forming part of the interior design. It is a also situated in a unique location with the sea on one side and the Bentara river on the other side. 

There are two wings. We've stayed in both. One wing is a little far away from the restaurants, reception, gym, kids play area etc. We booked a terrace room and were later upgraded to a luxury sea front room. But we could barely see the sea from our room in the first floor (didn't mind though since this was a free upgrade). This is because there is actually a small lane and a tree cover between the property and the public beach. The second floor probably gives better views. But the room was lovely! It was very spacious with a large balcony as well and had all the luxuries. 

They have a sizeable pool. The beach is public (You have to a cross a small lane to get to the beach) but clean. And the hotel does provide some beach chairs and umbrellas. 

They have a fabulous breakfast with a massive spread!!!! (It was actually the highlight of the visit 😉) For lunch, we went a la carte at their sea food restaurant. If I recall correctly, the extensive sea food menu was aviable only for dinner but they had their normal menu and what we got was quite exceptional. 

The dinner was not as fabulous as breakfast (especially the salads and desserts) but still quite good. One pet peeve was that the main restaurant had only a small area which was air conditioned. The rest of the area didn't even have fans. It was extremely humid the day we visited and coupled with the heat from all the cooking, we were sweating buckets, so much so that we kept an alarm on our second day and came very early for breakfast to get a spot in the air-conditioned section. 😀

Both breakfast and dinner had an extensive spread of local, Indian, East Asian and Western dishes. The staff weren't particularly friendly but were quite efficient except for a minor hassel related to our booking.

All in all, highly recommended if you are just looking to laze around (i.e. eat, sleep, swim) in comfort. [P.s they do offer painting classes, yoga, third party managed excursions in the river if you are looking for more energetic options.]
title: Ideal getaway

The pools are lovely, and the pool bar is cool. The team there is friendly, attentive, and they even remembered our previous orders, which made us feel genuinely welcomed.
The buffet for both breakfast and dinner were excellent, offering a wide variety of tasty dishes with something for everyone. The setting, overlooking the lake, made the dining experience even more enjoyable. The selection covers most cuisines, so there's always something new and delicious to try.
Overall, this hotel stands out for its thoughtful service, beautiful setting, and exceptional amenities. We would gladly return and highly recommend it!

roomTip: Best time for using the pool is probably late morning to midday.
text:
I don't often give 5 stars to a hotel but Simpson's deserves it.  The tuktuk ride up from Kandy station was up a steep, winding road, an adventure in itself.  The staff couldn't have been more helpful and friendly.  They upgraded me to a luxurious room in the bungalow, extremely peaceful with only the sound of birdsong for company.  Just across the lawn, the infinity pool provided wonderful sunsets.  And being 1,300 metres up, the climate was fresher than on the coast. 

The restaurant served excellent food, usually on a buffet basis.  Curry for breakfast every day!  On one afternoon they organised a nature trail, about an hour and a half around woodland and tea plantations.  Generally a very satisfying stay, a million miles from the teeming city.
title: Forest, hills

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for your heartwarming review! We are truly delighted that your stay at Simpson’s felt like a little piece of heaven. It’s wonderful to hear that you enjoyed the comfort of your room, the breathtaking views from the infinity pool, and the exceptional service from our dedicated team.

We’re especially pleased that our restaurant experience, from the à la carte dining to the early breakfast service, added to your holiday enjoyment. Your kind words about Wasantha, Prabudda, Chamara, and Namal mean a lot, and we will be sure to share your appreciation with them.

We would love to welcome you back for another memorable stay in the future. Until then, safe travels and warm wishes!

Best regards
placeInfo/address: Elkaduwa Road Meenawatte Estate, Kandy, Wattegama 20000 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: Simpson's Forest - Luxury Boutique Resort & Spa
roomTip: Don’t be afraid to make a request. The staff really want to make your stay great.
text:
We stayed two nights at Simpson’s as part of a touring holiday and felt very fortunate that we had been booked in there. I was sorry to leave. Our room (106) was well-appointed. Most importantly the bed and pillows were very comfortable, so we had a good sleep and woke refreshed for the sightseeing day ahead. One of my tests for a good hotel is the sleeping comfort. 
The infinity pool is in an elevated location, reached by 5 min walk up a steepish driveway. We managed fine, despite creaky joints, but there is a golf buggy service if you want. The view from the pool area across to distant hills is gorgeous. Don’t miss the sunsets up there.
All the staff, be they Reception, housekeeping, pool service or restaurant were genuinely kind and professional. Nothing was too much trouble. 
There was a wide range of good quality food at the restaurant. We ate à la carte one night and it was lovely to be served at the table. Most tables are inside with panoramic window views. There are a few on the terrace outside, we reserved one on our second night as al fresco dining is part of our holiday enjoyment. The twinkling fireflies in the trees were an added bonus. 
We had early starts on our sightseeing programme and the hotel willingly opened the breakfast service early for our convenience. 
I would like to close with a mention of the restaurant team members who all were so efficient and professional. It would be unfair to mention just one name. They were a great team. I hope I will be forgiven for any misspelling- Wasantha, Prabudda, Chamara and Namal. I would certainly go back to Simpson’s.
title: A little piece of Heaven

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for sharing your feedback. We appreciate your honesty and understand that your experience didn’t quite match up with your expectations based on other reviews. It’s great to hear that the location near the pool and gym worked well for you, and we appreciate your perspective on the food.

Just to highlight, we do offer an à la carte menu for guests who prefer a wider variety of dishes. Additionally, for those looking to enjoy a more authentic Sri Lankan experience, we’re happy to serve traditional Sri Lankan rice and curry upon request.

We also noticed that you may have missed our nature trekking experience, which is a unique opportunity to explore the beautiful surroundings and immerse yourself in the natural beauty of the area. We think it’s one of the highlights of staying with us, and we'd love for future guests to give it a try.

We’re sorry to hear that the food didn’t fully meet your expectations, and we’ll continue to work on improving our offerings. Thanks again for your feedback.

Warm regards
placeInfo/address: Elkaduwa Road Meenawatte Estate, Kandy, Wattegama 20000 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: Simpson's Forest - Luxury Boutique Resort & Spa
text:
I don’t really know how to score this place, looking at other reviews it seems it’s amazing.

For us it was OK.  Our upgraded room was OK, nothing special, a wee bit old and tired, the upside is we were right by the pool and gym, which if you are in the main hotel was a bit of an uphill hike.

The food was a buffet, you could order from the menu, but that was mostly western and most of the side dishes were lifted straight from the buffet.  The food available was a mish mash of roast chicken, vegetables, pasta, salads and a small cooking section that offered some fried fish or meat, neither of these were anything special.  There was a lot to go at, but all was a bit meh.

I fully accept I’m out of step here with the other reviews, but I am only saying as we saw it, we had much better food and room in our £30 home stay called Shay Mango, visit them if you want a true Sri Lankan experience with amazing food and accommodation.
title: It was OK, just

text:
Great hotel!
My family and I spent 5 days here and we have had a blast!
1. The location is unique. Placed 20 meters from the Indian Ocean this hotel offers the most beauty sunrise.
2. The saltwater pool is also fantastic and - correct me if I’m wrong- one of the longest in the country?
3. The staff - from reception to cleaning to pool boys to waiters - are extremely friendly and will to anything to satisfy you.

We will definitely be back!
title: Wonderful hotel

ownerResponse/text:
Thank you Marian for sharing your review, and it was a pleasure having you all stay at Sri Sharavi recently.

As you booked through a travel agent, and we had no direct contact before your arrival, our manager was very pleased to be able to welcome you and introduce you to all that Sri Sharavi has to offer as a small boutique property where the level of personalised service, and our quiet location, make a difference when compared to bigger properties. 

We pride ourselves on our a la carte menu - which means that each meal is prepared freshly and to order, and it also eliminates unnecessary food waste.

Our pool is a saltwater pool - water from the ocean is pumped into the system, and then fresh water is used to stabilise it. This is a specialised process to ensure that the water is clean and enjoyable for everyone. A saltwater pool is different than swimming in the sea, and also much more pleasant than swimming in a pool filled with harsh chlorine and chemicals. 

Thank you and safe travels
placeInfo/address: Matara Road 153 Km Post, Kamburugamuwa, Matara 81750 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Do not expect a place with crowd.

A place for the one want to have silence.
title: A good place for the one, want to have silence.

text:
Sharavi Mirissa is a hidden gem in Sri Lanka, albeit on the pricier side. With only 14 rooms, the intimate atmosphere ensures personalized service. The staff here are always ready to assist, making your stay feel like a home away from home.

Ideal for families with small kids, the pool area boasts two separate pools for children. The beach on the right side offers a less turbulent sea, perfect for a cautious swim. For those seeking private relaxation, look no further. Sharavi Mirissa stands out as a unique, higher-budget option in the area, making it the top choice for a special getaway in Mirissa.

Special thanks to madu, dimuthu, gayan, suranga, lahiru .

We hope to see you all soon .
title: Expensive for Srilanka but worth it !

placeInfo/address: Matara Road 153 Km Post, Kamburugamuwa, Matara 81750 Sri Lanka
text: My wife and I had a family holiday with our son and daughter aged 22 and 20 years in Mirissa and we choose this venue to take up two rooms at one of the Beach Villas. It was a wonderful setting right from the early evening that we arrived. A very spacious and tastefully furnished common area. A nice patio setting for yoga with Beach chairs and decks overlooking a pristine private beach. Given the season, we were lucky to have the Beach Villa hotel mostly to ourselves apart from a couple of guests. We enjoyed the saltwater pool and walked on the private beach the next morning. The staff went out of the way to cater to our vegetarian food requirements. The location of the beach villas made it easy for us to visit Mirissa Public Beach, Coconut Tree Hill and a few other tourists spots in the area. The rooms were wonderfully furnished with fully equipped spacious bathrooms. One got a feeling of luxury stay throughout. We also tried the massage service at the Spa of the property. And a therapist externally visited to provide the massage service. Overall, a fantastic and relaxing stay that was fully to our expectations.
title: One of the best Beach Villa experiences ever!

placeInfo/address: Matara Road 153 Km Post, Kamburugamuwa, Matara 81750 Sri Lanka
text: Sri Sharavi is an unexpected beauty just off the Galle Road in Mirissa. As soon as you step in you enter a new world, a peaceful space. The impressive view of the beach and ocean becomes increasingly visible as you step further. Really beautiful. Originally the 4 villas were meant to house families, with each vila having a mix of suites and double rooms. Very spacious, very luxurious, with like a private oceanfront living room with sitting area, sofas, large table for those who need to some work, and then the round dining table almost at the edge of the 40 meter swimming pool. We had an ocean facing suite which is more like a spacious apartment on the second floor, and 1 double bedroom on the ground floor. Food is delicious, staff is discreet and helpful, and Kenny the manager always available to assist and provide guidance. We live in Sri Lanka and have stayed in other places in Mirissa, but this is the best, at the higher end of course.
title: Beautiful views and very spacious suites and rooms

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Nicole

Thank you for writing such a flattering and effusive email, and of course, I am delighted that you enjoyed your stay so much.

We are very fortunate to have staff who genuinely wish to please the guests and make it super enjoyable.

Thank you for coming to stay at KK Beach, and hope that you may return one day in the future.

George Cooper
placeInfo/address: Matara Road, Habaraduwa 80630 Sri Lanka
text:
KK Beach quickly became our standout accommodation in Sri Lanka, earning its place among our favorites. The studio room, boasting exceptional views of the beach and ocean, was nothing short of amazing. The hotel's facilities, from the amenities to the ambiance, were of high quality, enhancing our overall experience.

While the food was undeniably delicious, some dishes leaned towards the pricier side compared to other spots in Sri Lanka. Nevertheless, the culinary offerings, including some of our favorites, contributed positively to our stay. The strategic location near Galle made it easily accessible, providing the option for a convenient meal out.

A substantial shout-out is due to the staff and management, particularly Pathum, Kasuntha, and Nipuna (and many others whose names we did not write down). 

However, the real star of our KK Beach experience was Kasun, whose attentive and enthusiastic care truly stood out. He seemed to anticipate our needs, ensuring we never had to ask for more water or a towel – a level of service that made our stay exceptionally comfortable.

In gratitude to the entire team at KK Beach, we extend a big thank you for making our stay so special. Their collective efforts, and particularly Kasun's, left an indelible mark on our experience. For those seeking a beachfront haven with exceptional service, KK Beach comes highly recommended.
title: Seaside Bliss: Exceptional Views, Delicious Cuisine, and Outstanding Service at KK Beach

Had a deep cut in my foot on the pool side tile. Slippery pebbles next to the tile is a bad combination. An accident,  no one's fault. Just a word of warning to be careful. But staff was very helpful in getting bandage etc.

Well what a beautiful hotel, just stunning in it's location.

Again the people of Sri Lanka continue to delight with their warmth and their generosity of spirit, you really can't fault the attention to detail the staff give you on every opportunity.

The best food of the entire trip, the tuna I had was so well cooked...as was all the dishes prepared for us by the kitchen the chefs here have a real talent.

Someone from the hotel escorted us to the beach, letting us know where we could swim and where we couldn’t, always looking out for us, he never left our side, he also set us up with a couple of beds by the ocean.
We came on our honeymoon and we can say all the staff is excellent and we recommend this place as a must.

placeInfo/address: Matara Road, Habaraduwa 80630 Sri Lanka
text:
A beautiful beach front property with excellent sunset views in the Winter time! We really enjoyed the sunset while soaking our feet in the calm waves. Sunset is the best time to take a stroll on the beach.

This boutique hotel has a small yet beautiful garden with palm trees.. it’s ideal to sunbath or just relax under these palm trees while sipping cocktails!

The pool is great but it’s a little deep. Recommend to take a dip only if you can swim or if you’re more than 5.5ft tall. 

Rooms are modern, spacious yet very cozy. You can have your morning coffee while watching over the garden and the beach.

Food is fantastic. Large portions but very tasty! 

Staff was very friendly and helpful. Don’t think twice to book this place. You’ll be amazed!
title: What we loved at KK BEACH

placeInfo/address: Matara Road, Habaraduwa 80630 Sri Lanka
text: KK Beach was one of six places we stayed in during our recent holiday travel in SL. It is undoubtedly the best of all. The place is small and homely with excellent service. We had breakfast and dinner for three nights there and the food was the best. Chef paid attention to what we liked and how we liked them and surprised us at each meal. Kasun the gardener looked after us every time we ventured out to sea.  He was discreet so we never felt intrusive. We loved the rooms, ours was a suite with french doors opening to a stunning view of the beach. We woke up to the sound of sea everyday and we will be back. Thank you for a wonderful experience.
title: Best boutique hotel in the South

The food here is amazing, Our boy is very fussy how he likes his food and the chief here has totally for filled his picky needs concerning food, we have ate here everyday practically trying nearly everything on the menu and we can not fault the meals that we’ve eaten and service that has come with it, We will be definitely booking again next year, we have really enjoyed our stay here.

placeInfo/address: Lane 3, Field View, Baddegama Road, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka
text:
We are just back from a fantastic two week holiday at Asian Jewel which we have visited several times over the past 15 years.

Once again the hotel lived up to all our expectations.  You will love it as well if you like the following:

A small hotel, reasonably priced, with a personal touch where you are truly spoilt.
A peaceful environment, with plenty of birdlife, etc.
A small, clean, pool which you often have to yourselves.
Comfortable sunbeds, set up to your liking. Drinks and food served to your sunbed if you wish.
Next to a lagoon, five minutes from the beach by tuktuk at a cost of £1
Good food, both western and Sri Lankan. Chosen from a menu and served to your table.
Friendly staff who cannot do enough for guests.

Sri Lanka is a beautiful country, with friendly people, beautiful beaches, incredible history and spectacular wildlife. VISIT!!!

Thank you Dale and all your staff for a fantastic holiday - we will be back!
title: Fantastic!

placeInfo/address: Lane 3, Field View, Baddegama Road, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka
text: The food and the service is amazing! Very friendly staff and make you feel like you are part of the family. The food is made fresh and is delicious!! Would highly recommend to anyone visiting the local area :)

It was a truly memorable stay at Asian Jewel Boutique Hotel. We went on a family trip and stayed one night there. The staff was so nice and polite. They were always helpful. We stayed in Kingfisher room which was very clean and had a private balcony with a great view of the nearby lake. Room was spacious enough. The neighborhood was calm and quiet. They had a little but clean pool at the front. The food was great and we got to know that their restaurant is much popular for nice food.

  It would have been great if there was a shower cubicle in the bath and coupe of arm chairs in the room, but these are just minor points when you consider the great service provided by the hotel and its staff.

title: Great food and service

placeInfo/address: Lane 3, Field View, Baddegama Road, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka
text: We had a wonderful meal at Asian Jewel and my partner said his was the best curry he had during our visit to Sri Lanka. We took The small tuk tuk ride on the reviews from others on trip advisor and I'm glad we did. The service was Excellent, very efficient, polite and friendly. Would highly recommend.
title: Excellent service

placeInfo/address: Lane 3, Field View, Baddegama Road, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka
text: We booked 3 nights initially and then extended to 5 nights. We were in Peacock room which was a good size and had a balcony. There was satellite tv, a kettle, in room safe and hair dryer. What really makes this hotel is the staff who are all very friendly and helpful. The restaurant is excellent, we had breakfast included in the room rate which was freshly cooked every morning and we ate dinner here every night. They serve a lot of non-residents in the restaurant and considering the hotel is a little out of town that shows how good the food was. It is easy to get a tuk tuk to the town and beach. The pool is very good and the views over the lagoon are beautiful. I would definitely recommend staying at Asian Jewel.
title: Very Good

placeInfo/address: Lane 3, Field View, Baddegama Road, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka
text: Secreted at the end of a rocking tuk tuk ride, you are greeted with a truly boutique experience. The menu is the most extensive of any restaurant in over 30 days of touring Sri Lanka. Service was slow at first but quickly shifted gears to very good. The servings were large and the presentation and flavours were excellent. Don’t miss this restaurant. 😉
title: A Gem of an experience ... never mind the setting

placeInfo/address: Lane 3, Field View, Baddegama Road, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka
text: We came here on our last night for dinner as the reviews are brilliant. We took a tuk tuk from the main street and 10 mins later we arrived. We didn’t want to sit at the side of the river due to the bugs but its not a problem if you don’t mind the odd bug. We has Sri Lanka boneless chicken curry, battered prawns (amazing!) and the cottage pie ( a little home comfort : ) we must say this was the best meal we had in Sri Lanka as too many places cater for ‘westerners’ serving toasties, burgers, crispy chicken etc. We didn’t travel all that way to not eat their food but this place made the best curry of our whole trip. It did take a while to come but it has a nice chilled atmosphere. Sorry no photos but please try this place out!
title: Lovely homemade food : )

placeInfo/address: Lane 3, Field View, Baddegama Road, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka
text: We had an amazing time in Hikkaduwa and this hotel definitely added to the experience. The hotel was so accommodating, the food was amazing, the rooms are lovely and we really enjoyed the pool table! The owner was very hospitable and we were sad to leave. We would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Hikkaduwa- we decided to walk to the beach but would recommend a Tuk Tuk which costs only a couple of £s. A massive thank you for making out holiday a memorable one.
title: A little slice of paradise

placeInfo/address: Lane 3, Field View, Baddegama Road, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka
text: Stayed in Jasmine room, overlooking the lake. Good size room with balcony and good size bathroom. Large bed. Stayed 5 nights. Staff attentive. Good size swimming pool with sunbeds. Breakfasts very good and filling. Excellent lunch and dinner menu with a large choice of local and international dishes.
title: Great hotel overlooking lake.

placeInfo/address: Lane 3, Field View, Baddegama Road, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka
text: We stayed here for 4 nights, it is about 20 minutes from the main town and next to the lake. This is quieter and very beautiful. The hotel has a lovely garden and pool, breakfast and meals are served on a veranda which is very nice. A very good breakfast and dinner menu. Excellent food, we had a Sri Lankan curry one evening very well presented, tasty and excellent value.  The downside for our stay was the bed mattresses were so hard that we couldn’t sleep and our joints and backs hurt, there were no mattress toppers and the blanket put under the sheet did little to help. A mattress topper would be really good for people who would like/need a softer mattress.
title: Part of Sri Lanka holiday
